docs.title: Car Insurance
docs.text:
Biz Car Insurance ID 157 Insurance purchase confirmation

The insurance business is located in Las Venturas city, near CNN LV.

This business is responsible for taxing personal vehicle owners for paying insurance policies.

From the amount paid for insurance, the business will receive 10% up to a profit of $100,000 in one day, after which it will drop to 5%.

docs.title: Characteristics
docs.text:
• Any personal vehicle needs at least one active insurance to be driven.
  • To buy insurance for a personal vehicle you must be inside that vehicle and use the /buyinsurance command or /v -> Buy Insurance, followed by a confirmation dialog.
  • Any vehicle can hold at most 5 active insurances at once.
  • This business has an interior.

docs.title: Insurance Costs
docs.text:
Depending on the Dealership cost of the vehicle, owners will pay the following amounts for insurance:

  • For vehicles with a price between $0 and $100,000 the insurance costs $500.
  • For vehicles with a price between $100,000 and $1,000,000 the insurance costs $1,000.
  • For vehicles with a price between $1,000,000 and $6,000,000 the insurance costs $1,500.
  • For vehicles with a price greater than $6,000,000 or which were purchased from the Shop and are not found in the Dealership the insurance costs $2,000.

docs.title: /buyinsurance
docs.text:
With the help of this command, any player can buy insurance for their personal vehicle.

The command is executed successfully only if you are in a personal vehicle and have the necessary money to purchase insurance.

Alternatively, you can use the /v -> Buy Insurance command to buy insurance.

Syntax: /buyinsurance

docs.title: Clothing Stores
docs.text: Clothing Stores Map Skins Table #1 #2 Costumes Interface

docs.title: Characteristics
docs.text:
• The B-Zone RPG server has a total of 16 clothing stores spread across the map.
  • Each clothing store is marked on the map with a white t-shirt, as in image #2.
  • The server automatically fixes the correct position of accessories on the skin (sunglasses / hats).
  • The money that the business deducts when you enter the interior represents only the entrance fee, so to buy accessories (/buyacs) you pay separately (see accessory prices below).

docs.title: Products
docs.text:
The following list contains all items available in a clothing store:

  • Sunglasses: $500
  • Hats: $500
  • Skins: $1 - $1,090,000
  • Costumes: $500

Skins are divided into 4 categories:

  • Starter ($1 or 1 Gold)
  • Bronze ($20,000 or 100 Gold)
  • Silver ($195,000 or 1,000 Gold)
  • Platinum ($1,090,000 or 5,000 Gold)

Legend: Product name - Product price

Skins List

docs.title: /buyacs
docs.text:
The command is used to buy sunglasses or hats and uses parameters, which means that after the /buyacs command you must specify one of the available options (hat or sunglasses).

Example #1: "/buyacs hat" will display dialogs with questions, for buying hats.

Example #2: "/buyacs sunglasses" will display dialogs with questions, for buying sunglasses.

docs.title: /skins
docs.text:
By using this command, the server will display a paginated table from which you can select the desired skin, the table cells being previews of the skins (see the image on the right).

Once decided, to buy the skin you must press the BUY button, and to view it press VIEW.

The /skins command is available both in your personal house (or rent), as well as in clothing stores. If used in a clothing store, the command will allow you to buy skins that you will have permanently available on your account, as well as wear the skins you have previously purchased. If used from a house, the command will only display the skins you have purchased, being able to use them directly from home, without having to go to the clothing store. Regardless of the location where it is used, the command will only display the skins corresponding to your gender in the game. To buy a skin you will be able to pay both with regular money and with Gold.

If you are not part of any faction (you are civilians), the table will contain 10 pages with 21 skins per page.

If you are part of a faction, the table will contain a single page, having only the skins specific to that faction (usually 4-5 skins).

Faction members will be able to wear such a "civilian" skin only if this skin is part of the most expensive category. A skin that is part of the medium or low price category can still be purchased, but can only be worn if the player is civilian.

If you are wanted by the police following an escape and you have the prison-specific skin, the command will not display the skin table but will offer you the skin you were using before entering prison. For more details about escapes, go to the Escape page.

docs.title: /costumes
docs.text:
This command used inside a clothing store will open an interface through which you will be able to attach multiple objects to your skin.

The number of objects that can be worn simultaneously is limited to 7.

After selecting an object you will be able to use the positioning system, which allows you to position the object in the desired location. You can also move the location of an already existing object or delete an object you no longer need.

Using the command outside clothing stores or houses will allow the user to show or hide the objects they already own.

docs.title: Clubs & Bars
docs.text: #1 #2 Interior of a club - Alhambra, Los Santos Map of bars and clubs

docs.title: General Characteristics
docs.text: Clubs represent the most important element of nightlife on the B-Zone RPG server. They are used for all kinds of occasions: birthday parties, events, contests or just for fun. They have bars, offering a wide range of alcoholic drinks and refreshments, and non-stop music, using various in-game radios. Clubs are private businesses, so there will always be an entrance fee, decided by the owner.

docs.title: Drinks from the Bar
docs.text:
By purchasing these products, you can increase your health points (HP; health points). Alcoholic drinks can lead to intoxication.

Note: If you drive while intoxicated, the police officer can give you a breathalyzer test and therefore you can be sanctioned from a fine, to the confiscation of your license for a period of several hours.

1. Alcoholic drinks:

  • Beer - $12
  • Wine - $21
  • Vodka - $30
  • Whiskey - $38

2. Non-alcoholic drinks (refreshments):

  • Water - $30
  • Carbonated soft drink (juice) [Soda] - $30
  • Sprunk (fictional drink from San Andreas) - $23
  • Coffee - $23

docs.title: Types of Clubs and Bars
docs.text:
• Alhambra - Los Santos (marked on the map as in image #1)
  • Jizzy Las Venturas - Las Venturas (marked on the map as in image #1)
  • Jizzy San Fierro - San Fierro (marked on the map as in image #1)
  • Pig Pen - Los Santos (marked on the map as in image #2)
  • The Big Spread Ranch - Las Venturas (marked on the map as in image #2)

docs.title: /drink
docs.text:
With this command you can buy drinks from a bar.

The command must be followed by the name of the desired drink

Example: /drink water (to buy water)

or

Example: /drink Vodka (to buy vodka)

You must be near the actual bar, inside the club, for this command to work.

To view the names of available drinks, use the /drink command.

Due to the consumption of alcoholic drinks, the camera will move chaotically and you will encounter difficulties in driving a vehicle.

docs.title: CNN
docs.text:
CNN Map CNN Los Santos #1

CNN (Cable News Network) represents the only advertising agency on the B-Zone RPG server. From its three locations, players can write and send advertisements to all other connected players (except those who have disabled this function through the /tog -> Announcements command).

To place announcements you need a minimum level of 3.

docs.title: Characteristics
docs.text:
• There is one CNN building in each city: Los Santos, Las Venturas and San Fierro.
  • These are marked on the map with an icon as in image #1.
  • The price (fee) is valid only in that CNN location and does not take into account the number of characters used.
  • The maximum number of characters that can fit in an announcement is 124.
  • Announcements will be published in the order of arrival, and the waiting time may vary depending on their number.
  • Administrators can delete inappropriate announcements before they are published.
  • CNN locations represent SafeZones.
  • Publishing offensive, vulgar announcements, or those that do not comply with the RPG server regulations is punishable according to them.

docs.title: On a Single Line
docs.text:
When the number of characters in the announcement does not exceed 50.

Example: Announcement published by Madalin (456): Buying BMX, Tampa, NRG-500 and Infernus.

docs.title: On Two Lines
docs.text:
When the number of characters in the announcement exceeds 50 (the separation is done automatically by the server).

Example:

  • Line 1: Announcement published by Kelton (128): Selling Monster B, Sparrow, stuntplane from wheel. Se ...
  • Line 2: ... lling house 336 cheap, Selling 6medkit, 2addict kit, selling biz 82...

docs.title: /ad
docs.text:
With this command you can write and publish an announcement. The text must have a maximum of 124 characters. After execution, the server will display a preview of the announcement and the number of seconds until publication.

The command is executed successfully only if you are in a CNN location.

Syntax: /ad [Announcement]

docs.title: /ads
docs.text:
This command displays a preview of all announcements that are placed on the server before they appear on the global chat.

Syntax: /ads

docs.title: /cancel ad
docs.text:
The command cancels your announcement, if it is unpublished, waiting. You will not get your money back.

The command is executed successfully only if you have an unpublished announcement waiting.

Syntax: /cancel ad

docs.title: /myad
docs.text:
This command displays a preview of the announcement and the maximum number of seconds until publication.

The command is executed successfully only if you have an announcement waiting.

Syntax: /myad

docs.title: FastFoods
docs.text: FastFoods Map Various FastFoods #1 #2

docs.title: Characteristics
docs.text:
• The B-Zone RPG server has a total of 28 FastFoods spread across the map.
  • The money that the business deducts when you enter the interior represents only the entrance fee, so to eat (/eat) you pay separately ($60).

  • Each FastFood is marked on the map with one of three symbols (see image #2):

    • A pizza slice
    • A bell
    • A burger

docs.title: Specific Commands
docs.text: The business has a single command:

docs.title: /eat
docs.text:
By using this command, you will receive 20 health points and it will cost you $60. The command can be used repeatedly until the health bar is full.

For the correct and successful execution of the command and to receive the health points, you must be as close as possible to the text "Type /eat to eat" (see image #1).

Note: As an alternative to this command, you can use the LALT key.

docs.title: Gas Stations
docs.text:
Gas Stations Map Gas Station Los Santos #1

A gas station on the B-Zone RPG server means a location where you can increase the fuel reserves of a vehicle.

Players are able to drive only vehicles that have fuel in the tank.

The RPG server has 19 gas stations, placed in each of the three main cities, as well as in other secondary locations.

docs.title: Characteristics
docs.text:
• A player who does not have a premium account can fill a vehicle's tank up to 100%.
  • A player who has a premium account can fill a vehicle's tank up to 150%.
  • This type of business does not have an interior.
  • Each gas station is marked on the radar with an icon similar to a transport truck.

docs.title: /fill
docs.text:
With the help of this command, any player can fuel their vehicle up to 100% fuel, in the case of players without a premium account, and up to 150% fuel, in the case of players who have a premium account.

The command is executed successfully only if you are in a vehicle and close enough to the fueling station.

The command also allows specifying the "percent" parameter, its syntax being: /fill [percent].

Example: /fill 10 will add 10 percent of fuel to the tank of the vehicle you are in.

docs.title: /fillgascan
docs.text:
The command is used to fill the fuel canister. The canister will be filled only if the one using the command owns one.

Any player on the server can buy a fuel canister from a 24/7 store.

The command is executed successfully only if you are close enough to the fueling station, in a vehicle or on foot.

Once the command is executed correctly and successfully, the canister will be filled and will have a volume depending on the skill level at the Mechanic job.

  • Skill 1: 20% fuel.
  • Skill 2: 25% fuel.
  • Skill 3: 30% fuel.
  • Skill 4: 35% fuel.
  • Skill 5: 40% fuel.
  • Skill 6: 45% fuel.
  • Skill 7: 50% fuel.
  • Skill 8: 55% fuel.
  • Skill 9: 60% fuel.
  • Skill 10: 65% fuel.

docs.title: General Description - Businesses
docs.text:
Gun Shop Los Santos Informational Text

Businesses are locations specific to daily life, such as FastFoods or clothing stores. On the B-Zone RPG server, these are buildings that any player can buy if they have a certain amount of money required and a certain level set for that business.

Businesses also have a certain money production like houses, so every time a player enters a business, they will be charged an amount of money called entrance fee. Any business owner can set the entrance fee for their business, except for businesses that have a standard fee.

  • Any player who has at least level 9 can purchase a business.

  • Each business has an informational text placed next to the entrance door. Looking at the informational text you will find out the following aspects about that business:

    • The business ID, located on the first line of the paragraph.
    • The informational name of the business.
    • The names of the business owners (you can see the owners using /shareholders).
    • The level you need to be able to buy the respective business.
    • The entrance fee.

docs.title: The Shares System
docs.text:
The shares system is a system based on buying and selling shares in a certain business. You can own a minimum of 10% of the profit from a business and a maximum of 100%, you can also own shares in multiple businesses at once. For example, you can own 10% of CNN LS, 20% of Pizza Idlewood, 40% of Clothes Store LS, until you reach the maximum of 100% that you can own. Depending on the percentage you own of a certain business, you will also receive your share of the profit, a simple example is if you own 10% of CNN LS and it produces $1,000,000 daily, you will earn $100,000 that day owning 10% of the business.

You can sell the shares of a business to another player using the [/trade] command, to sell the shares to the state for $0 you can use the [/sellshares] command.

docs.title: Types of Businesses
docs.text:
• Gas Stations
  • 24/7
  • FastFoods
  • Clothing Stores
  • Gun Stores
  • Clubs & Bars
  • Restaurants
  • Pay 'n' Sprays
  • Tuning Shops
  • Arenas
  • CNN
  • Rent
  • Melee Weapon Stores
  • Sex Shops
  • Poker Casino
  • Car Insurance
  • PUBG Arena
  • CarColor
  • Other Businesses

docs.title: Gun Shops
docs.text: #1 Gun Shop Interior LV Gun Shops Map

docs.title: Characteristics
docs.text:
• The B-Zone RPG server has one such store in each of the three cities: Los Santos, Las Venturas and San Fierro.
  • Each gun shop is marked on the map with a pistol icon as in image #1.
  • The money that the server deducts when entering the gun shop premises represents only the entrance fee. To buy a weapon you pay separately.
  • Each gun shop has an interior area (grill) where you can eat, increasing your health level (HP) up to 100%.
  • To eat, use the /eat command and it will cost $60.
  • To buy a weapon, use the /buygun command.
  • The /buygun command also displays both weapon prices and the price for a bullet.

docs.title: Available Weapons
docs.text:
• SDPistol - $1 per bullet
  • Deagle - $2 per bullet
  • Shotgun - $2 per bullet
  • MP5 - $2 per bullet
  • M4 - $3 per bullet
  • AK47 - $3 per bullet
  • Rifle - $3 per bullet

docs.title: Weapon Damage
docs.text:
• SDPistol - 13.2 HP
  • Deagle - 46.2 HP
  • Shotgun - 50 HP
  • MP5 - 8.2 HP
  • M4 - 10 HP
  • AK47 - 10 HP
  • Rifle - 24.7 HP
  • Tec9 - 6.6 HP
  • Uzi - 6.5 HP
  • Combat Shotgun - 39.6 HP
  • Sawn-off Shotgun - 46.2 HP
  • Sniper Rifle - 200 HP
  • Knife - 200 HP

Note: Knife, Sniper Rifle, Tec9, Uzi, Sawn-off Shotgun and Combat Shotgun are special weapons that cannot be purchased from Gun Shop. They are only available in certain factions.

Note: The health amounts (HP) displayed above represent the damage caused by a single bullet from the respective weapon.

Note: Combat Shotgun and Shotgun are weapons that fire bursts of bullets, which may or may not hit the target. The damage caused by these weapons decreases as the distance between the target and the shooter increases, due to the bullets spreading over a larger area.

docs.title: /buygun
docs.text:
By typing this command without specifying any parameter, the server will display a list of weapons available in the store, as well as their prices. To buy a weapon, the command is completed using the parameters: weapon name, ammunition quantity (bullets).

Example: /buygun Deagle 999 - The command will buy the Deagle weapon with 999 bullets.

Note: The maximum ammunition that a player can purchase by typing the command once is 999.

docs.title: /eat
docs.text:
To increase your health reserves (HP), gun shops provide specially created places for "eating", using the /eat command. For the command to be executed successfully, you must be as close as possible to the grill inside the shops. By typing the command, the server will deduct $60 from your money and give you +20 HP.

Note: As an alternative to this command, you can use the LALT key.

docs.title: Melee Weapons Store
docs.text:
Melee Weapons Store Map Melee Weapons Menu #1

The B-Zone RPG server has one such store in each of the three cities: Los Santos, Las Venturas and San Fierro.

The player needs a valid weapons license to be able to purchase a melee weapon.

docs.title: Characteristics
docs.text:
• Each melee weapons store is marked on the map with a pistol icon as in image #1.
  • The money that the server deducts when entering the weapons store premises represents only the entrance fee. To buy a weapon you pay separately.
  • You cannot hold more than one melee weapon simultaneously due to game mechanics. (Each type of weapon has its own slot, so a new melee weapon would overwrite the old weapon)
  • This type of business has an interior.

docs.title: Available Weapons
docs.text:
To buy a weapon you must go to the icon inside the store and press the Y key.

After pressing the Y key, a menu will open from which you can choose what melee weapon you want to buy.

Available weapons are:

  1. Katana - $1,000
  2. Golf Club - $250
  3. Baseball - $250
  4. Shovel - $500
  5. Pool Cue - $250
  6. Brass knuckles - $500

After you have chosen the desired weapon, press the BUY button to purchase it. If you no longer want to buy a melee weapon, you can exit the menu by pressing the CANCEL button.

docs.title: Damage Caused by Weapons
docs.text:
Each melee weapon causes different damage:

  1. Katana - 2.6 HP
  2. Golf Club - 4.6 HP
  3. Baseball - 4.6 HP
  4. Shovel - 4.6 HP
  5. Pool Cue - 4.6 HP
  6. Brass knuckles - 1.3 HP

docs.title: Other types of businesses
docs.text:
#1 #2 #3 #4 #5 #6 #7 #8

The B-Zone servers have around 160 businesses each, which is why it would be difficult to classify them all. Thus, we created this page, where all other types of businesses in the game are listed.

docs.title: LSPD/LVPD/SFPD Armoury
docs.text: Supplies the police with weapons, ammunition and other necessities. See photo #1.

docs.title: Phone Company
docs.text: Charges for calls and written messages (SMS). The cost of an SMS is $2 and the cost of a call is $6 / 30 seconds of conversation. See photo #2.

docs.title: Car Painting and Plating Co.
docs.text: Money paid for painting and registration ends up here. The price for painting and registering vehicles is $500. See photo #3.

docs.title: House Upgrade Company
docs.text: Benefits from house upgrades. Any upgrade or piece of furniture has a price of $1,000. See photo #4.

docs.title: Tow Car Company
docs.text: Unlike the faction with a similar name, this company handles personal towing. Towing a car is done in exchange for $200. See photo #5.

docs.title: The Los Santos Hospital
docs.text: Represents the only hospital in the game and, implicitly, in Los Santos. Here, players can get rid of drug addiction for $2. See photo #6.

docs.title: LS/LV/SF Hotdog Company
docs.text: The company earns from hotdogs sold through /hotdog. A hotdog costs $60. See photo #7.

docs.title: Casinos
docs.text: Here you can play gambling games at machines or with other players. See photo #8.

docs.title: Farmer Business
docs.text: From here you can buy the necessary items to be able to work at the Farmer system.

docs.title: Craftsman Business
docs.text: From here you can rent the necessary items to be able to work at the Craftsman job.

docs.title: Pay'n'Spray
docs.text:
#1 Map of Pay'n'Spray garages

In Pay'n'Spray garages, players can repair their damaged vehicles, for a sum of money.

docs.title: Characteristics
docs.text:
• The B-Zone RPG server has 10 such locations (4 in Los Santos, 3 in San Fierro, 3 in Las Venturas).
    • LS: Dilimore / Temple / Idlewood
    • LV: Redsands East / Royal Casino / Fort Carson
    • SF: Downtown / Juniper Hollow / El Quebrados
  • All garages are marked on the map with a green icon (see image #1).
  • Repairs cost $400, regardless of vehicle.
  • You must be in front of the "i" at the garage to be able to enter.
  • This business does not have a specific interior, apart from the garage interior used for repairs, which is not accessible to pedestrians.
  • Each Pay'n'Spray location represents a "Safezone" type area.

docs.title: /enter
docs.text:
With this command you can repair your vehicle at the price of $200. You must be near the business.

Note: The command can also be used in other situations, locations or systems.

Also, this type of business can be entered using the LALT key.

docs.title: Poker Casino
docs.text:
Biz Flamingo ID 156 Poker Table

For those passionate about Texas Hold'em style Poker, B-Zone servers provide such a system located within the Flamingo business in Las Venturas.

The poker tables are located at the end of the interior, waiting for eager players to win.

docs.title: Characteristics
docs.text:
• You can play poker if you have a minimum level 3.
  • General poker rules apply.
  • There can be at most 6 players simultaneously at a single table.
  • To be able to join a table you need a minimum level 3 and the minimum amount for entry, which is displayed at each table.
  • There are a total of 8 tables, each with its minimum entry amount.
  • From the pot won at the end of a round, 95% of the money will be received by the winning player or players, 4.9% of the money will be deleted from the server and 0.1% of the money will go into the business safe.
  • This business has an interior.
  • Leaving the table is done through the LEAVE button.
  • The poker game on the server does not fully comply with classic rules, sometimes having regulatory differences.

docs.title: Straight Flush
docs.text: Five cards in numerical order, all of the same suit.

docs.title: Four of a Kind
docs.text: Four cards having the same rank and a fifth additional card or 'kicker'.

docs.title: Full House
docs.text: Three cards of the same rank and two cards having another rank, but equal to each other.

docs.title: Flush
docs.text: Five cards of the same suit.

docs.title: Straight
docs.text: A sequence of five consecutive cards.

docs.title: Three of a Kind
docs.text: Three cards having the same rank, along with two other cards of different ranks.

docs.title: Two Pair
docs.text: Two cards having the same rank, another two cards having the same rank (but different from the rank of the first two cards) and a fifth card of a different rank.

docs.title: One Pair
docs.text: Two cards having the same rank, along with three other cards of different ranks.

docs.title: High Card
docs.text: Any hand that does not fall into any of the above categories.

docs.title: /poker
docs.text:
Through this command you will be able to join the poker table.

The command is executed successfully only if you are inside the Flamingo business, near one of the poker tables.

Syntax: /poker

docs.title: PUBG Arena
docs.text:
Inventory Map Loot Statistics

The PUBG Arena aims for a battle royale type match, which means that the last player left alive wins the match. The goal of the game is therefore to survive as long as possible, solo or in a team.

The arena can be found using the /gps command, biz id 159.

docs.title: Characteristics
docs.text:
• Upon entering the arena you will enter the Lobby and receive an automatic skin for the arena.
  • The lobby is accessible even when a match is already in progress.
  • It includes a team formation area near the tent area, teams can be formed by pressing the Y key in that location, as well as an arena exit area at the hot air balloon using the F or Enter key.
  • While a match is in progress you will be able to see through a HUD how many players are still alive.
  • If there is no match in progress you will see a timer on screen announcing the start of the next match.
  • At the start of the match each player will pay a fee that will be put into a POT which will be won by the player or team that wins the match.
  • The match starts with all players on a plane flying over the battle area, being able to jump from the plane with the space key when you consider you have reached above a favorable area.
  • If you do not jump from the plane you will be automatically removed at the end of the battle map.
  • The names of opponents are hidden, you will only be able to see the name of the player who killed you.
  • Once you have reached the ground your goal is to gather as much loot as possible to help you stay alive, avoid or kill opponents you encounter and stay inside the safe play areas.
  • You can opt for an aggressive style of play and search for opponents to kill or you can opt for a more passive style and hide until the play area is as small as possible.
  • Certain actions you take during a match give you certain points that count towards leveling up your PUBG character.
  • Currently the character level has no attribution.
  • The player or team of players who remain last alive will win the match.

docs.title: Loot
docs.text:
Loot represents the items that the player can find on the map to help them survive longer in the arena.

It is strategically divided across the entire game map, as follows:

  • High Loot: represents abundant loot areas, in popular zones, with loot between 21-50 items.
  • Medium Loot: represents medium loot area, in classic zones, with loot between 11-20 items.
  • Low Loot: represents low loot area, in peripheral zones, with loot between 3-10 items.

On the map there are also spawned vehicles in High Loot and Medium Loot areas.

Found items can be collected from the ground using the N key and being equipped or stored in inventory.

The inventory has a stock capacity of 350 units.

The loot that spawns on the map is divided into two types:

  • Loot that is random and changes as an item with each match.
  • Standard loot that will always be the same in each match.

docs.title: Types of Loot
docs.text:
• Medical Kit: grants 100 HP.
  • Adrenaline Pill: grants 2 HP/second up to a maximum of 20 HP.
  • Bandage: grants 10 HP.
  • Gas Can: grants 50 Fuel.
  • Armour Level 1, 2 or 3: grants 20, 35 or 50 armor.
  • Helmet Level 1, 2 or 3: grants 20, 35 or 50 armor.
  • Nightstick
  • Chainsaw
  • Grenade
  • Molotov
  • Silenced 9mm
  • Desert Eagle
  • Shotgun
  • Uzi
  • MP5
  • AK47
  • M4
  • Country Rifle
  • RPG
  • Backpack Level 1, 2 or 3: grants 500, 650 or 800 backpack capacity.

docs.title: Inventory
docs.text:
Here are stored and you can control all the items you have collected from the map.

  • The inventory can be accessed by pressing the Y key, closed by the Escape key.
  • By selecting an item from the inventory you will be able to see a general description of it.
  • The USE button is used to equip that item.
  • The inventory has a slot for a melee weapon, a slot for a main weapon and a slot for an automatic weapon.
  • For this reason you cannot switch between two automatic weapons as it normally works on sa-mp, but you have to equip from the inventory with the USE button the other automatic weapon if you want to use it.
  • The DROP ALL button allows you to drop an item on the ground with all the ammunition it has.
  • The DROP AMOUNT button allows you to drop an item on the ground with a certain amount of ammunition.
  • The backpack represents your storage space in inventory.

docs.title: Map
docs.text:
This represents the area where the match takes place.

Depending on the number of participating players, the arena will automatically determine whether a game is needed on all 3 cities or on a single city.

The map consists of 3 main zones:

  • Safe Zone: inside the blue circle; area where you are protected from the map's danger, but not from other players.
  • Neutral Zone: the area between the blue circle and the red one; this area temporarily protects you from the map's danger but pay attention to the timer because the area shrinks when time expires.
  • Danger Zone: the area outside the red circle; this represents the storm area where you will constantly lose HP depending on the stage of the game you have reached (if the circle is large, HP will decrease less and slower, if the circle is small, HP will decrease more and faster).

These map zones continuously change when the time displayed on the HUD expires.

In each stage of the match when the timer expires, the zones become increasingly smaller, gradually shrinking.

docs.title: Level
docs.text:
The arena has a level system through which players can advance.

  • Currently the character level does not bring any other benefit than visual.
  • There are certain actions that if done during a match bring you points that count towards leveling up.
  • These points can accumulate only once per match.
  • There is also a maximum limit of points that can be accumulated in a single day by a player, 5 times the maximum points from a single match.

docs.title: Points List
docs.text:
• Stage 1 Survivor: survive the first circle, 5 points
  • Stage 2 Survivor: survive the second circle, 10 points
  • Stage 3 Survivor: survive the third circle, 15 points
  • Stage 4 Survivor: survive the fourth circle, 20 points
  • Stage 5 Survivor: survive the fifth circle, 25 points
  • Dangerous Trio: last 3 remaining alive, 30 points
  • Lone Survivor: win the match, 70 points
  • Murderer: kill 5 enemies, 30 points
  • Serial Killer: kill 10 enemies, 40 points
  • Psycho: kill 15 enemies, 50 points
  • Massacre: kill 20 enemies, 60 points
  • Ghost Recon: kill an enemy with rifle, 15 points
  • First Kill: kill your first enemy, 5 points
  • First Find: pick up your first item from the ground, 1 point
  • First Weapon: pick up your first weapon from the ground, 2 points
  • Insane Mode: find an RPG, 5 points
  • The Mechanic: fuel a vehicle with a canister, 5 points
  • Full Backpack: fill the largest inventory, 10 points
  • Master of Elements: lose 10 HP in danger zone, 10 points
  • Clinically Dead: have under 15 HP in a match, 15 points

docs.title: Rent
docs.text:
Car Rent Las Venturas Plane Rent Las Venturas Biz Manage Buy Rent Car Rent a Car Garage View #7 #8 #9

On the B-Zone RPG server, players can rent four types of vehicles: cars, motorcycles, boats and aircraft.

There is one such center in each main city, except for those for boats and aircraft which are only present in Las Venturas.

docs.title: Characteristics
docs.text:
• The vehicle will remain in your possession until the rent expires or you terminate it sooner using the /unrentvehicle command.
  • The rented vehicle behaves like a personal one, being able to be found on /v, being able to give it locate, park, tow.
  • All rental centers represent SafeZones.
  • All money paid for renting the vehicle goes into the business at a rate of 100% (the state does not withhold anything).
  • Each business can have at most 10 vehicles.
  • When selling the business, the existing vehicles remain, these disappearing only when the owner sells them individually.
  • Car centers are marked on the map with an icon as in image #7.
  • Motorcycle centers are marked on the map with an icon as in image #8.
  • Boat centers are marked on the map with an icon as in image #9.
  • Aircraft centers can be found at the specific location.

docs.title: Rental Procedure
docs.text:
To rent a vehicle, you must:

  1. Go to one of the rental centers (marked on the map with icons as in the images).
  2. Choose an available vehicle, located in the parking lot adjacent to the business, and enter it.
  3. You will then be greeted with a dialog in which you will have to enter for what duration you want to rent the vehicle (minimum 1 hour, maximum 24 hours), and then a final confirmation dialog.

docs.title: Business Management
docs.text:
The business owner can use the /mybiz command to manage the business:

  • Setting the rental price for each vehicle individually.
  • Viewing whether or not they are rented and for what period.
  • Purchasing new vehicles.
  • Selling current vehicles.

Vehicles can be purchased by the owner at 10% of their price in Dealership, and when selling them they will receive 50% of their value back.

docs.title: /mybiz
docs.text:
This command is available to owners of rent-type businesses and helps with managing the business, setting the rental price for each vehicle individually, viewing whether or not they are rented and for what period, purchasing new vehicles, selling current vehicles.

The command is executed successfully only if you are inside your rent-type business.

docs.title: /unrentvehicle
docs.text:
The command will terminate the rental contract. Your old rented vehicle will disappear, and you will be left without its keys. You can use this command from anywhere.

The command is executed successfully only if you have an active rented vehicle.

Syntax: /unrentvehicle

docs.title: Restaurants
docs.text: #1 Interior of a restaurant Map of restaurants

docs.title: Characteristics
docs.text:
• The B-Zone RPG server has a total number of 7 restaurants spread across the map, two in each city.
  • The money that the business withdraws when you enter the interior represents only the entrance fee, to eat (/eat) you pay separately ($30).
  • Each restaurant is marked on the map with a cutlery set icon, exactly as in image #1.
  • Each restaurant has an outdoor annex.

docs.title: /eat
docs.text:
By using this command, you will receive 20 health units and it will cost you $30. The command can be used repeatedly, until the health bar is full.

For the correct and successful execution of the command and to receive the health units, you must be as close as possible to the text "Type /eat to eat" (see image #1).

Note: As an alternative to this command, you can use the LALT key.

docs.title: Sex Shops
docs.text:
Sex Shops Map Purchasing dildos Interface

B-Zone servers have a total of 3 Sex Shops, one in each of the three major cities.

These businesses have an entertainment role, so the items you can buy from them are strictly for your amusement and that of other players.

docs.title: Characteristics
docs.text:
• To be able to buy an item from a Sex Shop, the player will need to go to the indicator inside the business and press the Y key.
  • When this key is pressed, a specific interface will open on the player's screen.
  • The left/right arrows are used to navigate through the available items and the order button is used to buy an item or cancel to close the interface.
  • It should be noted that two such items cannot be held simultaneously.
  • This type of business has an interior.

docs.title: List of Available Items
docs.text:
The items available for purchase are:

  1. Flowers - $50
  2. White Dildo - $100
  3. Purple Dildo - $150
  4. Short Vibrator - $100
  5. Long Vibrator - $150

docs.title: Tuning
docs.text:
Tuning Map Tuning Interior Tuned Vehicles

On B-zone servers there are 3 tuning garages where you can tune your car: Loco Low Co, TransFender, Wheel Arch Angels.

The car can be tuned in any garage (Loco Low Co, TransFender, Wheel Arch Angels) regardless of the vehicle model.

docs.title: Characteristics
docs.text:
• All types of cars can now enter the tuning (not aircraft, boats or motorcycles).
  • This type of business has an interior.
  • Each tuning garage is marked on the radar with a specific icon.
  • Tuning is permanent for personal vehicles.
  • The tuning on the vehicle is not lost when selling the vehicle to another player through trade.
  • The maximum amount of money a player can spend to install absolutely all tuning components for a vehicle will not exceed 10% of the vehicle's price in DealerShip.
  • Tuning owners receive 0.5% of the money spent by players in the tuning garage.
  • Players with wanted level cannot enter the tuning garage.

docs.title: Components
docs.text:
There are a total of 17 categories of components, which are arranged on 3 pages (pages can be changed by pressing the numbers at the bottom of the menu).

For each component category, a certain percentage of the vehicle's value at the DealerShip is paid (only one component from a category can be installed):

  • Paint Jobs
  • Colors
  • Exhausts (Alien and X-Flow)
  • Front Bumper (Alien and X-Flow)
  • Rear Bumper (Alien and X-Flow)
  • Roof - Roof Spoiler (Alien and X-Flow)
  • Spoilers - Rear Spoiler (Alien and X-Flow)
  • Side Skirts (Alien and X-Flow)
  • Wheels
  • Car Stereo
  • Hydraulics
  • Nitro (x10) - Nitro Boost
  • Neons
  • Hood
  • Lamps
  • Vents

docs.title: Component Prices
docs.text:
• Hydraulics: 0.25%
  • Nitro (NOS): 0.8%
  • Wheels: 0.8%
  • Spoiler: 0.8%
  • Hood: 0.5%
  • Roof: 0.5%
  • Sideskirts: 0.5%
  • Lamps: 0.5%
  • Exhaust: 0.8%
  • Front Bullbar: 0.5%
  • Vents: 0.5%
  • Paintjob: 1.15%
  • Front Bumper: 0.5%
  • Rear Bumper: 0.5%
  • Color1/2: $25 fixed price (Colors are not permanent. For permanent colors type /carcolor or /hiddencolor)
  • Neons: 1.15%

docs.title: How to Tune the Car?
docs.text:
1. Once you arrive at the tuning garage, entry will be done using the /enter command or by pressing the LALT key.
  2. The component selection menu is positioned on the right side and will list all component categories (wheels, nitro, hydraulics, etc.).
  3. If the name of a category is red, then there are no tuning components in that category compatible with the vehicle.
  4. To choose a tuning component from a certain category, click on the name of the desired category, and you will be listed all the components compatible with your vehicle from that category.
  5. To return to the list of component categories, you can press the Back button. To select and install a component on the vehicle, click on its name.
  6. When you install a certain tuning component, the camera will automatically position itself so that you have perfect visibility.
  7. The amount of money is calculated and displayed above the menu as you install tuning components on the vehicle. To finalize your purchases, press the BUY button. To leave the tuning garage without causing any changes to the vehicle, you can press the ESC button on the keyboard.

docs.title: Premium Vehicles
docs.text:
• Only premium vehicles (Infernus, Cheetah, Banshee, Turismo, Bullet, all types of Monster Trucks, all types of Hotring) will be able to have neons installed.
  • If a vehicle has neons installed, the driver will have a new option for /tog, called "Vehicle Neons", with which they can turn on/off the neons.
  • You should keep in mind that neons do not shine at certain times of the day. They are usually visible in the morning, evening and only in some cases during the day.

docs.title: Business Useful Commands
docs.text:
Gun Shop Los Santos Informative text /shareholders command interface

On this page you will find all the control commands for a business, commands whose meaning is explained below.

To find out absolutely all the control commands for a business on the server, use the /businesshelp command.

docs.title: General characteristics
docs.text:
• Find out more information about businesses on the Businesses page.
  • For faster execution of the /enter and /exit commands, you can use the "F" key on your keyboard.

docs.title: /bizradio
docs.text:
Using this command, the owner of a business will be able to play a radio station or a YouTube link inside their own business. When a player enters that business, they will hear the radio station or the soundtrack from YouTube that was set by the owner.

By using the /bizradio command inside a business that does not belong to you, you will be able to control your ability to hear the audio streams inside the business.

Also, the sound playback can be stopped by the owner using this command.

docs.title: /enter
docs.text:
The /enter command is usually used to enter buildings, in this case, businesses. The command is executed successfully (you will be able to enter the business) only if you are close enough to the door of that business.

For faster execution, you can use the equivalent of this command, namely the "F" key on your keyboard.

docs.title: /exit
docs.text:
The /exit command is usually used to exit a building, in this case, a business. The command is executed successfully (you will be able to exit the business) only if you are close enough to the exit door.

For faster execution, you can use the equivalent of this command, namely the "F" key on your keyboard.

docs.title: /sellshares
docs.text: Following the use of this command, you will sell a share of the business to the state, the only money you will receive being that in the business safe, if it is not empty.

docs.title: /shareholders
docs.text: Following the use of this command, you will be able to see who the shareholders of a specific business are.

docs.title: /bizwithdraw
docs.text:
The command has the effect of withdrawing money from the business safe, money produced from the entrance fee that players pay when entering the business.

To find out how much money you have in the business safe, type the /bizwithdraw command without specifying the amount you want to withdraw from the safe.

If you want to withdraw a certain amount of money, type the command following this model: /bizwithdraw 500, will withdraw $500 from the business safe.

For correct and successful execution of the command, you must be inside the business (if it is possible to enter inside it), as close as possible to the exit door, or outside it, as close as possible to the entrance door.

docs.title: /bizinfo
docs.text:
To use the command you do not need to be near the business or inside it, the command being usable anywhere you are if you are the owner of a business.

By typing the command, the server will show you some details about your business:

  • Business level.
  • Entrance fee value.
  • Total revenue.
  • Minimum value for which the business can be sold.
  • The percentage of shares you hold in a certain business.
  • Business production based on the shares held.

docs.title: /bizstatus
docs.text: Following the use of this command, you will be able to see information about the safe of a business and the minimum value at which it can be sold.

docs.title: /mybiz
docs.text: To use the command you must be the owner of a rent type business (car, bike, airplane), and using this command you will be able to manage the owned vehicles and also buy new vehicles in the business if you have not reached the limit of 10 vehicles imposed by the server.

docs.title: /arenas
docs.text: Using the /arenas command you can see if the arenas available on the RPG server are occupied or not.

docs.title: /help
docs.text: Using the /help -> Businesses command you can find all the information presented above directly in the game.

docs.title: 69 Pier Mobs
docs.text: Faction Logo HQ Location Weapon packages by rank

docs.title: General Description
docs.text:
Starting in 1983, in the northeast of San Fierro, a group of 3 Latin Americans, "Coronas", "Regional Officer" and "Enforcer", gave birth to a gang called 69 Pier Mobs. Over time, they developed their gang, recruiting new gangsters for future battles. From the very beginning they had disagreements with their rivals in the city, from drug deals to street fights, slowly becoming the most feared gang. The gang has been and is involved in illegal activities such as robbery, blackmail, theft, kidnapping, drugs, weapons, pimping, protection for a fee and, especially, street fighting with other gangs for the conquest of territories. For these reasons, the gang members do not get along well with the law at all, the departments always visiting them in the places where they make their living, and, many times, these visits result in victims on both sides.

Led with tact and patience by their Leader, both in the past and in the present, this gang knows how to dot the i's to come out ahead. Every day, new recruits, called "Primitive", are subjected to various tests to see if they are ready to risk everything for the gang, subsequently becoming "Mummy".

If you want to be part of the new recruits and write history in 69 Pier Mobs, you must have at least level 10, common sense, responsibility and the desire to be in first place.

The main occupations of the mafiosi of B-Zone RPG servers are wars with other gangs (wars). The goal of all is to gain supremacy, to occupy as many territories as possible to become a known and respected gang by others. Find out more details about wars between gangs on the Wars page.

docs.title: Rank 2

docs.title: Rank 3

docs.title: Rank 4

docs.title: Rank 5

docs.title: Rank 6 or Leader

docs.title: Rank 1

docs.title: Rank 2

docs.title: Rank 3

earning = (6300 + random(15)) * (2,1 + coeficient_earning + coeficient_best)

Note:

  • random(15) represents a random number from 1 to 15.
  • coeficient_earning has the value 0 if the turf is lost, or the value 0,5 if the turf is won.
  • coeficient_best has the value 1 for the player who took best and the value 0 for the rest of the players.

docs.title: /fvr
docs.text: By executing the command, all unoccupied faction vehicles will be respawned. The command is accessible from rank 5 in any faction.

docs.title: /clothes
docs.text: To change your skin depending on the rank held, any member of a faction can use the /clothes command and only if they are in a clothing store.

docs.title: /order
docs.text: The command is used by the mafiosi of the servers to order a certain package of weapons (the weapon packages are available depending on the rank of the mafioso). A single parameter is used in completing the command, the ID of the weapon package. Note: There are a total of 4 weapon packages. The weapons contained in each package are listed in the image on the right.

docs.title: /backup & /cbackup
docs.text: In case a member of a mafia needs help, they can use /backup to ask for help from other members of the mafia. To cancel the help request, use the /cbackup command. Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /tie & /untie
docs.text: Any mafioso with rank 3 or higher has the right to use these two commands. They do nothing but kidnap, respectively release a player, the victim being unable to move.

docs.title: /fput & /fget
docs.text:
The /fput and /fget commands use one of the following parameters:

materials drugs

To deposit materials or drugs the /fput command is used, and to take them the /fget command is used.

docs.title: /stealers
docs.text: The command displays a list of information about all thieves of faction vehicles, active at that moment.

docs.title: /ftalkpower
docs.text: Through this command a member with rank 5+ can disable the faction chat for members with rank lower than the one chosen by him.

docs.title: /fwithdrawpower
docs.text: Through this command the faction Leader can set the minimum rank for extracting money, drugs and materials from HQ.

docs.title: /tduty
docs.text: Through this command those who are designated with the function of tester by the faction Leader can put themselves on duty to be able to perform faction entry tests.

docs.title: Activity Report
docs.text:
#1 Report dialog in-game #2 Report dialog on website #3 Activity report list website

The activity report represents the main activity of a faction member. The member must complete weekly the minimum number of points assigned to the rank and faction they are part of to be considered an active member.

The activity report is mandatory for Peaceful factions, for Departments and for Hitmen.

Factions such as the Mayor and Gangs do not have an activity report per se.

docs.title: General Characteristics
docs.text:
• Members with a rank between 1 and 5 must complete a mandatory report within the faction they are part of.
    • Players who join the faction on Wednesday through Sunday will have the activity report for that week optional.
  • Each rank is usually assigned a different number of points for the report.
  • The activity report is completed from Monday at 00:15 until Sunday at 23:45.
  • Leaders and Sub-leaders of the faction are exempt from completing the activity report.
  • Admins and Helpers who are part of factions will have a halved activity report.
  • The activity report is reset at the end of a week.
  • The activity report cannot be completed in advance.

docs.title: Completing the Report
docs.text:
• The progress of the activity report can be monitored in-game using the /raport, /myraport or /myreport commands (image #1).
  • It can also be monitored on the website in the My Account > Faction > Faction Reports section (image #2).
    • Here you can also view the progress for previous reports, regardless of which faction you were part of (image #3).
  • Activity report points are automatically allocated by the server when the player performs a specific faction action that counts towards the report.
  • The number of points required for the report specific to all factions can be viewed on the website in the Faction Reports section.

docs.title: The Bonus
docs.text:
• Players who complete a double report compared to what is normal receive a bonus worth $25,000.
  • Players who have an optional report can receive the bonus if they complete the points for the equivalent of a normal report.
  • Players who have a halved report can receive the bonus if they complete the points for the equivalent of a normal report.
  • In the case of gangs, the bonus will be allocated at the end of the report week only to players who managed to participate in at least 75% of the wars held that week.

docs.title: Leave from Report
docs.text:
• Players can request leave from completing an activity report by opening an inactivity request on the website in the My Account > Faction section.
  • Inactivity requests cannot be made for the current report week, only for report weeks that have not started. Therefore, if you are planning a vacation for the following week, it is advisable to open the inactivity request before the start of that week.
    • Case 1: If you did not manage to open the inactivity request on time and the week has already started, you have the option to not finish the activity report and you will receive a warning from the system if you have at least rank 2, after which in the following week you will have to recover the report from the missed week as well.
    • Case 2: If you did not finish the report for the current week and you have at least rank 2, and in the following week you have an accepted inactivity request, you will still have to recover the unfinished report in the week after the inactivity request expires.
  • Players with rank 1 do not have the right to open an inactivity request.
  • Players with rank 2 are entitled to a maximum of one week of inactivity.
  • Players with at least rank 3 are entitled to a maximum of two weeks of inactivity.

docs.title: Failure to Complete the Report
docs.text:
• Rank 1 players who fail to complete their activity report will be automatically dismissed from the faction with FP 60/60.
  • Players with at least rank 2 who fail to complete their activity report will initially enter recovery mode.
    • This means that in the next report week they will have to recover the unfinished points from the previous week in addition to the points they need to collect from the current report.
  • If the player does not manage to complete the report even in the recovery week, they will be sanctioned as follows:
    • Players with rank 2 will be automatically dismissed with FP 10/60.
    • Players with at least rank 3 will initially receive a rank down, and if they still do not finish their report, they will be automatically dismissed with FP 10/60.

docs.title: Avispa Rifa
docs.text: Faction Logo HQ Location Weapon packages by rank

docs.title: General Description
docs.text:
Avispa Rifa is a Mexican gang, located in the south of San Fierro city. Currently, it has numerous illegal occupations, including arms trafficking, killing people who are on the blacklist, drug trafficking. Mafia members daily demonstrate special skill during fights against other rival gangs.

Skill in handling weapons is the main objective, thus, this objective even becoming a criterion for recruiting new mafiosos. The faction has a fairly spacious parking lot for its vehicles, but also for its use as a shooting range. If you think your forte is fighting with members of other gangs among tall buildings, then your place is in Avispa Rifa.

The main occupations of mafiosos on B-Zone RPG servers are wars with other gangs (wars). Everyone's goal is to gain supremacy, to occupy as many territories as possible to become a well-known and respected gang by others. Find out more details about wars between gangs on the Wars page.

docs.title: /fvr
docs.text: By executing the command, all unoccupied faction vehicles will be respawned. The command is accessible from rank 5 in any faction.

docs.title: /clothes
docs.text: To change your skin according to your rank, any faction member can use the /clothes command only if they are in a clothing store.

docs.title: /order
docs.text: The command is used by mafiosos on servers to order a certain weapon package (weapon packages are available according to the mafioso's rank). A single parameter is used to complete the command, the ID of the weapon package. Note: There are a total of 4 weapon packages. The weapons contained in each package are listed in the image on the right.

docs.title: /backup & /cbackup
docs.text: If a mafia member needs help, they can use /backup to request help from other mafia members. To cancel the help request, use the /cbackup command. Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /tie & /untie
docs.text: Any mafioso with rank 3 or higher has the right to use these two commands. They do nothing but kidnap, respectively release a player, the victim being unable to move.

docs.title: /fput & /fget
docs.text:
The /fput and /fget commands use one of the following parameters:

  • materials
  • drugs

To deposit materials or drugs, use the /fput command, and to take them, use the /fget command.

docs.title: /stealers
docs.text: The command displays a list with information about all car thieves of the faction, active at that moment.

docs.title: /ftalkpower
docs.text: Through this command, a member with rank 5+ can disable faction chat for members with a rank lower than the one chosen by them.

docs.title: /fwithdrawpower
docs.text: Through this command, the faction leader can set the minimum rank for withdrawing money, drugs, and materials from HQ.

docs.title: /tduty
docs.text: Through this command, those designated with the tester function by the faction leader can go on duty to conduct faction entry tests.

docs.title: El Loco Cartel
docs.text: Faction Logo HQ Location Weapon packages by rank

docs.title: General Description
docs.text:
El Loco Cartel is a gang located in the center of San Fierro city and has origins in the wild Mexico.

The faction seeks to expand, defeating the other rival mafias that want to bring it down. The name is a tribute to El Loco, a crazy mafioso who beheaded 49 people. El Jefe, the faction leader, is looking for new applicants to join the organization. The mafia's goal is to train people who know what respect and teamwork are, to manage to turn players into bullet-throwing machines.

The main occupations of mafiosos on B-Zone RPG servers are wars with other gangs (wars). Everyone's goal is to gain supremacy, to occupy as many territories as possible to become a well-known and respected gang by others. Find out more details about wars between gangs on the Wars page.

docs.title: FBI
docs.text: Faction Logo HQ Location HQ Agent

docs.title: General Description
docs.text: Federal Bureau of Investigations is a governmental department, with a major importance in solving criminal cases from the three cities. Having its headquarters in San Fierro, agents have at their disposal a spacious building to operate freely. With maximum strictness regarding the rules, the director chooses agents capable of working under pressure. Having state-of-the-art vehicles capable of surpassing any limit, agents manage to catch even the most agile criminal. If you like strictness and adrenaline, this is the right place for you.

docs.title: /fvr
docs.text: By executing the command, all unoccupied vehicles of the faction will be respawned. The command is accessible from rank 5 in any faction.

docs.title: /clothes
docs.text: To change your skin according to your rank, any faction member can use the /clothes command only if they are in a clothing store.

docs.title: /m
docs.text:
Using this command, a police department member can send a message visible in a certain radius containing the name and rank held by the department member.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /su
docs.text:
This command is used by law enforcement on servers to grant a certain level of pursuit (wanted) to players. The command has a single parameter, the suspect's name or ID.

Example: /su Adi007 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /mdc
docs.text:
The command provides information about a player's criminal record. It has a single parameter, the name or ID of the player you want to check. The server will display the player's name, total crimes committed on the server, wanted level, total arrests, number of crimes for which they have not yet been sent to prison, information about each active unpunished crime and the number of police officers by which the suspect is currently being pursued. To use the command, you must be in any department vehicle, in a personal vehicle if you are a rank 3+ member, or inside the prison.

Example: /mdc Nic.eXe Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /arrest
docs.text:
Has a single parameter, the name or ID of the player you want to check. Example: /arrest Nic.eXe By using this command, a player with wanted level can be sent to prison. For a player to be arrested, the department member must use this command while in the prison area or in a department vehicle, near the special marker prepared at department headquarters, next to the suspect.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /wanted
docs.text:
This command provides the user with a list of information about all suspects on the server.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /nearwanted
docs.text:
This command provides the user with a list of information about suspects on the server located near their location.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /clear
docs.text:
Used to remove a player's wanted level. The command uses one parameter, the name or ID of the player whose record you want to clear.

Example: /clear Adi007 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /cuff & /uncuff
docs.text:
By using the /cuff command, a police department member can handcuff a player. By using the /uncuff command, a player can be released from handcuffs. Both commands have one parameter, the name or ID of the player you want to handcuff.

Example: /cuff Adi007 & /uncuff Adi007 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /punish
docs.text:
The /punish command is used to immobilize a player in prison. The command has a single parameter, the player's name or ID, the server automatically setting the suspect's punishment.

Example: /punish Adi007 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /confiscate
docs.text:
With this command, you can confiscate a player's drugs, materials, weapons and weapons license.

The command uses two parameters, the name or ID of the player from whom you want to confiscate an item and the name of the object you are going to confiscate.

Example: /confiscate Madalin Drugs Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard. The FBI faction being limited compared to police departments.

docs.title: /gov
docs.text:
This command is used to send a governmental announcement to all server players.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /duty
docs.text:
For a department member to be able to apply sanctions to players who break the rules, they need to equip themselves. To do this, the /duty command is used.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /lawyer
docs.text:
• Using this command you will sell release warrants to lawyers. The command uses two parameters, the name or ID of the lawyer to whom you want to sell the release warrant and the price of the warrant.
  • The price of a release warrant can be a minimum of $5,000 and a maximum of $20,000.
  • To sell a warrant you need 15 accept points.
  • The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /tazer
docs.text:
The /tazer command installs a shock device on the pistol. When you shoot the pistol at a suspect, having the shock device installed, the suspect is immobilized for 8 seconds.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /opengate
docs.text:
It is a command used to open a certain gate in prison. A single parameter is used to complete the command, the ID of the gate you want to open.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /frisk
docs.text:
To find out what objects a player has, the /frisk command is used. It displays the weapons a player has and other quantities such as drugs and materials.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /backup
docs.text:
In case a department member needs help against criminals, they can use this command, all police units being notified and all members of these units having a red point set on the map to lead them to the one who needs help.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /cbackup
docs.text:
This command cancels a help request initiated through the /backup command.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /ram
docs.text:
The command has the same effect as the /enter command, but is used only if a police member needs to enter inside a faction/house to catch a criminal.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /jaillist
docs.text:
Typing the command will display some details about all the prisoners logged on the server at that moment.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /untie
docs.text:
A police officer can release a player tied up by mafia members following a kidnapping.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /ms
docs.text:
Typing this command will send a specific message to the criminal, informing them that they are being pursued by a police member and must pull over immediately or surrender. For the message to be successfully sent to the criminal, you must be near them and have an active checkpoint generated by the /find command on the pursued player.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /shield
docs.text: With the help of the command you can buy, use or remove a defense shield. * To buy a shield, the command "/shield buy" will be typed while you are in a department's weapons depot (armoury). * To use a shield, you will need to type the command "/shield use" and a shield will attach to the skin. * To remove the shield from the skin (and its effect), you can type the command "/shield remove". * A police officer can own a maximum of one shield, and the price of a shield is $500. * The presence of the shield will absorb 100 units of damage (equivalent to armor) and only if the damage is caused by guns with bullets (not *explosions). * The shield will disappear if the police officer enters a vehicle. * The police officer cannot run constantly while having an active shield, periodically they will be blocked due to "fatigue".

docs.title: /undercover
docs.text: This command gives an agent an undercover identity. You need a minimum rank of 2+ in this department to use this command.

docs.title: /namecover
docs.text: This command gives an agent a new name if they are undercover. You need a minimum rank of 5+ in this department to use this command.

docs.title: /ftalkpower
docs.text: Through this command a member with rank 5+ can disable faction chat for members with rank lower than the one chosen by them.

docs.title: /fwithdrawpower
docs.text: Through this command the faction leader can establish the minimum rank for withdrawing money, drugs and materials from HQ.

docs.title: /tduty
docs.text: Through this command those who are designated with the tester function by the faction leader can go on duty to be able to perform faction entry tests.

docs.title: General Description
docs.text: #1 Leader /members options

docs.title: What is a faction?
docs.text:
A faction represents a group of a certain number of players who interact with each other and have the same goal, depending on the type of faction.

To make it easier for you to understand what a faction means, we can describe it as the equivalent of a workplace where all people must fulfill more or less the same objective and where they work collectively to achieve better development.

There are 4 major categories of factions on B-Zone RPG server:

  • Peaceful factions
  • Gangs
  • Police departments
  • Other factions

To be part of a faction included in one of the categories listed above, you also need a minimum level. The minimum level required for each faction can be found on the Factions page of the server website where you play.

docs.title: General characteristics
docs.text:
• Any player has the right to apply to a faction.
  • Players who are part of a faction usually need to fulfill a weekly activity report.
  • If a player does not fulfill the weekly report, but does not have an active inactivity request or other solid reasons, they will be sanctioned by the leader.
  • The sanctions that can be applied in a faction are:
    • Faction Warn (FW)
    • Faction Punish (FP)
  • Each faction has a special room for training, meetings or other similar activities. Members with rank 4+ can use the /open command near the entrance to open or close the room, which can allow faction members to enter. Inside, the /heal and /buygun commands can be used (at no cost).

docs.title: Faction Warn
docs.text:
• Faction Warn is a warning for the position held by the player in the faction. A leader gives a member of their faction a Faction Warn when they violate the faction's regulations, but not in a very serious way that requires the player's dismissal (example: regulation violations due to not knowing the regulations, insulting colleagues, not attending meetings/activities, etc.).
  • If a player receives a Faction Warn, they will have to wait two weeks more than the normal minimum time required to advance to the next rank. For department-type factions, other factions and mafias, you need to wait at least three weeks.
  • If a player accumulates three Faction Warns, they are automatically dismissed from the faction with 10 units of Faction Punish (FP). If the player is in the testing period (under 14 days since joining the faction), they will be automatically dismissed from the faction with 60 units of Faction Punish (FP).

docs.title: Faction Punish
docs.text:
• Faction Punish is measured in units. There is a maximum of 60 units of Faction Punish that a player can have. These units are given when a player is dismissed from a faction due to violating in various ways the regulations of the faction they are part of.
  • If a player has at least one unit of Faction Punish, they do not have the right to apply to any faction.
  • At each PayDay, each player who has been sanctioned with Faction Punish will have one unit removed.
  • If you have a premium account, for every 5 hours played, one additional unit of Faction Punish will be removed.
  • Faction Punish is given when a player violates the regulations and must be dismissed accompanied by a penalty.
  • Faction Punish units can also be removed by purchasing packages called "Clear 10 FP" from the virtual shop (/shop), using Gold.
  • Removing 10 units of Faction Punish from the shop (/shop) costs 200 gold.

docs.title: Without Faction Punish
docs.text: To leave a faction without Faction Punish, you must have been in that faction for a minimum of two weeks and not have accumulated three active Faction Warns. If you meet these requirements, you will be able to leave the faction without Faction Punish.

docs.title: With Faction Punish 10/60
docs.text: To leave a faction with Faction Punish 10/60, you must have been in that faction for a minimum of two weeks and have accumulated three active Faction Warns.

docs.title: With Faction Punish 60/60
docs.text: To leave a faction with Faction Punish 60/60, you must have been in that faction for less than two weeks and have violated the rules or resigned, or have been in the faction for a minimum of two weeks and have been banned for cheats.

docs.title: About application
docs.text:
You do not need to create another account, you will use the same login credentials as your account on the server you play on. Before entering your credentials, always make sure the address you entered is the official one.

You can apply to a faction using the FACTIONS tab, finding the factions that are recruiting by looking at Application Status where you will see Closed for factions that are not recruiting and Opened for those that are recruiting. Once you have found your preferred faction with Opened status, you will be able to apply to it by clicking the Apply button if you meet the minimum application requirements for the faction.

The application itself is done relatively easily because you are given a model with sections that you simply need to fill out. For your application to have maximum chances of acceptance, it must be well put together, written correctly, contain enough information so that the leader can find out everything they are interested in about you, and last but not least, be truthful. A weak application means your chances of acceptance are minimal.

docs.title: Application response
docs.text:
Depending on the number of applicants to that faction, the response to your application can be received from a few hours to a few days of waiting. When your application receives a response, you will automatically receive a notification on the website. You can also manually check the response to your application by going to your profile on the website to the Faction tab where you will be able to see both the log list from the factions you have been part of and the log list of your applications to factions.

There you will see the status of your application and when you notice that it has been modified, you can click on View to see the leader's response to your application.

docs.title: The test
docs.text:
Once you are accepted for testing, you will need to present yourself in-game to one of the faction testers, depending on how the leader informs you in the application or how you are informed in the subforum of the faction you are applying to, and take a theoretical and a practical test.

The theoretical test consists of a set of questions from the general regulations of the type of faction you are applying to and from the specific internal regulations of that faction. How the test is conducted and what the rules are will be presented to you by the tester, and in the case of some factions you will be able to find this information in the faction's subforum.

The practical test differs from one faction to another, and in some cases it may be missing.

Once all tests have been completed, you will receive a response as to whether you were admitted or rejected for the tests.

Leaders, sub-leaders of the faction and players accepted for testing can use the /testers command to view online testers.

docs.title: Complaints and Faction Sanctions
docs.text: As a faction member, you will receive complaints against you from time to time that the leader must analyze and decide whether or not you have violated any rules of the faction you are part of. You will automatically receive a notification on the website when a complaint is made against you, when your complaint receives new comments, or when your complaint receives a response from the leader. As a faction member, you have the right to defend yourself with evidence and useful information in your favor by leaving a comment on the complaint so that it is easier for the leader to respond to your complaint.

docs.title: /factions
docs.text: By typing this command you can see a list of all factions as well as information about them (the leader, minimum application level, whether applications are open or not).

docs.title: /testers
docs.text: This command displays a list of all online testers, if you have an accepted application in a faction.

docs.title: /f
docs.text: With the help of this command you can talk on the faction chat, if you are a member of a faction.

docs.title: /fvr
docs.text: With the help of this command you can respawn faction vehicles (minimum rank 5+).

docs.title: /members
docs.text: This command displays a list of all members of a faction, provided you are members of a faction.

docs.title: /leaders
docs.text:
This command displays a list of all online leaders on the server.

Failure to comply with server rules, general faction rules or specific faction rules will lead to your sanctioning within the faction.

docs.text:
Players who have spent at least 4 years in a faction with or without breaks, will receive from the staff a special vehicle that cannot be purchased anywhere, but is only found at the HQ of the respective faction.

To get a special vehicle you must open a ticket on the forum only if you meet the criterion mentioned above.

Important note: Seniority in factions of the same type does not add up. The period must be achieved in a single faction.

docs.title: Green Street Bloods
docs.text: Faction Logo HQ Location Weapon packages by rank

docs.title: General Description
docs.text:
Green Street Bloods represents a mafia of African-American origin, located on the outskirts of Los Santos looking from Las Colinas at the bustling city. The gang began to terrorize the city of Los Santos since the 1960s, being one of the oldest gangster groups. The gang members are simple young people, who have been taught from a young age the secrets of handling weapons and illegal businesses, dreaming only of conquering cities through brute force. The numerous crimes committed by Green Street Bloods members have also stood out in police files, they are wanted by all the police in the city of Los Santos. Supreme Chief is the name of the faction Leader and is in continuous search of courageous members who know the art of handling weapons.

The main occupations of the mafiosi of B-Zone RPG servers are wars with other gangs (wars). The goal of all is to gain supremacy, to occupy as many territories as possible to become a known and respected gang by others. Find out more details about wars between gangs on the Wars page.

docs.text:

Note: There are a total of 4 weapon packages. The weapons contained in each package are listed in the image on the right.

docs.title: /backup & /cbackup
docs.text:
In case a member of a mafia needs help, they can use /backup to ask for help from other members of the mafia. To cancel the help request, use the /cbackup command.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /tie & /untie
docs.text: Any mafioso with rank 3 or higher has the right to use these two commands. They do nothing but kidnap, respectively release a player, the victim being unable to move.

docs.text:

materials drugs

To deposit materials or drugs the /fput command is used, and to take them the /fget command is used.

docs.title: Hitmen Agency
docs.text: Agency Logo HQ Location HQ Assassination Contract successfully completed

docs.title: General Description
docs.text:
Hitmen Agency - Agency of assassins in direct translation. One of the most respected factions, the family of elite players as it is called. All you have to do is fulfill the favors of some individuals, payment is made in advance, then you have to fulfill a contract. You are a simple person in the eyes of those around you, but your mind describes the qualities of the agency. A true member of this faction must first excel through mental abilities, agility and perfection. You have the chance to take a test for entry if your application is accepted by the leader. In most cases, the faction seeks as much experience as possible and a very important quality, correct writing in Romanian language.

The agency has a limited number of vehicles such as Sparrow, Buffalo. Most of the time, agency members choose the easiest way, which is using nature and technology. The 3 cities need peace, citizens need a normal life and of course the agency needs satisfied customers.
