docs.text: By executing the command, all unoccupied faction vehicles will be respawned. The command is accessible from rank 5 in any faction.

docs.title: /clothes
docs.text: To change your skin according to your rank, any faction member can use the /clothes command only if they are in a clothing store.

docs.title: /portable
docs.text:
The command connects the assassin to the agency's server, from where they can get a contract, order weapons, etc. Once you use this command, it will connect you to the agency's server and you will be able to operate different commands.

  • MyContract, with this option you can see information about your target.
  • GetHit, with this option you can get a contract.
  • LeaveHit, with this option you can abandon the contract.
  • Order, with this option you can get weapons.
  • Ranks, with this option, you can see the online agency members.
  • Undercover, with this option you go undercover.
  • Logout, with this option, you disconnect from the agency's server.

Note: After completing the contract, you will have a waiting period depending on the distance from which you completed the contract.

docs.title: /ram
docs.text: The command has the same effect as the /enter command, but is only used if a member of the assassin agency must enter a house to assassinate a player.

docs.title: /ftalkpower
docs.text: Through this command, a member with rank 5+ can disable the faction chat for members with a rank lower than the one chosen by them.

docs.title: /fwithdrawpower
docs.text: Through this command, the faction leader can set the minimum rank for withdrawing money, drugs and materials from HQ.

docs.title: /tduty
docs.text: Through this command, those who are designated with the tester function by the faction leader can go on duty to be able to conduct entrance tests to the faction.

docs.title: For completing the contract
docs.text:
• From over 300 meters, or if you complete the contract with Knife, you will be able to gethit immediately.
  • From 250 - 299 meters, or the target commits suicide, you will be able to gethit in 5 minutes.
  • From 200 - 249 meters, you will be able to gethit in 10 minutes.
  • From under 199 meters, you will be able to gethit in 15 minutes.

docs.title: For abandoning the contract
docs.text:
The agent does not receive waiting time in the following situations handled by the server:

  1. If the target goes to /sleep while the agent is chasing them.
  2. If the target is imprisoned by police or admins.
  3. If the target is a mafioso and participates in war.
  4. If the target is in a clan and participates in clan war.
  5. If the target is in the virtual world of jail.
  6. If the target participates in an event.
  7. If the target participates in a live.
  8. If the target is in a mission.
  9. If the target is in a business where an event is taking place.
  10. If the target is in a Poker match or in the Poker business.
  11. If the target is AFK with 0 HP.
  12. If the target is logging in.
  13. If the target is in Training Room.

  1. Weapon (you can own a weapon)
  2. Materials (you can purchase materials for the purpose of selling weapons or the materials procured)
  3. Fishing (allows legal fishing)
  4. Flying (allows piloting an airplane/helicopter)
  5. Sailing (allows navigating a boat)

Note: The amount of money required to obtain the above licenses differs depending on the level of the aspiring player.

It should be mentioned that this is the minimum level required by the server, the internal regulations may not allow certain licenses from the same level.

docs.title: NPC license purchase or renewal
docs.text:
#1 NPC #2 Dialog for selecting the desired license and its purchase price
  • Next to the entrance to the Training Room there is an NPC from which players can purchase or renew the desired licenses directly without having to take a test for them.
  • This option is available only if the player has already tried requesting an instructor and within 5 minutes their request was not accepted by any instructor on duty.
  • If there is no instructor on duty at that time, the license purchase dialog will be displayed directly.
  • License prices are considerably higher than usual at an instructor depending on the player's level as follows:
    • Flying License:
      • Level 1-9: costs $4,500
      • Level 10-49: costs $9,000
      • Level 50+: costs $18,000
    • Sailing License:
      • Level 1-9: costs $4,250
      • Level 10-49: costs $8,500
      • Level 50+: costs $17,000
    • Fishing License:
      • Level 1-9: costs $1,250
      • Level 10-49: costs $2,500
      • Level 50+: costs $5,000
    • Weapon License:
      • Level 5-9: costs $5,000
      • Level 10-49: costs $10,000
      • Level 50+: costs $20,000
    • Materials License:
      • Level 1-9: costs $4,000
      • Level 10-49: costs $8,000
      • Level 50+: costs $16,000
  • Once the desired license is selected from the NPC dialog (see image #2), the available hours for it are automatically set to 100.

docs.title: /duty
docs.text: With this command, a faction member goes on duty or off duty. (whether or not they receive license requests)

docs.title: /fvr
docs.text: By executing the command, all unoccupied faction vehicles will be respawned. The command is accessible from rank 5 in any faction.

docs.title: /clothes
docs.text: To change your skin according to your rank, any member of a faction can use the /clothes command only if they are in a clothing store.

docs.title: /sx
docs.text: With this command, all three instructor schools can communicate with each other.

docs.title: /startlesson
docs.text: With this command, an instructor starts a client's lesson to give them a license.

docs.title: /stoplesson
docs.text: Using this command, an instructor stops a client's lesson.

docs.title: /givelicense
docs.text:
An instructor with at least rank 1 can use this command. By using it, an instructor gives a certain license to a player after passing the tests.

Example: /givelicense Adi007 Fishing

docs.title: /servicecalls
docs.text: With this command, instructors will be able to see unanswered commands.

docs.title: /ftalkpower
docs.text: With this command, a member with rank 5+ can disable the faction chat for members with a rank lower than the one chosen by them.

docs.title: /fwithdrawpower
docs.text: With this command, the faction leader can set the minimum rank for withdrawing money, drugs and materials from HQ.

docs.title: /tduty
docs.text: With this command, those who are designated with the tester function by the faction leader can go on duty to be able to perform faction entry tests.

docs.title: LS Taxi
docs.text: Faction Logo HQ Location HQ

docs.title: General Description
docs.text:
Located on the outskirts of the city, Los Santos Taxi company offers customers a variety of cars and experienced drivers to drive them safely and as quickly as possible to their desired destination. Los Santos Taxi Cab Company is a taxi company that ensures safe and timely transportation anytime and anywhere. The faction headquarters is located in the south of Los Santos city.

When a taxi driver uses the /fare command to activate their duty function, they will receive a table with information on the right side of the screen. The table includes:

  • The fare value set through the /fare command.
  • Total money earned from the ride.
  • Total kilometers traveled.
  • The name of the taxi company you belong to.

docs.title: LSPD
docs.text: Department Logo HQ Location HQ Police Officer

docs.title: General Description
docs.text:
Los Santos Police Department is a governmental institution that eliminates crime from the streets of Los Santos, with the help of modern weapons and special vehicles under their command. As with the other local departments, SF Police Department and LV Police Department, the LS Police Department faction is divided into two main teams:

  1. Traffic team
  2. S.W.A.T. team

The traffic team is responsible for traffic monitoring and fining players who press too hard on the accelerator and defy traffic rules. The S.W.A.T. team is made up of experienced detectives who have passed the rank of officers and act to catch all the criminals in the city. If you have civic sense and like to respect the law, this is your place.

docs.title: /fvr
docs.text: By executing the command, all unoccupied faction vehicles will be respawned. The command is accessible from rank 5 in any faction.

docs.title: /clothes
docs.text: To change your skin according to your rank, any faction member can use the /clothes command only if they are in a clothing store.

docs.title: /m
docs.text:
Using this command, a member of police departments can send a visible message at a certain radius containing the name and rank held by the department member.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /su
docs.text:
This command is used by law enforcement on servers to give a certain level of pursuit (wanted) to players. The command has a single parameter, namely the suspect's name or ID.

Example: /su Adi007 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /mdc
docs.text:
The command provides information about a player's criminal record. It has a single parameter, the name or ID of the player you want to check. The server will display the player's name, total crimes committed on the server, wanted level, total arrests, number of crimes for which they have not yet been sent to prison, information about each active unpunished crime and the number of police officers currently pursuing the suspect. To use the command you must be in any department vehicle, in a personal vehicle if you are a rank 3+ member, or in the prison compound.

Example: /mdc Nic.eXe Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /arrest
docs.text:
Has a single parameter, the name or ID of the player you want to check. Example: /arrest Nic.eXe By using this command, a player with a wanted level can be sent to prison. For a player to be arrested, a department member must use this command while in the prison compound or in a department vehicle, near the special marker of the department headquarters, together with the suspect.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /wanted
docs.text:
This command provides the user with a list of information about all suspects on the server.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /nearwanted
docs.text:
This command provides the user with a list of information about suspects on the server located near their location.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /clear
docs.text:
Used to remove a player's wanted level. The command uses one parameter, the name or ID of the player whose record you want to clear.

Example: /clear Adi007 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /cuff & /uncuff
docs.text:
By using the /cuff command, a member of a police department can handcuff a player. By using the /uncuff command, a player can be released from handcuffs. Both commands have one parameter, the name or ID of the player you want to handcuff.

Example: /cuff Adi007 & /uncuff Adi007 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /punish
docs.text:
The /punish command is used to immobilize a player in prison. The command has a single parameter, the player's name or ID, with the server automatically setting the suspect's punishment.

Example: /punish Adi007 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /confiscate
docs.text:
With this command, you can confiscate drugs, materials and weapons from a player, one of the following licenses if they have them: 1. Driver's license 2. Flying license 3. Sailing license 4. Materials license 5. Weapons license

The command uses two parameters, the name or ID of the player from whom you want to confiscate an item and the name of the object you are going to confiscate, except for the driver's license which also accepts a third parameter, the number of hours, which is implicitly 3 and can be between 1 and 5.

Example: /confiscate Adi007 Drivinglic Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /gov
docs.text:
This command is used to send a government announcement to all server players.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /duty
docs.text:
For a department member to be able to apply sanctions to players who break the rules, they need to equip themselves. To do this, use the /duty command.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /lawyer
docs.text:
• Using this command you will sell release warrants to lawyers. The command uses two parameters, the name or ID of the lawyer to whom you want to sell the release warrant and the price of the warrant.
  • The price of a release warrant can be minimum $5,000 and maximum $20,000.
  • To sell a warrant you need 15 accept points.
  • The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /tazer
docs.text:
The /tazer command installs a shock absorber on the pistol. When you shoot a suspect with the pistol, having the shock absorber installed, the suspect is immobilized for 8 seconds.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /opengate
docs.text:
It is a command used to open a certain gate in the prison. A single parameter is used to complete the command, namely the ID of the gate you want to open.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /frisk
docs.text:
To find out what items a player has, use the /frisk command. This displays the weapons a player has and other quantities such as drugs and materials.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /backup
docs.text:
If a department member needs help against criminals, they can use this command, all police units are notified and all members of these units get a red point set on the map to lead them to the one in need of help.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /cbackup
docs.text:
This command cancels a help request initiated by the /backup command.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /ram
docs.text:
The command has the same effect as the /enter command, but is only used if a police member needs to enter a faction/house to catch a criminal.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /jaillist
docs.text:
Typing the command will display some details about all prisoners logged on the server at that time.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /untie
docs.text:
A police officer can release a player tied by gangsters following a kidnapping.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /startradar & /stopradar
docs.text:
The commands are used only inside a police vehicle. The /startradar command uses one parameter, the maximum allowed speed. Example: /startradar 130 - will set the radar speed limit to 130km/h. The /stopradar command will deactivate the radar.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD

docs.title: /ticket
docs.text:
Server police officers use this command to issue fines to players. It uses a single parameter, the ID or name of the player to whom you want to issue the fine.

Example: /ticket 130 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD

docs.title: /radars
docs.text: The /radars command is available to rank 4+ members from LSPD, LVPD and SFPD factions which will display an informative table about all placed radars (police officer name, faction, placement area and imposed speed limit).

docs.title: /ms
docs.text:
Typing this command will send a specific message to the criminal, informing them that they are being pursued by a police member and must immediately pull over or surrender. For the message to be sent successfully to the criminal, you must be near them and have an active checkpoint generated by the /find command on the tracked player.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /shield
docs.text: With this command you can buy, use or remove a defense shield. * To buy a shield, type the command "/shield buy" while in a department's weapon depot (armoury). * To use a shield, you will need to type the command "/shield use" and a shield will attach to the skin. * To remove the shield from the skin (and its effect), you can type the command "/shield remove". * A police officer can own a maximum of one shield, and the price of a shield is $500. * The presence of the shield will absorb 100 damage units (equivalent to armor) and only if the damage is caused by bullet weapons (not explosions). * The shield will disappear if the police officer enters a vehicle. * The police officer cannot run constantly while having an active shield, periodically they will be blocked due to "fatigue".

docs.title: /ftalkpower
docs.text: Through this command a member with rank 5+ can disable faction chat for members with lower rank than the one chosen by them.

docs.title: /fwithdrawpower
docs.text: Through this command the faction leader can set the minimum rank for withdrawing money, drugs and materials from HQ.

docs.title: /tduty
docs.text: Through this command those who are designated with the tester function by the faction leader can go on duty to be able to perform faction entry tests.

docs.title: Licenses & General Description
docs.text:
LV School Instructors can provide you with any of the following licenses for a sum of money fixed by the respective faction's regulations, which all instructors are obliged to respect:

  1. Weapon (you can own a weapon)
  2. Materials (you can purchase materials for the purpose of selling weapons or procured materials)
  3. Fishing (allows legal fishing)
  4. Flying (allows piloting an airplane/helicopter)
  5. Sailing (allows navigating a boat)

Note: The amount of money required to obtain the above licenses differs depending on the aspiring player's level.

docs.title: NPC License Purchase or Renewal
docs.text:
#1 NPC #2 Dialog for selecting the desired license and its purchase price
  • Next to the Training Room entrance, there is an NPC from which players can purchase or renew their desired licenses directly without having to take a test for them.
  • This option is only available if the player has already attempted to request an instructor and within 5 minutes their request has not been accepted by any instructor on duty.
  • If there is no instructor on duty at that moment, the license purchase dialog will be displayed directly.
  • The license prices are considerably higher than usual from an instructor, depending on the player's level as follows:
    • Flying License:
      • Level 1-9: costs $4,500
      • Level 10-49: costs $9,000
      • Level 50+: costs $18,000
    • Sailing License:
      • Level 1-9: costs $4,250
      • Level 10-49: costs $8,500
      • Level 50+: costs $17,000
    • Fishing License:
      • Level 1-9: costs $1,250
      • Level 10-49: costs $2,500
      • Level 50+: costs $5,000
    • Weapon License:
      • Level 5-9: costs $5,000
      • Level 10-49: costs $10,000
      • Level 50+: costs $20,000
    • Materials License:
      • Level 1-9: costs $4,000
      • Level 10-49: costs $8,000
      • Level 50+: costs $16,000
  • Once the desired license is selected from the NPC dialog (see image #2), the available hours for it are automatically set to 100.

docs.title: /duty
docs.text: With this command a faction member goes on duty or off duty. (whether they receive license requests or not)

docs.title: /fvr
docs.text: By executing the command, all unoccupied faction vehicles will be respawned. The command is accessible from rank 5 in any faction.

docs.title: /clothes
docs.text: To change your skin according to your rank, any faction member can use the /clothes command only if they are in a clothing store.

docs.title: /sx
docs.text: With this command all three instructor schools can communicate with each other.

docs.title: /startlesson
docs.text: With this command an instructor starts a client's lesson to offer them a license.

docs.title: /stoplesson
docs.text: Using this command an instructor stops a client's lesson.

docs.title: /givelicense
docs.text:
An instructor with at least rank 1 can use this command. By using it, an instructor offers a certain license to a player after taking the tests.

Example: /givelicense Adi007 Fishing

docs.title: /servicecalls
docs.text: With this command, instructors can see unclaimed requests.

docs.title: /ftalkpower
docs.text: With this command a member with rank 5+ can disable faction chat for members with a rank lower than the one they choose.

docs.title: /fwithdrawpower
docs.text: With this command the faction leader can set the minimum rank for withdrawing money, drugs and materials from HQ.

docs.title: /tduty
docs.text: With this command those designated as testers by the faction leader can go on duty to conduct faction entry tests.

docs.title: LV Taxi
docs.text: Faction Logo HQ Location HQ

docs.title: General Description
docs.text:
Las Venturas Taxi Cab Company is a taxi company that ensures safe and timely transportation anytime and anywhere. The faction headquarters is located in the west of Las Venturas city, being a fairly open area with enough space for vehicle parking.

When a taxi driver uses the /fare command to activate their duty function, they will receive a table with information on the right side of the screen. The table includes:

  • The fare value set through the /fare command.
  • Total money earned from the ride.
  • Total kilometers traveled.
  • The name of the taxi company you belong to.

docs.title: LVPD
docs.text: Department Logo HQ Location HQ Police Officer

docs.title: General Description
docs.text:
Las Venturas Police Department is a governmental institution that eliminates crime from the streets of Las Venturas, with the help of modern weapons and special vehicles under their command. As with the other local departments, LS Police Department and SF Police Department, the LV Police Department faction is divided into two main teams:

  1. Traffic team
  2. S.W.A.T. team

The traffic team is responsible for traffic monitoring and fining players who press too hard on the accelerator and defy traffic rules. The S.W.A.T. team is made up of experienced detectives who have passed the rank of officers and act to catch all the criminals in the city. If you have civic sense and like to respect the law, this is your place.

docs.title: /fvr
docs.text: By executing the command, all unoccupied faction vehicles will be respawned. The command is accessible from rank 5 in any faction.

docs.title: /clothes
docs.text: To change your skin according to your rank, any faction member can use the /clothes command only if they are in a clothing store.

docs.title: /m
docs.text:
Using this command, a member of police departments can send a visible message at a certain radius containing the name and rank held by the department member.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /su
docs.text:
This command is used by law enforcement on servers to give a certain level of pursuit (wanted) to players. The command has a single parameter, namely the suspect's name or ID.

Example: /su Adi007 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /mdc
docs.text:
The command provides information about a player's criminal record. It has a single parameter, the name or ID of the player you want to check. The server will display the player's name, total crimes committed on the server, wanted level, total arrests, number of crimes for which they have not yet been sent to prison, information about each active unpunished crime and the number of police officers currently pursuing the suspect. To use the command you must be in any department vehicle, in a personal vehicle if you are a rank 3+ member, or in the prison compound.

Example: /mdc Nic.eXe Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /arrest
docs.text:
Has a single parameter, the name or ID of the player you want to check. Example: /arrest Nic.eXe By using this command, a player with a wanted level can be sent to prison. For a player to be arrested, a department member must use this command while in the prison compound or in a department vehicle, near the special marker of the department headquarters, together with the suspect.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /wanted
docs.text:
This command provides the user with a list of information about all suspects on the server.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /nearwanted
docs.text:
This command provides the user with a list of information about suspects on the server located near their location.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /clear
docs.text:
Used to remove a player's wanted level. The command uses one parameter, the name or ID of the player whose record you want to clear.

Example: /clear Adi007 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /cuff & /uncuff
docs.text:
By using the /cuff command, a member of a police department can handcuff a player. By using the /uncuff command, a player can be released from handcuffs. Both commands have one parameter, the name or ID of the player you want to handcuff.

Example: /cuff Adi007 & /uncuff Adi007 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /punish
docs.text:
The /punish command is used to immobilize a player in prison. The command has a single parameter, the player's name or ID, with the server automatically setting the suspect's punishment.

Example: /punish Adi007 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /confiscate
docs.text:
With this command, you can confiscate drugs, materials and weapons from a player, one of the following licenses if they have them: 1. Driver's license 2. Flying license 3. Sailing license 4. Materials license 5. Weapons license

The command uses two parameters, the name or ID of the player from whom you want to confiscate an item and the name of the object you are going to confiscate, except for the driver's license which also accepts a third parameter, the number of hours, which is implicitly 3 and can be between 1 and 5.

Example: /confiscate Adi007 Drivinglic Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /gov
docs.text:
This command is used to send a government announcement to all server players.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /duty
docs.text:
For a department member to be able to apply sanctions to players who break the rules, they need to equip themselves. To do this, use the /duty command.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /lawyer
docs.text:
• Using this command you will sell release warrants to lawyers. The command uses two parameters, the name or ID of the lawyer to whom you want to sell the release warrant and the price of the warrant.
  • The price of a release warrant can be minimum $5,000 and maximum $20,000.
  • To sell a warrant you need 15 accept points.
  • The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /tazer
docs.text:
The /tazer command installs a shock absorber on the pistol. When you shoot a suspect with the pistol, having the shock absorber installed, the suspect is immobilized for 8 seconds.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /opengate
docs.text:
It is a command used to open a certain gate in the prison. A single parameter is used to complete the command, namely the ID of the gate you want to open.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /frisk
docs.text:
To find out what items a player has, use the /frisk command. This displays the weapons a player has and other quantities such as drugs and materials.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /backup
docs.text:
If a department member needs help against criminals, they can use this command, all police units are notified and all members of these units get a red point set on the map to lead them to the one in need of help.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /cbackup
docs.text:
This command cancels a help request initiated by the /backup command.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /ram
docs.text:
The command has the same effect as the /enter command, but is only used if a police member needs to enter a faction/house to catch a criminal.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /jaillist
docs.text:
Typing the command will display some details about all prisoners logged on the server at that time.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /untie
docs.text:
A police officer can release a player tied by gangsters following a kidnapping.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /startradar & /stopradar
docs.text:
The commands are used only inside a police vehicle. The /startradar command uses one parameter, the maximum allowed speed. Example: /startradar 130 - will set the radar speed limit to 130km/h. The /stopradar command will deactivate the radar.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD

docs.title: /ticket
docs.text:
Server police officers use this command to issue fines to players. It uses a single parameter, the ID or name of the player to whom you want to issue the fine.

Example: /ticket 130 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD

docs.title: /radars
docs.text: The /radars command is available to rank 4+ members from LSPD, LVPD and SFPD factions which will display an informative table about all placed radars (police officer name, faction, placement area and imposed speed limit).

docs.title: /ms
docs.text:
Typing this command will send a specific message to the criminal, informing them that they are being pursued by a police member and must immediately pull over or surrender. For the message to be sent successfully to the criminal, you must be near them and have an active checkpoint generated by the /find command on the tracked player.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /shield
docs.text: With this command you can buy, use or remove a defense shield. * To buy a shield, type the command "/shield buy" while in a department's weapon depot (armoury). * To use a shield, you will need to type the command "/shield use" and a shield will attach to the skin. * To remove the shield from the skin (and its effect), you can type the command "/shield remove". * A police officer can own a maximum of one shield, and the price of a shield is $500. * The presence of the shield will absorb 100 damage units (equivalent to armor) and only if the damage is caused by bullet weapons (not explosions). * The shield will disappear if the police officer enters a vehicle. * The police officer cannot run constantly while having an active shield, periodically they will be blocked due to "fatigue".

docs.title: /ftalkpower
docs.text: Through this command a member with rank 5+ can disable faction chat for members with lower rank than the one chosen by them.

docs.title: /fwithdrawpower
docs.text: Through this command the faction leader can set the minimum rank for withdrawing money, drugs and materials from HQ.

docs.title: /tduty
docs.text: Through this command those who are designated with the tester function by the faction leader can go on duty to be able to perform faction entry tests.

docs.title: Mayor
docs.text: Faction Logo HQ Location HQ

docs.title: General Description
docs.text: The Mayor, a position that only a person respected by other players could hold. Seriousness perfectly describes this position. You can obtain it by participating in monthly elections. In general, a mayor financially helps newcomers and occasionally gets involved in organizing events. Any player can become mayor for a month, only if they meet certain imposed conditions. The central element that defines a mayor is the desire to help and offer the best for the server's players. City Hall is located in the south of Los Santos city, right next to the police headquarters and manages all 3 cities (Los Santos, Las Venturas and San Fierro). For travel and to carry out activities, the mayor has a limousine (Stretch model), which is parked in front of City Hall. Although City Hall actually represents a faction, the mayor is not allowed to invite other players into it.

docs.title: Skin ID 9 - Female
docs.text: Female skin

docs.title: Stretch
docs.text:
Stretch
  • Vehicle: ID 409
  • Color: ID 1
  • Number of vehicles: 1
  • Maximum speed: 168 KM/h
  • Available in Dealership: Yes

docs.title: /fvr
docs.text: By executing the command, all unoccupied faction vehicles will be respawned. The command is accessible from rank 5 in any faction.

docs.title: /clothes
docs.text: To change your skin according to your rank, any faction member can use the /clothes command only if they are in a clothing store.

docs.title: /tog
docs.text: This command allows activating/deactivating the display of details that the server generates when someone uses the /charity command.

docs.title: /gov
docs.text: This command is used to send a government announcement to all server players.

docs.title: /viewtax
docs.text: The command displays to the mayor the amount of money present at that moment in City Hall's safe.

docs.title: /givetax
docs.text:
This command will send money from City Hall's safe to players with levels between 2 and 7. Also, the mayor will be able to offer a limited amount from the allocated budget to beginners by specifying it as a parameter of the /givetax command. The custom amount cannot exceed the total budget and cannot be less than the total number of beginners who could receive the money. If no parameter is specified, the command will distribute the entire budget to beginners. City Hall's safe can allow a maximum amount of $500,000.

Note: If a player has multiple accounts with levels between 2 and 7 on the same IP, only 2 accounts will receive the money.

docs.title: /settax
docs.text: It is a command used by the mayor to set the tax that each player pays at each payday to City Hall. The tax can be between $1 and $100.

docs.title: National Guard
docs.text: Department Logo HQ Location HQ Soldier

docs.title: General Description
docs.text:
National Guard, a military institution, located in the heart of the Las Venturas desert, in Area 51, ensures control in critical situations. Organized and strategically deployed interventions lead to successful mission completion and danger elimination. Being equipped with fighter jets, Hunter helicopters and vehicles that can cross any terrain and weather, department members arrive on time anywhere, anytime. To enter this army you must have appropriate behavior and language. National Guard has 2 types of training to teach you how to manage in the air, as well as in handling weapons. If you manage to enter this department as rank 1 you will deal with order and discipline in prison. What exactly does this mean? You need to make sure that prisoners receive water/food whenever needed, open their cells at a certain time interval for a break, and so on. Also, prisoners can be punished. If they hit each other, if they hit the bars, they will be punished according to the severity of the situation.

After you manage to advance in rank, namely rank 2+, you will have the opportunity to go after criminals who rob the bank or those who do not cooperate when you are in pursuit of them. Over time, you have the opportunity to advance in rank, but for this you must have seniority, special behavior, appropriate language and be able to work in a team regardless of the situation.

docs.title: /fvr
docs.text: By executing the command, all unoccupied faction vehicles will be respawned. The command is accessible from rank 5 in any faction.

docs.title: /clothes
docs.text: To change your skin according to your rank, any faction member can use the /clothes command only if they are in a clothing store.

docs.title: /m
docs.text:
Using this command, a member of police departments can send a visible message at a certain radius containing the name and rank held by the department member.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /su
docs.text:
This command is used by law enforcement on servers to give a certain level of pursuit (wanted) to players. The command has a single parameter, namely the suspect's name or ID.

Example: /su Adi007 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /mdc
docs.text:
The command provides information about a player's criminal record. It has a single parameter, the name or ID of the player you want to check. The server will display the player's name, total crimes committed on the server, wanted level, total arrests, number of crimes for which they have not yet been sent to prison, information about each active unpunished crime and the number of police officers currently pursuing the suspect. To use the command you must be in any department vehicle, in a personal vehicle if you are a rank 3+ member, or in the prison compound.

Example: /mdc Nic.eXe Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /arrest
docs.text:
Has a single parameter, the name or ID of the player you want to check. Example: /arrest Nic.eXe By using this command, a player with a wanted level can be sent to prison. For a player to be arrested, a department member must use this command while in the prison compound or in a department vehicle, near the special marker of the department headquarters, together with the suspect.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /wanted
docs.text:
This command provides the user with a list of information about all suspects on the server.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /nearwanted
docs.text:
This command provides the user with a list of information about suspects on the server located near their location.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /clear
docs.text:
Used to remove a player's wanted level. The command uses one parameter, the name or ID of the player whose record you want to clear.

Example: /clear Adi007 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /cuff & /uncuff
docs.text:
By using the /cuff command, a member of a police department can handcuff a player. By using the /uncuff command, a player can be released from handcuffs. Both commands have one parameter, the name or ID of the player you want to handcuff.

Example: /cuff Adi007 & /uncuff Adi007 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /punish
docs.text:
The /punish command is used to immobilize a player in prison. The command has a single parameter, the player's name or ID, with the server automatically setting the suspect's punishment. When you punish a prisoner you will receive $600 for each /punish you issue.

Example: /punish Adi007 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /confiscate
docs.text:
With this command, you can confiscate drugs, materials and weapons from a player.

The command uses two parameters, the name or ID of the player from whom you want to confiscate an item and the name of the object you are going to confiscate.

Example: /confiscate Madalin Weapons Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard. The National Guard faction is limited compared to police departments.

docs.title: /gov
docs.text:
This command is used to send a government announcement to all server players.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /duty
docs.text:
For a department member to be able to apply sanctions to players who break the rules, they need to equip themselves. To do this, use the /duty command.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /lawyer
docs.text:
• Using this command you will sell release warrants to lawyers. The command uses two parameters, the name or ID of the lawyer to whom you want to sell the release warrant and the price of the warrant.
  • The price of a release warrant can be minimum $5,000 and maximum $20,000.
  • To sell a warrant you need 15 accept points.
  • The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /tazer
docs.text:
The /tazer command installs a shock absorber on the pistol. When you shoot a suspect with the pistol, having the shock absorber installed, the suspect is immobilized for 8 seconds.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /opengate
docs.text:
It is a command used to open a certain gate in the prison. A single parameter is used to complete the command, namely the ID of the gate you want to open.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /frisk
docs.text:
To find out what items a player has, use the /frisk command. This displays the weapons a player has and other quantities such as drugs and materials.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /backup
docs.text:
If a department member needs help against criminals, they can use this command, all police units are notified and all members of these units get a red point set on the map to lead them to the one in need of help.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /cbackup
docs.text:
This command cancels a help request initiated by the /backup command.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /ram
docs.text:
The command has the same effect as the /enter command, but is only used if a police member needs to enter a faction/house to catch a criminal.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /jaillist
docs.text:
Typing the command will display some details about all prisoners logged on the server at that time.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /untie
docs.text:
A police officer can release a player tied by gangsters following a kidnapping.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /opencell & /closecell
docs.text:
These are two commands used to open or close a certain cell in the prison. A single parameter is used to complete the commands, namely the ID of the cell you want to open/close.

Note: The command is available only for National Guard members.

docs.title: /opencellsall & /closecellsall
docs.text:
These are two commands used to open or close all cells in the prison.

Note 1: The command is available only for National Guard members of rank 3+. Note 2: The commands cannot be used between XX:00-XX:11 and XX:30-XX:41.

docs.title: /ms
docs.text:
Typing this command will send a specific message to the criminal, informing them that they are being pursued by a police member and must immediately pull over or surrender. For the message to be sent successfully to the criminal, you must be near them and have an active checkpoint generated by the /find command on the tracked player.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /shield
docs.text: With this command you can buy, use or remove a defense shield. * To buy a shield, type the command "/shield buy" while in a department's weapon depot (armoury). * To use a shield, you will need to type the command "/shield use" and a shield will attach to the skin. * To remove the shield from the skin (and its effect), you can type the command "/shield remove". * A police officer can own a maximum of one shield, and the price of a shield is $500. * The presence of the shield will absorb 100 damage units (equivalent to armor) and only if the damage is caused by bullet weapons (not explosions). * The shield will disappear if the police officer enters a vehicle. * The police officer cannot run constantly while having an active shield, periodically they will be blocked due to "fatigue".

docs.title: /ftalkpower
docs.text: Through this command a member with rank 5+ can disable faction chat for members with lower rank than the one chosen by them.

docs.title: /fwithdrawpower
docs.text: Through this command the faction leader can set the minimum rank for withdrawing money, drugs and materials from HQ.

docs.title: /tduty
docs.text: Through this command those who are designated with the tester function by the faction leader can go on duty to be able to perform faction entry tests.

docs.title: News Reporters
docs.text: Faction Logo HQ Location HQ

docs.title: General Description
docs.text:
The daily activity of reporters is represented by writing newspapers, editing breaking news, interviewing players and, occasionally, organizing unique contests.

The News Reporters faction has earned respect through the way it handles certain situations, but also through the good upbringing of its members, who prove their seven years at home every time they have the opportunity, by supporting all players who need help.

Potential News Reporters recruits must be receptive throughout the testing period, be very attentive to behavior and the way they speak with others. Also, all applicants need, mandatory, the basic principles of the faction: respect, attention, lack of pride, the ability to write correctly from a grammatical point of view, principles without which you cannot become a News Reporters member.

docs.title: /papers
docs.text: Displays a list of all newspapers available at that moment, specifying the author, title, content and motto of the newspaper, including different buttons like "WRITE" to be able to write a new newspaper, "DELETE" for members with minimum rank 3+, who can delete a newspaper and "BRING" to pick up the respective newspaper so it can be delivered.

docs.title: /duty
docs.text: The /duty command activates certain functions for a reporter, such as the /news command.

docs.title: /news
docs.text: By using this command, a reporter sends a message that all players logged on the servers can see. There is an anti-abuse system through which you can only give 15 announcements through which you can receive money, after 15 announcements given you will no longer receive money in that hour. Also to receive salary from this command, you must give announcements in the interval 09:00 - 23:00, Romanian time.

docs.title: /live
docs.text: This command is used to add or remove someone from a live interview. Messages from the interview can be seen by all server players. The command uses as parameter the player's ID or name: Example to add/remove a person from interview: /live Adi007

docs.title: /endlive
docs.text: This command ends a live for all participants.

docs.title: /callout
docs.text: You can add a newspaper motto, next to your skin will appear a free space with a text chosen by you, by default it is "Thanks for buying my newspaper".

docs.title: /readpaper
docs.text: With this command you can read the newspaper.

docs.title: /deliver
docs.text: With this command reporters can sell newspapers to players, the price being between $1 and $100.

docs.title: Paramedics
docs.text: Faction Logo HQ Location HQ

docs.title: General Description
docs.text:
In this faction, you will be greeted by an atmosphere dominated by common sense, respect and at the same time you will be able to work as a team with the best players. It is a peaceful faction, with headquarters in the heart of Las Venturas city and its purpose is to maintain the pulse on the server.

Paramedics is led by experienced players, whose purpose is to train new players and help them in their career. This faction has special importance on the server, being the only one whose objective is to save injured people and treat them. To be able to join the faction you need a minimum level of 7, high activity, seriousness and common sense.

docs.title: Important Information
docs.text:
• If the medic transports a corpse with the same IP as his, he will not receive a point in the activity report nor money.
  • If the medic loses the vehicle in which he was transporting the corpse, it will be automatically lost and can no longer be transported.
  • If the medic fails to transport a corpse within 15 minutes, it will be automatically lost and can no longer be transported.
  • If the medic heads towards a corpse and fails to pick it up within 10 minutes, the paramedic will lose the right to pick it up, the corpse in question remaining at that location until it decomposes or another medic picks it up.
  • If the player dies (respawn from admins / killed by hitman etc.) during transport, the corpse will be automatically lost and can no longer be transported.
  • If the player dies (respawn from admins / killed by hitman etc.) while on the way to a corpse, they will lose the right to pick it up, the corpse in question remaining at that location until it decomposes or another medic picks it up.
  • If the medic leaves the vehicle with which he was transporting a corpse / heading towards a corpse for 20 seconds, he will lose the right to pick it up or the corpse will disappear if it was already in the vehicle.

  3. For a corpse transported: earning = [(15 * 65) * (0.4 + 1.5 + (4/10.0))] = 2,242$

  2. For a rehab given: earning = 1,500$ per 10 dependency points.
  3. For a corpse transported: earning = [(15 * 65) * (0.5 + 1.5 + (5/10.0))] = 2,437$

docs.title: Rank 6

  3. For a corpse transported: earning = [(15 * 65) * (0.6 + 1.5 + (6/10.0))] = 2,632$

docs.text: For a paramedic to be notified through chat with corresponding messages when someone calls an ambulance (/service medic), they must activate this function through the /duty command.

docs.title: /heal
docs.text: The command is used by any paramedic to fill a player's health percentage.

docs.title: /corpse
docs.text:
This command is used to pick up a corpse. Note: The command is used followed by the corresponding corpse ID. Corpse IDs can vary from 0 to 19.

This command can only be used if: * The medic is on duty. * The corpse ID is valid ~ the ID belongs to an existing corpse towards which another medic is not heading. * The medic is in a Romero or Raindance belonging to the faction.

docs.title: /corpses
docs.text: This command shows you all corpses generated on the map.

docs.title: /ftalkpower
docs.text: Through this command, a member with rank 5+ can disable faction chat for members with a rank lower than the one chosen by them.

docs.title: /fwithdrawpower
docs.text: Through this command, the faction leader can set the minimum rank for withdrawing money, drugs, and materials from HQ.

docs.title: /tduty
docs.text: Through this command, those designated with the tester function by the faction leader can go on duty to conduct faction entry tests.

docs.title: Corpse System
docs.text:
Corpse System
  • When a player on the server is killed by a civilian or a member of any other faction, apart from Paramedics, they will leave behind a corpse at the location where they were killed.
  • A maximum of 20 corpses can exist simultaneously. If a player is killed, but there are already 20 existing corpses on the map, that player will not leave a corpse behind.
  • These corpses can be picked up by a medic within a maximum interval of 15 minutes before decomposing.
  • The corpse will only spawn if all these conditions are met:
  • at least 1 medic is on duty
  • the killed player is in Virtual World 0 and Interior 0
  • the limit of existing corpses has not been reached (20 spawned corpses)
  • the player has not left a corpse behind for at least 10 minutes
  • neither the killed player nor the one who killed them are part of Paramedics
  • When a player who meets all the above conditions dies, Paramedics members will receive an informative message about this. The message will contain the name of the killed player, their ID, the corpse location and the command they must use to head towards that corpse.
Notification message
  • To pick up a corpse, medics must use the [/corpse] command followed by the corresponding corpse ID. Corpse IDs can vary from 0 to 19.
  • To see all corpses on the map, use the [/corpses] command.

docs.title: Red Dragon Triad
docs.text: Mafia Logo HQ Location Weapon packages by rank

docs.title: General Description
docs.text:
Red Dragon Triad is one of the most feared mafias in Las Venturas, with its headquarters near rivals. Are you ready? The best gang in Las Venturas, a gang that focuses on quality over quantity, invites you to participate in various interesting daily activities. Do you think you have what it takes? Dragon Head, the faction leader, invites you to join and become a feared dragon. Red Dragon Triad members must know what respect and seriousness mean. Anyone who doesn't respect this simple rule risks ending up swallowing cyanide, burned at the stake, or through other means of torture. The faction has an extremely spacious parking lot that can support both a large number of vehicles and a large number of bullets flying everywhere.

The main occupations of the B-Zone RPG server mafiosi are wars with other gangs. The goal of all is to gain supremacy, to occupy as many territories as possible to become a known and respected gang by others. Learn more details about gang wars on the Wars page.

docs.text:
If a mafia member needs help, they can use /backup to request help from other mafia members.

To cancel the help request, use the /cbackup command.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /tie & /untie
docs.text: Any mafioso with rank 3 or higher has the right to use these two commands. They do nothing more than kidnap, respectively release a player, with the victim being unable to move.

docs.title: /fput & /fget
docs.text:
The /fput and /fget commands use one of the following parameters:

  • materials
  • drugs

To deposit materials or drugs use the /fput command, and to withdraw use the /fget command.

Note: All applications must be submitted in English as the SF School Instructors faction is primarily an English faction. If you are Romanian and know English, then you are free to apply.

docs.title: Licenses & general description
docs.text:
SF School Instructors can hand you any of the following licenses for a sum of money fixed by the faction's regulations, which all instructors are obliged to respect:

  1. Weapon (you can own a weapon)
  2. Materials (you can purchase materials for the purpose of selling weapons or the materials procured)
  3. Fishing (allows legal fishing)
  4. Flying (allows piloting an airplane/helicopter)
  5. Sailing (allows navigating a boat)

Note: The amount of money required to obtain the above licenses differs depending on the level of the aspiring player.

docs.title: NPC license purchase or renewal
docs.text:
#1 NPC #2 Dialog for selecting the desired license and its purchase price
  • Next to the entrance to the Training Room there is an NPC from which players can purchase or renew the desired licenses directly without having to take a test for them.
  • This option is available only if the player has already tried requesting an instructor and within 5 minutes their request was not accepted by any instructor on duty.
  • If there is no instructor on duty at that time, the license purchase dialog will be displayed directly.
  • License prices are considerably higher than usual at an instructor depending on the player's level as follows:
    • Flying License:
      • Level 1-9: costs $4,500
      • Level 10-49: costs $9,000
      • Level 50+: costs $18,000
    • Sailing License:
      • Level 1-9: costs $4,250
      • Level 10-49: costs $8,500
      • Level 50+: costs $17,000
    • Fishing License:
      • Level 1-9: costs $1,250
      • Level 10-49: costs $2,500
      • Level 50+: costs $5,000
    • Weapon License:
      • Level 5-9: costs $5,000
      • Level 10-49: costs $10,000
      • Level 50+: costs $20,000
    • Materials License:
      • Level 1-9: costs $4,000
      • Level 10-49: costs $8,000
      • Level 50+: costs $16,000
  • Once the desired license is selected from the NPC dialog (see image #2), the available hours for it are automatically set to 100.

docs.title: General description
docs.text:
San Fierro Taxi is located on a mountain peak, far from the hustle and bustle of the city. San Fierro Taxi Cab Company is a taxi company that ensures safe and timely transportation anytime and anywhere. The faction headquarters is located in the south of San Fierro city, on a hill near Mount Chilliad.

When a taxi driver uses the /fare command to activate their duty function, they will receive an information table on the right side of the screen. The table includes:

  • The fare value set through the /fare command.
  • Total money earned from the ride.
  • Total kilometers traveled.
  • The name of the taxi company you are part of.

docs.title: SFPD
docs.text: Department Logo HQ Location HQ Police Officer

docs.title: General Description
docs.text:
San Fierro Police Department is a governmental institution that eliminates crime from the streets of San Fierro, with the help of modern weapons and special vehicles under their command. As with the other local departments, LS Police Department and LV Police Department, the SF Police Department faction is divided into two main teams:

  1. Traffic team
  2. S.W.A.T. team

The traffic team is responsible for traffic monitoring and fining players who press too hard on the accelerator and defy traffic rules. The S.W.A.T. team is made up of experienced detectives who have passed the rank of officers and act to catch all the criminals in the city. If you have civic sense and like to respect the law, this is your place.

1. For an arrested suspect: earnings = [2,43 * (247 + random(15) + 10 * WantedLevel)] * 1,8
  2. For a fine: earnings = 2 * fine_price
  3. For a suspect caught escaping: earnings = [2,43 * (247 + random(15) + 100)] * 1,8

docs.title: Rank 4
docs.text:
1. For an arrested suspect: earnings = [2,43 * (247 + random(15) + 10 * WantedLevel)] * 1,9
  2. For a fine: earnings = 2 * fine_price
  3. For a suspect caught escaping: earnings = [2,43 * (247 + random(15) + 100)] * 1,9

docs.title: Rank 5
docs.text:
1. For an arrested suspect: earnings = [2,43 * (247 + random(15) + 10 * WantedLevel)] * 2
  2. For a fine: earnings = 2 * fine_price
  3. For a suspect caught escaping: earnings = [2,43 * (247 + random(15) + 100)] * 2

docs.title: Rank 6 or Leader
docs.text:
1. For an arrested suspect: earnings = [2,43 * (247 + random(15) + 10 * WantedLevel)] * 2,1
  2. For a fine: earnings = 2 * fine_price
  3. For a suspect caught escaping: earnings = [2,43 * (247 + random(15) + 100)] * 2,1

Notes: * random(15) represents a random number from 1 to 15. * WantedLevel represents the number of wanted stars of the suspect.

docs.title: /fvr
docs.text: By executing the command, all unoccupied faction vehicles will be respawned. The command is accessible from rank 5 in any faction.

docs.title: /clothes
docs.text: To change your skin according to your rank, any faction member can use the /clothes command only if they are in a clothing store.

docs.title: /m
docs.text:
Using this command, a member of police departments can send a visible message at a certain radius containing the name and rank held by the department member.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /su
docs.text:
This command is used by law enforcement on servers to give a certain level of pursuit (wanted) to players. The command has a single parameter, namely the suspect's name or ID.

Example: /su Adi007 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /mdc
docs.text:
The command provides information about a player's criminal record. It has a single parameter, the name or ID of the player you want to check. The server will display the player's name, total crimes committed on the server, wanted level, total arrests, number of crimes for which they have not yet been sent to prison, information about each active unpunished crime and the number of police officers currently pursuing the suspect. To use the command you must be in any department vehicle, in a personal vehicle if you are a rank 3+ member, or in the prison compound.

Example: /mdc Nic.eXe Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /arrest
docs.text:
Has a single parameter, the name or ID of the player you want to check. Example: /arrest Nic.eXe By using this command, a player with a wanted level can be sent to prison. For a player to be arrested, a department member must use this command while in the prison compound or in a department vehicle, near the special marker of the department headquarters, together with the suspect.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /wanted
docs.text:
This command provides the user with a list of information about all suspects on the server.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /nearwanted
docs.text:
This command provides the user with a list of information about suspects on the server located near their location.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /clear
docs.text:
Used to remove a player's wanted level. The command uses one parameter, the name or ID of the player whose record you want to clear.

Example: /clear Adi007 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /cuff & /uncuff
docs.text:
By using the /cuff command, a member of a police department can handcuff a player. By using the /uncuff command, a player can be released from handcuffs. Both commands have one parameter, the name or ID of the player you want to handcuff.

Example: /cuff Adi007 & /uncuff Adi007 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /punish
docs.text:
The /punish command is used to immobilize a player in prison. The command has a single parameter, the player's name or ID, with the server automatically setting the suspect's punishment.

Example: /punish Adi007 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /confiscate
docs.text:
With this command, you can confiscate drugs, materials and weapons from a player, one of the following licenses if they have them: 1. Driver's license 2. Flying license 3. Sailing license 4. Materials license 5. Weapons license

The command uses two parameters, the name or ID of the player from whom you want to confiscate an item and the name of the object you are going to confiscate, except for the driver's license which also accepts a third parameter, the number of hours, which is implicitly 3 and can be between 1 and 5.

Example: /confiscate Adi007 Drivinglic Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /gov
docs.text:
This command is used to send a government announcement to all server players.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /duty
docs.text:
For a department member to be able to apply sanctions to players who break the rules, they need to equip themselves. To do this, use the /duty command.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /lawyer
docs.text:
• Using this command you will sell release warrants to lawyers. The command uses two parameters, the name or ID of the lawyer to whom you want to sell the release warrant and the price of the warrant.
  • The price of a release warrant can be minimum $5,000 and maximum $20,000.
  • To sell a warrant you need 15 accept points.
  • The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /tazer
docs.text:
The /tazer command installs a shock absorber on the pistol. When you shoot a suspect with the pistol, having the shock absorber installed, the suspect is immobilized for 8 seconds.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /opengate
docs.text:
It is a command used to open a certain gate in the prison. A single parameter is used to complete the command, namely the ID of the gate you want to open.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /frisk
docs.text:
To find out what items a player has, use the /frisk command. This displays the weapons a player has and other quantities such as drugs and materials.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /backup
docs.text:
If a department member needs help against criminals, they can use this command, all police units are notified and all members of these units get a red point set on the map to lead them to the one in need of help.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /cbackup
docs.text:
This command cancels a help request initiated by the /backup command.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /ram
docs.text:
The command has the same effect as the /enter command, but is only used if a police member needs to enter a faction/house to catch a criminal.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /jaillist
docs.text:
Typing the command will display some details about all prisoners logged on the server at that time.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /untie
docs.text:
A police officer can release a player tied by gangsters following a kidnapping.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /startradar & /stopradar
docs.text:
The commands are used only inside a police vehicle. The /startradar command uses one parameter, the maximum allowed speed. Example: /startradar 130 - will set the radar speed limit to 130km/h. The /stopradar command will deactivate the radar.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD

docs.title: /ticket
docs.text:
Server police officers use this command to issue fines to players. It uses a single parameter, the ID or name of the player to whom you want to issue the fine.

Example: /ticket 130 Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD

docs.title: /radars
docs.text: The /radars command is available to rank 4+ members from LSPD, LVPD and SFPD factions which will display an informative table about all placed radars (police officer name, faction, placement area and imposed speed limit).

docs.title: /ms
docs.text:
Typing this command will send a specific message to the criminal, informing them that they are being pursued by a police member and must immediately pull over or surrender. For the message to be sent successfully to the criminal, you must be near them and have an active checkpoint generated by the /find command on the tracked player.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /shield
docs.text: With this command you can buy, use or remove a defense shield. * To buy a shield, type the command "/shield buy" while in a department's weapon depot (armoury). * To use a shield, you will need to type the command "/shield use" and a shield will attach to the skin. * To remove the shield from the skin (and its effect), you can type the command "/shield remove". * A police officer can own a maximum of one shield, and the price of a shield is $500. * The presence of the shield will absorb 100 damage units (equivalent to armor) and only if the damage is caused by bullet weapons (not explosions). * The shield will disappear if the police officer enters a vehicle. * The police officer cannot run constantly while having an active shield, periodically they will be blocked due to "fatigue".

docs.title: /ftalkpower
docs.text: Through this command a member with rank 5+ can disable faction chat for members with lower rank than the one chosen by them.

docs.title: /fwithdrawpower
docs.text: Through this command the faction leader can set the minimum rank for withdrawing money, drugs and materials from HQ.

docs.title: /tduty
docs.text: Through this command those who are designated with the tester function by the faction leader can go on duty to be able to perform faction entry tests.

  • SF Police Department Logs
  • SF Police Department Applications List

docs.title: Sons of Anarchy
docs.text: Faction Logo Los Santos Garage Las Venturas Garage San Fierro Garage Weapon Packages by Rank

docs.title: General Description
docs.text:
Sons of Anarchy is a faction based on motorcycle club activities, the faction's main activity is stealing motorcycles to impose respect throughout San Andreas state. They also deal with "squeezing" impostors who dare to wear their clothes, leaving them naked and robbed. The faction has three garages where they can deliver stolen motorcycles (Los Santos garage see image #2, Las Venturas garage see image #3, San Fierro garage see image #4). Faction members must have the necessary knowledge to start a motorcycle engine without having the key (skill 4 at the Car Jacker job). Also, if they don't want to be caught and arrested, they will have to be careful around them before stealing a motorcycle, otherwise they risk being chased and imprisoned for their deed. At the same time, faction members benefit from 4 weapon packages (see image #5) to have them if needed in case they are targeted by department members for the illegalities they commit.

Note: You will receive the Sawn-off-Shotgun weapon only once, meaning in one hand only, you will not receive them in both hands.

docs.title: Southern Pimps
docs.text: Faction Logo HQ Location Weapon packages by rank

docs.title: General Description
docs.text:
Southern Pimps is a gang of American origin located in the south of Las Venturas in the Blackfield Chapel area. The gang was founded by Jizzy in 1995, who, together with a few boys, started robbing banks, casinos, bars and trafficking weapons and drugs. Over time it expanded, and the number of members grew considerably.

Gang members are engaged in the same old habits, but also in conquering rival gang territories. The gang is led by Pimp Boss and his assistant, Pimp. Depending on your seniority and behavior in the gang you are promoted in rank and can receive functions such as trainer or group Leader. Members with more than three months of seniority are core members, and they can attack rival gang territories and are part of the gang's 'tester' team.

To be part of this gang you must be capable of teamwork, show seriousness, activity and common sense, and when it recruits you must make an application on the website where you demonstrate to the Leader that you deserve a chance; once accepted you will be subject to two tests, the one in the rules and the weapons one; if you pass these tests brilliantly, you will be on probation for two weeks.

The main occupations of the mafiosi of B-Zone RPG servers are wars with other gangs (wars). The goal of all is to gain supremacy, to occupy as many territories as possible to become a known and respected gang by others. Find out more details about wars between gangs on the Wars page.

docs.title: /tie & /untie

To deposit materials or drugs the /fput command is used, and to take them the /fget command is used.

docs.title: The Tsar Bratva
docs.text: Faction Logo Weapon packages by rank

docs.title: General Description
docs.text:
The Tsar Bratva is a criminal organization being at the same time one of the main criminal groups that make up the Russian Mafia, primarily composed of bandits of Slavic origin, dating back to the 20th century, in the Soviet Union area. Developing progressively and reaching expansion following the mastery of the Russian system, these groups have spread all over the world.

Tsar Bratva was among the first gangs to appear, functioning by respecting the spheres of influence of the areas, by respecting and adaptability to new conditions. An important characteristic for Tsar Bratva is the interconnections with political power, also having business relationships with various organizations.

Tsar Bratva is located in the north of Las Venturas, having as rivals Red Dragon Triads and Southern Pimps, conducting a bitter fight with them for the domination of the city.

The main occupations of the mafiosi of B-Zone RPG servers are wars with other gangs (wars). The goal of all is to gain supremacy, to occupy as many territories as possible to become a known and respected gang by others. Find out more details about wars between gangs on the Wars page.

earning = (6300 + random(15)) * (2,1 + coeficient_earning + coeficient_best)

Note:

  • random(15) represents a random number from 1 to 15.
  • coeficient_earning has the value 0 if the turf is lost, or the value 0,5 if the turf is won.
  • coeficient_best has the value 1 for the player who took best and the value 0 for the rest of the players.

docs.title: /fvr
docs.text: By executing the command, all unoccupied faction vehicles will be respawned. The command is accessible from rank 5 in any faction.

docs.title: /clothes
docs.text: To change your skin depending on the rank held, any member of a faction can use the /clothes command and only if they are in a clothing store.

docs.title: /order
docs.text:
The command is used by the mafiosi of the servers to order a certain package of weapons (the weapon packages are available depending on the rank of the mafioso). A single parameter is used in completing the command, the ID of the weapon package.

Note: There are a total of 4 weapon packages. The weapons contained in each package are listed in the image on the right.

docs.title: /backup & /cbackup
docs.text:
In case a member of a mafia needs help, they can use /backup to ask for help from other members of the mafia. To cancel the help request, use the /cbackup command.

Note: The command is available for LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, FBI and National Guard.

docs.title: /tie & /untie
docs.text: Any mafioso with rank 3 or higher has the right to use these two commands. They do nothing but kidnap, respectively release a player, the victim being unable to move.

docs.title: /fput & /fget
docs.text:
The /fput and /fget commands use one of the following parameters:

materials drugs

To deposit materials or drugs the /fput command is used, and to take them the /fget command is used.

docs.title: /stealers
docs.text: The command displays a list of information about all thieves of faction vehicles, active at that moment.

docs.title: /ftalkpower
docs.text: Through this command a member with rank 5+ can disable the faction chat for members with rank lower than the one chosen by him.

docs.title: /fwithdrawpower
docs.text: Through this command the faction Leader can set the minimum rank for extracting money, drugs and materials from HQ.

docs.title: /tduty
docs.text: Through this command those who are designated with the function of tester by the faction Leader can put themselves on duty to be able to perform faction entry tests.

docs.title: Tow Truck Company
docs.text: Faction Logo HQ Location HQ

docs.title: General Description
docs.text:
Did you run out of gas? Car broke down? Tow Truck Company always has qualified and well-trained mechanics to help you anywhere and anytime. Your car will be towed and you won't be late for work. Each mechanic is carefully examined by supervisors to offer you and other players services at a high quality.

The main occupation of the members of this faction is to clear the streets of illegally parked vehicles and tow them to a safe area. Also, the mechanics from Tow Truck Company also deal with auto repairs and increasing fuel reserves. Occasionally, meetings are held between faction members to have debates about the activity reports of members as well as possible promotions.

docs.title: Verdant Family
docs.text: Faction Logo HQ Location Weapon packages by rank

docs.title: General Description
docs.text:
Verdant Family is a family of Italian origin located in the city of Los Santos. This family has illegal occupations such as assassinating people who wish it harm, trafficking in weapons and drugs, money laundering and the battle for control of the city. Every new member recruited by "Capo Crimini" is properly received. To occupy a place in the bosom of the family you must have respect and seriousness. If you have been accepted you must take two tests, one theoretical and one practical. The mafia places special emphasis on both tests, which means that to be a good mafioso you must understand that the theoretical test is important, and the practical one is crucial.

The main occupations of the mafiosi of B-Zone RPG servers are wars with other gangs (wars). The goal of all is to gain supremacy, to occupy as many territories as possible to become a known and respected gang by others. Find out more details about wars between gangs on the Wars page.

docs.text: Mafia logo HQ Location Weapon packages by rank

docs.title: General description
docs.text:
Vietnamese Boys is a mafia originating from Vietnam, with its location in the west of Los Santos city. The gang has the following illegal occupations: theft, money laundering, killing people who violate their territory, arms and drug trafficking, kidnapping people. All gang members are carefully recruited by the "President", assisted by the "Right Hand", "Brigadier" and "Assault Man" in testing them. The experience, common sense and professionalism of the members have brought respect to this gang, making it a feared gang that can gather all the glory and esteem of a city like Los Santos.

The main occupations of the mafia members on B-Zone RPG servers are wars with other gangs (wars). Everyone's goal is to gain supremacy, to occupy as many territories as possible to become a known and respected gang by others. Find out more details about gang wars on the Wars page.
