docs.title: General Description - Houses
docs.text:
House Exterior House 3D Text
  • Any player who has at least level 3 can purchase a house.

  • Each house has an informational text placed next to the entrance door. Looking at the informational text you will find out the following aspects about that house:

    • The ID of the respective house, located on the first line of the paragraph (House 442, where 442 is the house ID).
    • The name of the respective house, located on the second line of the paragraph (House Name, where House Name is the name set by the owner).
    • Whether the respective house is for sale (This house is for sale) or not.
    • The name of the house owner (Owner: Nic.eXe, where Nic.eXe is the owner's name).
    • The level you need to be able to buy the respective house (Level: 7, where 7 is the level required to purchase the house).
    • The price of the house, being displayed only if the owner has put the house for sale (Price: $800.700, where $800.700 is the house price).
    • Whether the house owner has offered the possibility of renting the house. (Rent: $100, where $100 is the amount of money you will pay each PayDay if you rented that house).

Note: The rent price varies depending on the owner, from $0 to $1000.

  • For a player to keep the house on their account, they need a minimum of 20 real hours played for regular houses. For level 999 houses from the shop, you only need a minimum of 10 real hours played.
  • If you do not have this minimum at the end of the month, your house will be taken from your account by the state.

docs.title: Useful Commands - Houses
docs.text:
House Exterior Informational Text House Lift

The houses on our servers are designed in RPG style, which means they closely mimic real houses.

B-Zone provides you with the possibility to buy a house, sell a house, the possibility to rent it, and why not, it offers you a perfect place to relax by sleeping, using the /sleep command.

  • Only tenants and the house owner are allowed to use the /tenants and /sleep commands.
  • Only the house owner is allowed to use the /open, /setrentable, /setrent, /evict, /evictall, /sellhousetostate, /houseprice, /housewithdraw, /houseupgrade commands.
  • If the house door is not locked by its owner, absolutely any player is allowed to use the /heal, /enter and /exit commands. If the door is locked, the commands are only available to tenants and the owner.
  • The furniture inside a house will become invisible to all players if the property owner receives wanted (wanted level).
  • The owner of a property will not be allowed to use commands for adding or editing furniture elements if they have at least 1 wanted star.

Below you can find all the house control commands.

docs.title: /enter
docs.text: The /enter command is usually used to enter buildings, in this case, houses. The command is executed successfully (you will manage to enter the house) only if you are close enough to the door of the respective building. For faster execution, you can use the equivalent of this command, namely the "F" key on your keyboard.

docs.title: /exit
docs.text: The /exit command is usually used to exit a building, in this case, a house. The command is executed successfully (you will manage to exit the house) only if you are close enough to the exit door. For faster execution, you can use the equivalent of this command, namely the "F" key on your keyboard.

docs.title: /open
docs.text:
With the help of this command you can lock and unlock your own house. If you choose to lock the house, the only players who will be able to continue entering the house are the tenants and the owner.

You can benefit from this command only if you are the owner of a house. For successful execution of the command, you must be inside the house as close as possible to the exit door, or outside it, as close as possible to the entrance door.

docs.title: /setrentable
docs.text: The command tells the server whether you want players to be able to become your tenants. To offer the house for rent, use the command "/setrentable Yes", otherwise use "/setrentable No".

docs.title: /setrent
docs.text:
Using this command, you can set the house rental price. Each tenant you have who is online (connected to the server) at PayDay will have the respective amount of dollars deducted, the money will be deposited in the house safe. The command is executed correctly and successfully only if you have chosen a price between $0 and $1000.

Note: You are allowed to use the command only if the "/setrentable Yes" command function is enabled.

docs.title: /tenants
docs.text: The command will display both the number and names of all tenants online (on the server) at the time of typing the command. Only tenants and the house owner have access to using this command.

docs.title: /evict
docs.text:
The command has the effect of breaking the house rental contract with a tenant and is available to any house owner. For correct and successful execution of the command, use it in the following two ways: /evict or /evict .

Example: Consider the player Adi007 as being the tenant of a house and having ID 12. Therefore, the house owner will break the rental contract with Adi007 using one of the following examples: /evict Adi007 or /evict 12.

docs.title: /evictall
docs.text: The command has the effect of breaking the house rental contract with absolutely all tenants that the house is hosting at the time of using it.

docs.title: /sellhousetostate
docs.text: After using this command, you will sell the house to the state, the only money you will receive being the one in the house safe, only if it is not empty.

docs.title: /houseprice
docs.text:
The correct use of the command will lead to activating the possibility for a server player to buy your house in exchange for the amount of money you have set.

Example: "/houseprice 15000" will set the house price to $15,000.

The minimum price you can set for your own house is represented by the product between the house level and the number 1,000.

Example: If you own a house that has level 15, the minimum price you can set is 15 multiplied by 1,000, which is $15,000

The maximum price you can set for your own house is represented by the product between the house level and the number 200,000.

Example: If you own a house that has level 15, the maximum price you can set is 15 multiplied by 200,000, which is $3,000,000

This command offers you the chance that your property can be sold even if you are offline. The money will enter your bank account.

docs.title: /heal
docs.text: To use the command you must be inside a house that you own or have been a tenant of for at least 10 minutes. After executing it, you will have 100 health points (HP). If the player typing the command is part of a department and at the same time the house has the "armour upgrade", they will have 100 health points and 100 armour points.

docs.title: /sleep
docs.text:
The command is designed to mimic sleeping, thus, by using the command, a specific animation will be applied to your character. When you sleep, other players will see in certain situations, next to your name, the text "(AFK)". Examples of commands that experience the described situation: /id, /members, /clanmembers, etc.

If you sleep at PayDay time, you will receive the respect point needed to advance in level, but the number of hours played will not increase.

The command does not work near the house exit door and not if you are wanted by the police or have committed a crime in the last 60 seconds since typing the command. No player will be able to kill you while you sleep.

docs.title: /houseupgrade
docs.text:
The command will display a simple menu from where you can renovate your house. Currently, with the help of this menu you will be able to add the possibility to increase health and armour reserves, add decorative objects (furniture) and activate the possibility to play a radio station inside the house.

The Heal and Armour functions are put into effect when a player uses the "/heal" command in the house. Each object selected from the menu will cost $1,000. House upgrades will be lost when selling the house. Players will be able to add up to 170 objects maximum in the house.

docs.title: /removefurniture
docs.text: By typing this command, all furniture items added through the /houseupgrade command will be removed. The money spent on the furniture to be removed will not be refunded.

docs.title: /editfurniture
docs.text: Using this command, the server will display a list of all furniture objects you have added to the house. By clicking on one of the objects in the list, you will be able to remove that object or edit its position. The order of displaying objects in the menu is from the newest added to the oldest added.

docs.title: /defaultfurniture
docs.text: By typing this command, you can choose between creating or destroying the decorative objects of the property (the initial ones, not those created by you). For the change to take effect, you will need to leave the server and reconnect to it. It is possible that the initial objects of a house cannot be affected by this command (you cannot hide them).

docs.title: /housewithdraw
docs.text:
The command has the effect of withdrawing money from the house safe, money produced from the rent that tenants pay at each PayDay.

To find out what amount of money you have in the house safe, type the command /housewithdraw, without specifying the amount you want to withdraw from the safe.

If you want to withdraw a certain amount of money, type the command following this model: "/housewithdraw 500", will withdraw $500 from the house safe.

For correct and successful execution of the command, you must be inside the house as close as possible to the exit door.

docs.title: /houseinfo
docs.text:
To use the command you do not need to be near the house or inside it, the command being usable anywhere you are if you are the owner of a house.

By typing the command, the server will show you some details about your house:

  • The house level.
  • The number of tenants connected to the server.
  • Whether the house is rentable or not. If it is rentable, the rent value you have set using the /setrent command will appear.
  • Whether the respective house is locked or not.
  • The minimum value for which the house can be sold.
  • The value of the tax charged by the state (the money you will not receive when someone buys your house, but it will be deducted from the buyer's account). The tax value is equal to the product between the house level and the number 100. Example (house with level 15): 15 multiplied by 100, so the tax is $1,500.
  • The house name, set by its owner.

docs.title: /houseradio
docs.text: Using this command, the owner of a house will be able to play a radio station or a YouTube link in their own property. When a player enters that house, they will hear the radio station or YouTube soundtrack that have been set by the owner. By using the /houseradio command inside a property that does not belong to you, you will be able to control your ability to hear audio streams from inside houses. Also, sound playback can be stopped by the owner using this command.

docs.title: /housename
docs.text:
Using this command, the owner of a house will be able to set a house name that will be visible to all players who are around that house.

Note: Using vulgar/offensive texts is punishable by admins.

docs.title: /lift
docs.text: This system allows players to teleport between various areas of the house (roof, parking, depending on availability). Only the owner and tenants of a house that has a lift will be able to use the /lift command.

docs.title: Archeologist
docs.text:
Archaeological procedure #1 /getjob location #2 Artifact collection interface #4 Selling interface at the Egyptian Merchant #5

The job location can be viewed in image #2. The Archeologist job consists of finding artifacts from various specific locations for artifact localization (see images #3 and #4), respectively following cleaning and conservation procedures specified in each archaeologist's unique procedure (see image #1), after conserving the artifact it must be delivered to the Egyptian Merchant (see image #5).

docs.title: General characteristics
docs.text:
• The job is legal, located in Las Venturas city in the Lil' Probe Inn area (near the National Guard HQ) and you can work here starting at level 3.
  • The job has three main activities:
    • actual artifact localization
    • following the artifact collection and conservation procedure
    • selling it to the Egyptian Merchant
  • You can hold a maximum of 10 artifacts at the same time, then you will need to sell them if you want to create more. They can all be sold at once.
  • There are four artifact categories, each category having 10 nationalities (Romanian, Moldovan, Egyptian, Russian, Ukrainian, Tunisian, Greek, Italian, Spanish and Chinese).
  • The job gives you 1 XP for marathon if it is active and 1 XP for clan for each artifact sold.
  • You can work at this job while having wanted level.
  • You can view the number of artifacts you have through the commands /inventory, /inventar, /backpack or /inv if you have at least skill 3 at this job or at the Craftsman job.
  • The maximum skill for this job is 10.
  • If the archaeologist fails to locate the artifact and collect it within 10 minutes, they will fail to collect it.

docs.title: Artifact localization time
docs.text:
The artifact localization time depends on your skill level, the required time is divided as follows:

  • Skill 1 - 19 seconds are needed to locate an artifact.
  • Skill 2 - 18 seconds are needed to locate an artifact.
  • Skill 3 - 17 seconds are needed to locate an artifact.
  • Skill 4 - 16 seconds are needed to locate an artifact.
  • Skill 5 - 15 seconds are needed to locate an artifact.
  • Skill 6 - 14 seconds are needed to locate an artifact.
  • Skill 7 - 13 seconds are needed to locate an artifact.
  • Skill 8 - 12 seconds are needed to locate an artifact.
  • Skill 9 - 11 seconds are needed to locate an artifact.
  • Skill 10 - 10 seconds are needed to locate an artifact.

docs.title: Archaeological procedure attempt limit
docs.text:
The archaeological procedure attempt limit depends on your skill level, the limit is divided as follows:

  • Skill 1 - there is 1 attempt available, otherwise the artifact will be destroyed.
  • Skill 2 - there are 2 attempts available, otherwise the artifact will be destroyed.
  • Skill 3 - there are 3 attempts available, otherwise the artifact will be destroyed.
  • Skill 4 - there are 4 attempts available, otherwise the artifact will be destroyed.
  • Skill 5 - there are 5 attempts available, otherwise the artifact will be destroyed.
  • Skill 6 - there are 6 attempts available, otherwise the artifact will be destroyed.
  • Skill 7 - there are 7 attempts available, otherwise the artifact will be destroyed.
  • Skill 8 - there are 8 attempts available, otherwise the artifact will be destroyed.
  • Skill 9 - there are 9 attempts available, otherwise the artifact will be destroyed.
  • Skill 10 - there are 10 attempts available, otherwise the artifact will be destroyed.

docs.title: Earnings and particularities by artifact
docs.text:
• Romanian Artifact: worth $350, grants 1 point of skill.
  • Moldovan Artifact: worth $500, grants 1 point of skill.
  • Egyptian Artifact: worth $650, grants 1 point of skill.
  • Russian Artifact: worth $800, grants 1 point of skill.
  • Ukrainian Artifact: worth $950, grants 2 points of skill.
  • Tunisian Artifact: worth $1,100, grants 2 points of skill.
  • Greek Artifact: worth $1,250, grants 2 points of skill.
  • Italian Artifact: worth $1,400, grants 2 points of skill.
  • Spanish Artifact: worth $1,550, grants 3 points of skill.
  • Chinese Artifact: worth $1,700, grants 3 points of skill.

Note: The above amounts represent the base value of the artifact, to this amount an additional 50% of its value is added if you have a Premium Account. The new value is determined by the formula: (base_value / 2) + base_value

docs.title: Skill advancement
docs.text:
• Skill 1 to Skill 2: you will need 50 points, for a total of 50 points.
  • Skill 2 to Skill 3: you will need 100 points, for a total of 150 points.
  • Skill 3 to Skill 4: you will need 200 points, for a total of 350 points.
  • Skill 4 to Skill 5: you will need 400 points, for a total of 750 points.
  • Skill 5 to Skill 6: you will need 750 points, for a total of 1500 points.
  • Skill 6 to Skill 7: you will need 1500 points, for a total of 3000 points.
  • Skill 7 to Skill 8: you will need 2000 points, for a total of 5000 points.
  • Skill 8 to Skill 9: you will need 3000 points, for a total of 8000 points.
  • Skill 9 to Skill 10: you will need 3000 points, for a total of 11000 points.

docs.title: Benefits for archaeologists working in San Fierro
docs.text:
• You have a 50% chance that your artifact will be upgraded to the next level. (Ex: Romanian Artifact to Moldovan).
  • At higher skill levels you will have a chance to receive a Skin Fragment:
    • Skill 1-7: 0% chance
    • Skill 8: 1% chance
    • Skill 9: 2% chance
    • Skill 10: 3% chance

docs.title: Similar posts
docs.text:
• Craftsman
  • Fisherman
  • Daily Job

docs.title: Arms Dealer
docs.text:
Job location Player working as an arms dealer

The job headquarters where you can get hired is located in the east of Los Santos city. An arms dealer performs legal work only when transporting small quantities of materials. When a worker's skill increases enough that the transported quantity becomes illegal, they will receive a certain level of wanted. Find out more details about this job below.

docs.title: General characteristics
docs.text:
• There is one materials warehouse in each city (Los Santos, Las Venturas and San Fierro).
  • Each materials warehouse sells 10 materials for $1.
  • Only quantities of materials ending in 0 can be purchased (multiples of 10: 10, 20, 30 etc).
  • Depending on skill, players can have:
    • Skill 1 - 100,000 materials
    • Skill 2 - 200,000 materials
    • Skill 3 - 300,000 materials
    • Skill 4 - 400,000 materials
    • Skill 5 - 2,147,483,640 materials
  • To increase skill, players employed in this job must use the /work command at one of the three warehouses to start transporting materials.
  • At skill 5, players will be able to use the /creategun command to create their own weapons.
  • Depending on skill, the number of materials needed to create a weapon (/creategun or /sellgun) will gradually decrease by an average of 150-200 materials per skill.
  • For each materials transport (/work), players with skill 3 and 4 will receive wanted +1 and those with skill 5 will receive wanted +3, except those who have a materials license.

docs.title: Earnings based on skill for one route
docs.text:
• Skill 1 - Approximately $1077 without bonuses. Average time to complete a route is 117 seconds.
  • Skill 2 - Approximately $1159 without bonuses. Average time to complete a route is 101 seconds.
  • Skill 3 - Approximately $1276 without bonuses. Average time to complete a route is 95 seconds.
  • Skill 4 - Approximately $1423 without bonuses. Average time to complete a route is 91 seconds.
  • Skill 5 - Approximately $1573 without bonuses. Average time to complete a route is 91 seconds.

Please note: The payment above is approximate and does not include the premium account bonus or other active bonuses on the account. Players with premium accounts receive 50% more than the base job payment.

docs.title: Routes required to advance in skill
docs.text:
• To advance from skill 1 to skill 2, a worker needs 50 routes.
  • To advance from skill 2 to skill 3, a worker needs 200 routes. (total: 250)
  • To advance from skill 3 to skill 4, a worker needs 250 routes. (total: 500)
  • To advance from skill 4 to skill 5, a worker needs 500 routes. (total: 1000)

Note: A route represents transporting materials from the warehouse to the red point on the radar.

docs.title: Benson
docs.text:
Benson
  • Maximum speed: 123 KM/h
  • Based on: 1979 Ford F-Series
  • Number of seats: 2
  • Required skill: 1, 2
  • Tunable: TransFender

docs.title: Berkley's RC Van
docs.text:
Berkley's RC Van
  • Maximum speed: 136 KM/h
  • Based on: Ford Econoline 1979 Dodge Tradesman
  • Number of seats: 4
  • Required skill: 3, 4
  • Tunable: TransFender

docs.title: Skill 5
docs.text: • Skill 5 - Any personal vehicle

docs.title: Quantities of materials needed to create weapons (/creategun or /sellgun)
Skill 1
docs.text:
• SD Pistol - 1000 materials required
  • Deagle - 1500 materials required
  • Shotgun - 2000 materials required
  • MP5 - 3000 materials required
  • AK47 or M4 - 6000 materials required
  • Rifle - 7000 materials required

docs.title: Skill 2
docs.text:
• SD Pistol - 850 materials required
  • Deagle - 1300 materials required
  • Shotgun - 1750 materials required
  • MP5 - 2750 materials required
  • AK47 or M4 - 5750 materials required
  • Rifle - 6750 materials required

docs.title: Skill 3
docs.text:
• SD Pistol - 700 materials required
  • Deagle - 1100 materials required
  • Shotgun - 1500 materials required
  • MP5 - 2500 materials required
  • AK47 or M4 - 5500 materials required
  • Rifle - 6500 materials required

docs.title: Skill 4
docs.text:
• SD Pistol - 550 materials required
  • Deagle - 900 materials required
  • Shotgun - 1250 materials required
  • MP5 - 2250 materials required
  • AK47 or M4 - 5250 materials required
  • Rifle - 6250 materials required

docs.title: Skill 5
docs.text:
• SD Pistol - 400 materials required
  • Deagle - 700 materials required
  • Shotgun - 1000 materials required
  • MP5 - 2000 materials required
  • AK47 or M4 - 5000 materials required
  • Rifle - 6000 materials required

docs.title: /work
docs.text: Using this command the server will provide you with the appropriate vehicle, depending on skill to start work. If you are not close enough to the location set as the starting point for missions, the server will guide you to this area by setting a red point on your radar.

docs.title: /getmaterials
docs.text:
This command is used by job employees near one of the three headquarters to obtain materials for personal use. Only quantities of materials ending in 0 can be purchased (multiples of 10: 10, 20, 30 etc).

Example: /getmaterials 500

docs.title: /sellmaterials
docs.text: Using this command, a player can sell a certain quantity of materials to another player, for a sum of money.

docs.title: /creategun
docs.text: To create a weapon from a certain quantity of materials, any player who has skill 5 can use the /creategun command.

docs.title: /sellgun
docs.text: This is an important command, frequently used and indispensable for the RPG server's mafia members. Using it, an arms dealer can sell a certain type of weapon to another player, for a sum of money.

docs.title: Bus Driver
docs.text: Job location #1 Job location #2 Player working as a bus driver

docs.title: General Characteristics
docs.text:
• The Bus Driver job is a legal one.
  • To become a bus driver, you need at least level 1.
  • For this job, you will use the Bus vehicle.
  • The job locations can be found on the map in images #1 and #2 (Los Santos and San Fierro).
  • You will lose the mission if you leave the vehicle and don't return to it within 20 seconds.

docs.title: Earnings
docs.text: • For each station, you will receive a random amount of money between $12 and $16.

docs.title: Bus
docs.text:
Bus
  • In-game money price: $30,000,000
  • DealerShip return: $0
  • Euro price at Kelton: 30 Euro
  • Maximum speed: 130 KM/h
  • Based on: MCI MC-8
  • Number of seats: 8
  • Required skill: Any skill
  • Tunable: TransFender

docs.title: /work
docs.text: Using this command, the server will provide you with the appropriate vehicle to start working. If you are not close enough to the designated job start location, the server will guide you to these zones by setting a red checkpoint on the map.

docs.title: /fare
docs.text: Using the /fare command, you can set a specific fare for players who board the bus. The fare is an amount between $1 and $5.

docs.title: Car Jacker
docs.text: #1 Radar Photo

docs.title: General characteristics
docs.text:
The car jacker steals public vehicles, personal vehicles, gang vehicles or department vehicles, and then delivers them to a drop-off point in one of the 3 cities.

  • There are 3 drop-off points in each city.
  • To steal vehicles, you need a driving license.
  • You must wait 5 minutes from the delivery of the last car to steal another one. The time is saved even when you leave the server.
  • The vehicles you can steal are only those corresponding to the skill you have (see below).
  • You have 20 seconds to return to the vehicle if you leave it, otherwise you will lose the run.
  • You cannot steal bicycles, boats, planes, helicopters or cars whose keys you own.
  • Using the /picklock command automatically gives you wanted 1.
  • For stealing a police vehicle, you will automatically receive wanted 3, without the right to deliver.
  • Car owners and gang members will receive specific messages when their cars are stolen.
  • Mafia members cannot steal vehicles from their own faction.
  • You cannot steal your own personal car.
  • Owners can use /locatecar to find the thief, and gang members have /stealers available.
  • Players who have a premium account receive 50% more at the end of each run.

docs.title: Earnings based on skill
docs.text:
• Skill 1 - $978
  • Skill 2 - $1070
  • Skill 3 - $1200
  • Skill 4 - $1380
  • Skill 5 - $1659

Note:

The payment above is approximate and does not include the premium account bonus or other active bonuses on the account.

Players with a premium account receive 50% more than the base job payment.

docs.title: Skill advancement
docs.text:
1. To advance from skill 1 to skill 2, you need to steal 60 vehicles.
  2. To advance from skill 2 to skill 3, you need to steal another 60 vehicles. (total: 120)
  3. To advance from skill 3 to skill 4, you need to steal another 120 vehicles. (total: 240)
  4. To advance from skill 4 to skill 5, you need to steal another 240 vehicles. (total: 480)

docs.title: Types of cars that can be stolen, by skill
docs.text:
• At skill 1, players can only steal public vehicles (found on the street; anyone can drive them).
  • At skill 2, players can only steal unlocked personal vehicles.
  • At skill 3, players can only steal gang vehicles.
  • At skill 4, players can only steal locked personal vehicles.
  • At skill 5, players can steal vehicles belonging to departments or can choose to steal vehicles available for other skills.

docs.title: /work
docs.text:
This command allows you to start working.

It must be used before stealing or breaking into (/picklock) a vehicle. It is available 5 minutes after completing the previous mission (successfully or not).

When using the command, you will receive wanted 3 if you have skill 5 and it is used on a police vehicle.

Note: You can cancel this action using the /cancel carjacker command

docs.title: /picklock
docs.text:
This command will allow you to open locked personal cars that are not being used by another driver at that moment.

Using the /work command beforehand is required.

When using the command, you will receive wanted 1.

docs.title: Car Mechanic
docs.text:
#1 Mechanic job location

The mechanic job location is situated in the north of Las Venturas city, in a specific area for this type of job. Additionally, the mechanic job has a skill system like other jobs. For more details about the car mechanic job, continue reading this article.

docs.title: General Information
docs.text:
• Once you use the /work command, you will need to go to the checkpoint placed on the server map where you will have to complete one of the 3 minigames:

    • Tow The Car: in this minigame you will need to use left/right click to control the Tow Truck until the tow hook reaches the damaged car. Be careful not to press in the wrong direction and hit the TowTruck against walls. Android players will be able to use Y/N keys instead of left/right click to control the towtruck.
    • Adjust the Oil Level: in this minigame you will need to adjust the car's oil level until it reaches the maximum level, the oil level and maximum level are randomly chosen, so you will need to decrease or increase the oil level until it reaches the maximum value. Be careful not to empty the engine of oil or overfill it.
    • Mount the Components: in this minigame you will need to mount a set of 3 components on the vehicle in the order specified by the client.

  • The job also offers a set of perks for players with high skill:

    • Change Vehicle Color: players with at least skill 6 at this job will be able to change the permanent color of their vehicle without needing to go to Car Color. They can change both Hidden and Non-Hidden colors, prices will be identical to Car Color. Money paid by players will be redirected to the business.
    • Tune The Vehicle: players with at least skill 7 at this job will be able to tune their vehicle without needing to go to a Tuning business. Money paid by players will be redirected to the nearest Tuning business at the time of purchasing components. Not all components will be available at skill 7, they will unlock gradually as you advance in skill. This perk also applies a discount for vehicle components as follows:
      • Skill 7: Front Bumper, Rear Bumper, Sideskirts, Hydraulics (5% Discount).
      • Skill 8: Roof, Front Bullbar, Hood, Lamps, Vents (10% Discount).
      • Skill 9: Spoiler, Wheels, Exhaust (15% Discount).
      • Skill 10: NOS, Paintjob, Neons (20% Discount).

  • Mechanics will be able to repair and refill themselves regardless of their skill at maximum value.

docs.title: Repair and Refill Percentage
docs.text:
• Skill 5+ will give players the ability to repair/refill the tank with the engine running.
  • HP offered for each skill is as follows:
    • Skill 1 Repair: 100 HP offered.
    • Skill 2 Repair: 200 HP offered.
    • Skill 3 Repair: 300 HP offered.
    • Skill 4 Repair: 400 HP offered.
    • Skill 5 Repair: 500 HP offered.
    • Skill 6 Repair: 600 HP offered.
    • Skill 7 Repair: 700 HP offered.
    • Skill 8 Repair: 800 HP offered.
    • Skill 9 Repair: 900 HP offered.
    • Skill 10 Repair: 1000 HP offered.
  • Fuel level is also different for each skill:
    • Skill 1: Refill without Premium Account: 55% fuel | with Premium Account: 83% fuel
    • Skill 2: Refill without Premium Account: 60% fuel | with Premium Account: 90% fuel
    • Skill 3: Refill without Premium Account: 65% fuel | with Premium Account: 98% fuel
    • Skill 4: Refill without Premium Account: 70% fuel | with Premium Account: 105% fuel
    • Skill 5: Refill without Premium Account: 75% fuel | with Premium Account: 113% fuel
    • Skill 6: Refill without Premium Account: 80% fuel | with Premium Account: 120% fuel
    • Skill 7: Refill without Premium Account: 85% fuel | with Premium Account: 128% fuel
    • Skill 8: Refill without Premium Account: 90% fuel | with Premium Account: 135% fuel
    • Skill 9: Refill without Premium Account: 95% fuel | with Premium Account: 143% fuel
    • Skill 10: Refill without Premium Account: 100% fuel | with Premium Account: 150% fuel

Calculation formula:

  • For players with Premium Account:
    • spillage_rate = (10 - current_skill) * 5
    • fuel_added = (150 - current_fuel) * (1.0 - (spillage_rate / 100))
  • For players without Premium Account:
    • spillage_rate = (10 - current_skill) * 5
    • fuel_added = (100 - current_fuel) * (1.0 - (spillage_rate / 100))

docs.title: Repair and Refill Kits
docs.text:
• To have access to your own repair and refill you need to use kits, kits have durability and will deteriorate with each use.
  • Kits can be purchased from Tow Truck Company members, if none are online you can buy them from the NPC at their HQ, a checkpoint will be positioned there if you don't have another one active already.
  • The price of kits from them is $4,000 for the repair kit and $8,000 for the refill kit if purchased from a Tow Truck Company member.
  • Kit prices at NPC are somewhat higher, differing depending on the player's skill:
    • Repair kit:
      • Skill 3: $15,000;
      • Skill 4 - 7: $12,000;
      • Skill 8 - 10: $10,000.
    • Refill kit:
      • Skill 3: $25,000;
      • Skill 4 - 7: $20,000;
      • Skill 8+: $15,000.
  • Tow Truck Company members cannot sell kits to colleagues, already having these abilities without needing a kit.
  • Kit durability depends on your skill, it will decrease with each use until it becomes unusable as follows:
    • Repair kit durability:
      • Skill 1: 14% deterioration per use.
      • Skill 2: 13% deterioration per use.
      • Skill 3: 12% deterioration per use.
      • Skill 4: 11% deterioration per use.
      • Skill 5: 10% deterioration per use.
      • Skill 6: 9% deterioration per use.
      • Skill 7: 8% deterioration per use.
      • Skill 8: 7% deterioration per use.
      • Skill 9: 6% deterioration per use.
      • Skill 10: 5% deterioration per use.
    • Refill kit durability:
      • Skill 1: 15% deterioration per use.
      • Skill 2: 14% deterioration per use.
      • Skill 3: 13% deterioration per use.
      • Skill 4: 12% deterioration per use.
      • Skill 5: 11% deterioration per use.
      • Skill 6: 10% deterioration per use.
      • Skill 7: 9% deterioration per use.
      • Skill 8: 8% deterioration per use.
      • Skill 9: 7% deterioration per use.
      • Skill 10: 6% deterioration per use.

docs.title: Points Required for Skill Advancement
docs.text:
• Skill advancement is done as follows:
    • To advance to Skill 2 you will need 50 runs (for a total of 50).
    • To advance to Skill 3 you will need 50 runs (for a total of 100).
    • To advance to Skill 4 you will need 100 runs (for a total of 200).
    • To advance to Skill 5 you will need 200 runs (for a total of 400).
    • To advance to Skill 6 you will need 250 runs (for a total of 650).
    • To advance to Skill 7 you will need 250 runs (for a total of 900).
    • To advance to Skill 8 you will need 300 runs (for a total of 1200).
    • To advance to Skill 9 you will need 350 runs (for a total of 1550).
    • To advance to Skill 10 you will need 350 runs (for a total of 1900).
  • Each job turn will offer players:
    • Skill 1 - 4: 3 skill points, 3 marathon points and 3 Clan XP.
    • Skill 5 - 6: 2 skill points, 2 marathon points and 2 Clan XP;
    • Skill 7 - 10: 3 skill points, 4 marathon points and 4 Clan XP;

docs.title: Available Vehicles
docs.text:
• The job offers a list of vehicles that will make your work easier when you advance in skill, the list is as follows:
    • Skill 1 - 2: Utility Van.
    • Skill 3 - 4: Rumpo.
    • Skill 5 - 6: Bobcat.
    • Skill 7 - 8: Burrito.
    • Skill 9 - 10: TowTruck.

docs.title: Earnings by Skill
docs.text:
• The job is profitable and can be the job of the day.
  • Other bonuses such as premium account, job of the day and job boost can be added to these amounts.
  • Job payments are as follows:
    • Skill 1: without Premium Account: $90 - $650, with Premium Account: $135 - $975.
    • Skill 2: without Premium Account: $102 - $718, with Premium Account: $153 - $1,077.
    • Skill 3: without Premium Account: $120 - $840, with Premium Account: $180 - $1,260.
    • Skill 4: without Premium Account: $145 - $1025, with Premium Account: $217 - $1,537.
    • Skill 5: without Premium Account: $185 - $1305, with Premium Account: $277 - $1,957.
    • Skill 6: without Premium Account: $225 - $1585, with Premium Account: $337 - $2,377.
    • Skill 7: without Premium Account: $280 - $1960, with Premium Account: $420 - $2,940.
    • Skill 8: without Premium Account: $335 - $2415, with Premium Account: $502 - $3,622.
    • Skill 9: without Premium Account: $415 - $2935, with Premium Account: $622 - $4,402.
    • Skill 10: without Premium Account: $510 - $3390, with Premium Account: $765 - $5,085.

docs.title: /work
docs.text: Use this command to start work at the location imposed by the server.

docs.title: /repair
docs.text: This is the command with which you repair your own vehicle using the repair kit and you have to wait 5 minutes until the next repair.

docs.title: /refill
docs.text: This is the command with which you refuel your own vehicle using the refill kit and you have to wait 5 minutes until the next refill.

docs.title: /kits
docs.text: This is the command with which you can view the durability percentage of the repair and refill kits.

docs.title: Chemist
docs.text:
#1 Working at job #2 Job payout #3 Using kits

The action of this job consists of packaging medicines and delivering them to hospitals, from where you will obtain money and, sometimes, certain medical / addiction kits.

docs.title: General Characteristics
docs.text:
• The job is located in Los Santos city in Montgomery area and can be used from level 1.
  • By typing the /work command you will start working at the job, being placed in a specially arranged interior.
  • You will need to turn on the electric generators in turn, carry some boxes into the packaging room and place them in the machine that packages them. Next you will have the mission to deliver them to a hospital and return back to the medicine factory, at which point you will receive your reward.
  • The job brings you 6XP to marathon if it is active and 6XP to clan.
  • The job can only be started with a clean record (without having wanted).

docs.title: /work
docs.text:
This command allows you to start the job.

You need to be near the job location to execute the command. If this is not the case, the server will put a checkpoint on your map, marking the place where you need to go.

docs.title: /usekit
docs.text:
This command allows you to use the kits received from the job.

You can hold medical kits that give you 100HP or addiction kits that reduce the addiction level by 30 units.

The command works even during wars.

Kits can be sold to other players through the /trade command.

Depending on the skill held, a player can hold a maximum of between 1 and 10 kits, equivalent to the skill level held.

Example:

  • Skill 1 - 1 healing kit OR 1 addiction kit
  • Skill 2 - 2 kits - 1 healing kit & 1 addiction kit OR 2 healing kits OR 2 addiction kits.

docs.title: Craftsman
docs.text:
/craft command interface #1 Craftsman job location #2 Craftsman business location #3 House Upgrade business location #4 /buy command interface in Craftsman business #5

The job location can be seen in image #2. The craftsman job consists of gathering the necessary materials to create carpentry objects, processing and transporting them to the House Upgrade business. Dexterity for creating artisan objects will be gained over time, gaining more experience and being able to craft objects of greater complexity and value.

docs.title: General characteristics
docs.text:
• The job is legal, located in San Fierro in the King's area (near Bank SF) and you can work here starting from level 5.
  • The job has four main activities:
    • renting a chisel, a chainsaw and a protective mask from the Craftsman business (ID 160)
    • gathering the necessary materials to create objects (wood, cotton, gold and silver)
    • processing the materials to create a finished product
    • delivering the finished object and returning to the initial job location
  • The rental is valid for 24 hours and is mandatory to be able to work at the job, the rental prices are as follows:
    • Chisel - $1000 for 24 hours
    • Chainsaw - $500 for 24 hours
    • Mask - $500 for 24 hours
  • Materials can be obtained by working at jobs, to be able to earn those materials you will need to have minimum skill 5 at the following jobs:
    • to obtain Wood you will have to work at the Lumberjack job
    • to obtain Cotton you will have to work at the Farmer job (planting Cacti) and then receive cotton after you harvest them
    • to obtain Gold you will have to work at the Miner job
    • to obtain Silver you will have to work at the Quarry Worker job
  • You can hold a maximum of 5 carpentry objects at the same time, then you will have to sell them if you want to create more. They can also be sold all at once.
  • There are four categories of crafts, each category having five objects (chairs, tables, accessories and doors).
  • The job brings you 20 XP for marathon if it is active and 20 XP for clan.
  • After you manage to rent the items specified above, you will have to gather the necessary materials to create that object (you can see the necessary materials and those you have through the /craft command). After you gather the necessary materials, return to the job location, use the /craft command and create the desired object by pressing the CRAFT button. You will have to deliver the manufactured object to the House Upgrade business (image #4), then return to the job location with the check received from the business manager to cash your money.
  • You will be able to create artisan objects depending on your skill level as follows:
    • between Skill 1 and Skill 3 you can only process chairs
    • between Skill 4 and Skill 6 you can process chairs and tables
    • between Skill 7 and Skill 8 you can process chairs, tables and accessories
    • between Skill 9 and Skill 10 you can process chairs, tables, accessories and doors
  • You can work at this job while having a criminal record (wanted).
  • The maximum amount of materials (gold bars/cotton/wood/silver) that the player can collect is 999.
  • You can view the amount of materials you have through the commands /inventory, /inventar, /backpack or /inv if you have at least skill 3 at this job.

docs.title: Daily Job
docs.text:
#1 Daily Job, marked in orange

The Daily Job is a new system introduced on B-Zone servers, created to double the earnings from various server jobs for a period of 24 hours.

docs.title: General characteristics
docs.text:
• It is marked differently in the server's job list (/jobs), as shown in image #1.
  • Every day at 00:00 (server time) the daily job will change to the next job in the list.
  • The daily job will offer players double earnings compared to normal.

Note:

This new earning will be added on top of the 50% bonus for Premium users as well as other active bonuses on the player's account.

The jobs Pocket Thief, Detective, Lawyer, Farmer, Bus Driver and Craftsman cannot be selected by the system for the Daily Job.

docs.title: Detective
docs.text: #1 Employment point location

docs.title: General Characteristics
docs.text:
• With the help of the Detective job you will be able to find the location of a certain player.
  • The Detective job is a legal one.
  • To become a detective, you need a minimum level of 3.
  • Players can get hired from inside the city hall in Los Santos.
  • The location of the employment point can be found on the map in image #1.

docs.title: Skill Advancement
docs.text:
1. To advance from skill 1 to skill 2 you must use the /find command 50 times.
  2. To advance from skill 2 to skill 3 you must use the /find command 50 times. (total: 100)
  3. To advance from skill 3 to skill 4 you must use the /find command 100 times. (total: 200)
  4. To advance from skill 4 to skill 5 you must use the /find command 200 times. (total: 400)

docs.title: Time limit based on skill
docs.text:
1. At skill 1, the red checkpoint will remain active for 30 seconds.
  2. At skill 2, the red checkpoint will remain active for 60 seconds.
  3. At skill 3, the red checkpoint will remain active for 100 seconds.
  4. At skill 4, the red checkpoint will remain active for 180 seconds.
  5. At skill 5, the red checkpoint will remain active permanently.

Note: At skill 1, 2, 3 and 4, the /find command can only be used once every two minutes.

docs.title: /find
docs.text:
The /find command has a single parameter, namely the ID of the player you want to search for or their name.

Example: /find Adi007

Once the command is entered, a red point will be fixed on the map. At the bottom of the screen, the server will display and periodically update the distance between the detective and the target.

Also, when entering the command, the server will provide in the chat as a message the name of the area where the target is located, as well as the city (LS, LV, SF).

docs.title: Drugs Dealer
docs.text: Job hire location (#1) Player working as a drugs dealer

docs.title: General characteristics
docs.text:
• The hiring point for this job is located at the headquarters in San Fierro (see image #1). This job is part of the illegal jobs category, which means that at some point, when you start your work, you will receive a certain wanted level. Imitating real life, when you transport smaller quantities of drugs (skill 1 and 2), the police will not detect any illegal trace in your work. However, once you advance to skill 3, the police will detect the transport you are trying to make and you will receive wanted based on your skill level). More details about this job can be found below.
  • The job consists of two components:
    • The component represented by drug transport (/work).
    • The component of the actual drug consumption system. Find more details about drugs, addiction and consumption on the Drugs page.
  • There is one Crack House (headquarters) in each city, each location can be used to start /work.
  • The limit of drugs that can be held by a player is 2147483630.
  • When typing the /work command, players with skill 3 and 4 will receive wanted +1, and those with skill 5 will receive wanted +3.

docs.title: Earnings based on skill for players without premium account (one run)
docs.text:
• Skill 1 - Approximately $973. The average time to complete a run is 98 seconds.
  • Skill 2 - Approximately $1074. The average time to complete a run is 91 seconds.
  • Skill 3 - Approximately $1203. The average time to complete a run is 80 seconds.
  • Skill 4 - Approximately $1375. The average time to complete a run is 76 seconds.
  • Skill 5 - Approximately $1548. The average time to complete a run is 57 seconds.

To remember:

The payment above is approximate and does not include the premium account bonus or other active bonuses on the account.

Players with premium accounts receive 50% more than the base job payment.

docs.title: Runs required for skill advancement
docs.text:
• To advance from skill 1 to skill 2, a worker needs 50 runs.
  • To advance from skill 2 to skill 3, a worker needs 50 runs. (total: 100)
  • To advance from skill 3 to skill 4, a worker needs 100 runs. (total: 200)
  • To advance from skill 4 to skill 5, a worker needs 200 runs. (total: 400)

Note: A run represents transporting drugs from the warehouse to the red point on the radar.

docs.title: /work
docs.text: Using this command, the server will provide you with the appropriate vehicle, depending on your skill, to start work. If you are not close enough to the location set as the starting point for missions, the server will guide you to this zone by setting a red point on your radar.

docs.title: /getdrugs
docs.text:
This command is used by job employees near one of the three headquarters, to obtain drugs for personal use purposes. Only limited quantities of drugs can be purchased, as follows:

  • Skill 1 - Cannot buy drugs from a headquarters (crack house).
  • Skill 2 - Cannot buy drugs from a headquarters (crack house).
  • Skill 3 - Maximum 25 grams of drugs per hour.
  • Skill 4 - Maximum 25 grams of drugs per hour.
  • Skill 5 - Maximum 50 grams of drugs per hour.

docs.title: /selldrugs
docs.text: Using this command, a player can sell a certain amount of drugs to another player, in exchange for a sum of money.

docs.title: Electrician
docs.text:
#1 Electrician repairing an electric pole #2 Cutting wires #3 Connecting wires #4 Voltage stabilization

The electrician job ensures quick repair and maintenance of electrical installations, ensuring efficient operation of the electrical infrastructure. They are always called where needed, to repair a pole, repair a transformer, etc.

docs.title: General Characteristics
docs.text:
• The job is located in the city of Los Santos in the Ocean Docks area and you can work on it starting with minimum level 3.
  • You will have to drive the car received from the job to the red point on the map, once you get there you have to get off and start repairing the electrical installation.
  • If you perform a wrong operation you will fail the job and an explosion will occur near you.
  • You can stop working using the [/killcp] command.
  • You can receive a random minigame between cutting wires (see image #2), connecting wires (see image #3) and voltage stabilization (see image #4). The wire cutting minigame will be available at any skill, wire connecting only at skills 4 - 10 and voltage stabilization at skills 8 - 10. The chosen minigame is random depending on the skill you have.
  • Depending on the skill you have, you will also receive 1 Skill Point/XP Marathon/XP Clan at skills 1 - 4, 2 Skill Point/XP Marathon/XP Clan at skills 5 - 6, 3 Skill Point/XP Marathon/XP Clan at skills 7 - 10.
  • The job can be started even if you have or do not have a clean record (with/without having wanted).

docs.title: Earnings and particularities based on skill
Skill 1
docs.text:
• Random between $90 and $650.
  • Sadler will be used as transport vehicle.

docs.title: Skill 2
docs.text:
• Random between $102 and $718.
  • Sadler will be used as transport vehicle.

docs.title: Skill 3

docs.title: /work
docs.text:
This command allows you to start the job.

You need to be near the job location to execute the command. If this is not the case, the server will place a checkpoint on the map, marking the place where you need to go.

docs.title: Farmer
docs.text:
Los Santos Farm #1 3D Text of parcel #2 Agricultural Business ID 158 #3 Plowing the field #4 Plant seeding menu #5

There is one farm in each city. Farmers wake up early and start working so that their skill develops day by day, thus, depending on their skill, they can plant more things. More details about the farmers' life, earnings and skill can be found below on this page.

docs.title: General Characteristics
docs.text:
• Each farm has a number of parcels (64 parcels in total).
  • A parcel consists of 16 plants.
  • A public parcel can be worked by a maximum of 5 farmers simultaneously.
  • There are two types of parcels:
    • Private Parcel - costs 200 Gold for 24 hours.
      • Los Santos - IDs from 21 to 24.
      • Las Venturas - IDs from 49 to 52.
      • San Fierro - IDs from 25 to 28.
      • The advantage of a private parcel is that it never dries out, you won't lose the rent if you don't plant and you can plant anything regardless of skill.
    • Public Parcel - costs $1000 for 24 hours.
      • Los Santos - IDs from 1 to 20.
      • Las Venturas - IDs from 53 to 64.
      • San Fierro - IDs from 29 to 48.
  • Each parcel contains a 3D text with information about it (image #2).
  • Parcels can be rented for 24 hours by going to the 3D text on the parcel and pressing the Y key.
  • From the moment of rental you have one hour to plant something or the rent will be cancelled.
  • A player can simultaneously own a private parcel and a public one.
  • After renting the parcel you must go to the Agricultural business (biz id 158, image #3) where you will need to rent the necessary tools and buy seeds.
  • Each player can hold 32 seeds of each type of plant. To view the seeds use the command /seeds.
  • The rent on tools is lost when you lose the rent on the parcel.
  • The tractor will spawn automatically when exiting the agricultural business. If you want to respawn the tractor you can select it from the biz, using the /buy command to respawn it without additional fee.
  • When getting on the tractor you will receive a checkpoint at the farm to start the plowing process.
  • The next stage is planting the seeds (image #5), and then watering them.
  • After planting you will see a HUD on the screen (image #6) with the necessary information about the parcel which can be deactivated using the /tog command.
  • The cooking process differs depending on the plant and the humidity of the plants must be monitored otherwise they will dry out.
    • If the plants have reached maturity they will no longer dry out due to humidity.
  • If the plants on the parcel dry out, the player will also lose the rent on the parcel.

Note: You have available the command (/tog) from where you can activate/deactivate the informative HUD for the parcel you own.

docs.title: Garlic
docs.text:
• Reaches maturity in 15 minutes.
  • Humidity remains at 100% for 5 minutes from the last watering, after which it will decrease to 0%.
  • The time needed for humidity to decrease from 100% to 0% is another 5 minutes.
  • After the plant reaches maturity you have 7 minutes and 30 seconds to harvest it or it will dry out over time.
  • You need at least skill 1 to be able to plant this plant.

docs.title: Fern
docs.text:
• Reaches maturity in 45 minutes.
  • Humidity remains at 100% for 15 minutes from the last watering, after which it will decrease to 0%.
  • The time needed for humidity to decrease from 100% to 0% is another 15 minutes.
  • After the plant reaches maturity you have 30 minutes to harvest it or it will dry out over time.
  • You need at least skill 2 to be able to plant this plant.

docs.title: Reed
docs.text:
• Reaches maturity in 2 hours.
  • Humidity remains at 100% for 40 minutes from the last watering, after which it will decrease to 0%.
  • The time needed for humidity to decrease from 100% to 0% is another 40 minutes.
  • After the plant reaches maturity you have 1 hour to harvest it or it will dry out over time.
  • You need at least skill 3 to be able to plant this plant.

docs.title: Mint
docs.text:
• Reaches maturity in 8 hours.
  • Humidity remains at 100% for 2 hours and 40 minutes from the last watering, after which it will decrease to 0%.
  • The time needed for humidity to decrease from 100% to 0% is another 2 hours and 40 minutes.
  • After the plant reaches maturity you have 4 hours to harvest it or it will dry out over time.
  • You need at least skill 4 to be able to plant this plant.

docs.title: Cactus
docs.text:
• Reaches maturity in 16 hours.
  • Humidity remains at 100% for 5 hours and 20 minutes from the last watering, after which it will decrease to 0%.
  • The time needed for humidity to decrease from 100% to 0% is another 5 hours and 20 minutes.
  • After the plant reaches maturity you have 8 hours to harvest it or it will dry out over time.
  • You need at least skill 5 to be able to plant this plant.

docs.title: Earnings based on skill
docs.text:
• Skill 1 - $244 base profit for each plant, +50% if you have a premium account.
  • Skill 2 - $563 base profit for each plant, +50% if you have a premium account.
  • Skill 3 - $1,050 base profit for each plant, +50% if you have a premium account.
  • Skill 4 - $2,400 base profit for each plant, +50% if you have a premium account.
  • Skill 5 - $4,200 base profit for each plant, +50% if you have a premium account.

Note: The final payment amount is calculated including Job Boost if it is active on the account.

docs.title: Skill advancement
docs.text:
Each plant offers a certain score based on which skill advancement is made:

  • Garlic: 1 point
  • Fern: 3 points
  • Reed: 8 points
  • Mint: 32 points
  • Cactus: 64 points

To advance in skill you need the following points:

  • To make the transition from skill 1 to skill 2, a worker needs 1536 points.
  • To make the transition from skill 2 to skill 3, a worker needs 6144 points.
  • To make the transition from skill 3 to skill 4, a worker needs 13824 points.
  • To make the transition from skill 4 to skill 5, a worker needs 23040 points.

docs.title: Fisherman
docs.text: #1 Map Location #2 Getjob Cabin #3 Ground Fishing HUD

docs.title: General Characteristics
docs.text:
• The job is located in every city: Los Santos, Las Venturas and San Fierro at specific fishing locations. (''image #1'').
  • The job is legal.
  • To become a fisherman, you need a minimum level of 1.
  • With the help of the ''Fisherman'' job you will be able to fish and sell caught fish in exchange for a sum of money.
  • Fish are divided into 8 levels. You will only be able to catch fish from a level equal to or lower than your fishing skill.
  • Each level contains 30 types of fish. In total, 240 fish can be caught.
  • For this job it is recommended to have a fishing license, otherwise you will be sanctioned with wanted 1 for each fish caught without having a license.
  • Each fishing attempt includes the possibility of failure and catching waste. The higher the skill, the higher the chance of success and the lower the chance of failure.
  • Multiple fish can be caught in a single fishing session, not just one.
  • At 24/7 all fish you have in your inventory will be sold.

docs.title: Success Chances Based on Skill
docs.text:
• Skill 1 - 100% Tier 1 fish.
  • Skill 2 - 20% Tier 1 fish | 80% Tier 2 fish.
  • Skill 3 - 10% Tier 1 fish | 20% Tier 2 fish | 70% Tier 3 fish.
  • Skill 4 - 5% Tier 1 fish | 10% Tier 2 fish | 25% Tier 3 fish | 60% Tier 4 fish.
  • Skill 5 - 5% Tier 1 fish | 5% Tier 2 fish | 10% Tier 3 fish | 20% Tier 4 fish | 60% Tier 5 fish.
  • Skill 6 - 3% Tier 1 fish | 5% Tier 2 fish | 10% Tier 3 fish | 15% Tier 4 fish | 25% Tier 5 fish | 42% Tier 6 fish.
  • Skill 7 - 3% Tier 1 fish | 4% Tier 2 fish | 8% Tier 3 fish | 12% Tier 4 fish | 18% Tier 5 fish | 25% Tier 6 fish | 30% Tier 7 fish.
  • Skill 8 - 2% Tier 1 fish | 3% Tier 2 fish | 6% Tier 3 fish | 9% Tier 4 fish | 15% Tier 5 fish | 20% Tier 6 fish | 25% Tier 7 fish | 20% Tier 8 fish.
  • Skill 9 - 1% Tier 1 fish | 2% Tier 2 fish | 4% Tier 3 fish | 7% Tier 4 fish | 12% Tier 5 fish | 18% Tier 6 fish | 25% Tier 7 fish | 31% Tier 8 fish.
  • Skill 10 - 1% Tier 1 fish | 2% Tier 2 fish | 3% Tier 3 fish | 6% Tier 4 fish | 10% Tier 5 fish | 15% Tier 6 fish | 22% Tier 7 fish | 41% Tier 8 fish.

docs.title: Failure Chances Based on Skill
docs.text:
• Skill 1 - 10% chance to catch waste.
  • Skill 2 - 9% chance to catch waste.
  • Skill 3 - 8% chance to catch waste.
  • Skill 4 - 7% chance to catch waste.
  • Skill 5 - 6% chance to catch waste.
  • Skill 6 - 5% chance to catch waste.
  • Skill 7 - 4% chance to catch waste.
  • Skill 8 - 3% chance to catch waste.
  • Skill 9 - 2% chance to catch waste.
  • Skill 10 - 1% chance to catch waste.

docs.title: Base Earnings for Each Tier
docs.text:
• Tier 1 Fish - $38
  • Tier 2 Fish - $76
  • Tier 3 Fish - $114
  • Tier 4 Fish - $152
  • Tier 5 Fish - $190
  • Tier 6 Fish - $228
  • Tier 7 Fish - $266
  • Tier 8 Fish - $304

Note: These amounts are the base amounts, without any bonus applied!

docs.title: Inventory Space Occupied for Each Tier
docs.text:
• Tier 1 Fish - 6 KG.
  • Tier 2 Fish - 7 KG.
  • Tier 3 Fish - 8 KG.
  • Tier 4 Fish - 9 KG.
  • Tier 5 Fish - 10 KG.
  • Tier 6 Fish - 11 KG.
  • Tier 7 Fish - 12 KG.
  • Tier 8 Fish - 15 KG.

docs.title: Inventory Limit Based on Skill
docs.text:
• Skill 1 - you have a capacity of 200 KG available.
  • Skill 2 - you have a capacity of 350 KG available.
  • Skill 3 - you have a capacity of 500 KG available.
  • Skill 4 - you have a capacity of 650 KG available.
  • Skill 5 - you have a capacity of 800 KG available.
  • Skill 6 - you have a capacity of 950 KG available.
  • Skill 7 - you have a capacity of 1100 KG available.
  • Skill 8 - you have a capacity of 1250 KG available.
  • Skill 9 - you have a capacity of 1400 KG available.
  • Skill 10 - you have a capacity of 1550 KG available.

docs.title: Inventory System
docs.text:
• All caught fish are automatically placed in the fishing inventory accessible through the command (''/jobinventory'').
  • The inventory updates in real time, therefore, it allows you to track the worn equipment, its tier, durability level and number of KG of fish caught.
  • Once the inventory is full, you need to go to a 24/7 type business to sell the caught fish and empty the inventory.

docs.title: Equipment System
docs.text:
• Players will be able to equip special fishing equipment such as: Hat, Suit, Boots, Rod and Bait, using the command [''/jobinventory''].
  • Equipment can be purchased from any 24/7 type store using the command [''/buy''] -> Fisherman Gear.
  • Players can choose the 'Buy All Gear' option to simultaneously purchase all equipment possible for their skill.
  • Hat: Tier 1 - $100 | Tier 2 - $150 | Tier 3 - $200 | Tier 4 - $250 | Tier 5 - $300 | Tier 6 - $350 | Tier 7 - $400 | Tier 8 - $450.
  • Suit: Tier 1 - $130 | Tier 2 - $180 | Tier 3 - $230 | Tier 4 - $280 | Tier 5 - $330 | Tier 6 - $380 | Tier 7 - $430 | Tier 8 - $480.
  • Boots: Tier 1 - $110 | Tier 2 - $1600 | Tier 3 - $210 | Tier 4 - $260 | Tier 5 - $310 | Tier 6 - $360 | Tier 7 - $410 | Tier 8 - $460.
  • Rod: Tier 1 - $200 | Tier 2 - $250 | Tier 3 - $300 | Tier 4 - $350 | Tier 5 - $400 | Tier 6 - $450 | Tier 7 - $500 | Tier 8 - $550.
  • Bait: Tier 1 - $50 | Tier 2 - $60 | Tier 3 - $70 | Tier 4 - $80 | Tier 5 - $90 | Tier 6 - $100 | Tier 7 - $110 | Tier 8 - $120.
  • Players will be able to purchase only equipment that is equal to or lower than their current fishing skill level.
  • Players cannot purchase duplicate equipment of the same type and level.
  • Players can purchase up to 20 baits per level. This means that a player with maximum fishing skill level can carry 160 baits simultaneously.
  • Each piece of special fishing equipment comes in 8 levels. Higher level equipment offers an increased chance to catch higher tier fish and a lower chance to catch waste.
  • Tier 1 Equipment: Each item (Hat, Suit, Boots, Rod and Bait) offers a +3% chance increase, up to a maximum of +15% chance when fully equipped.
  • Tier 2 Equipment: Each item (Hat, Suit, Boots, Rod and Bait) offers a +4% chance increase, up to a maximum of +20% chance when fully equipped.
  • Tier 3 Equipment: Each item (Hat, Suit, Boots, Rod and Bait) offers a +5% chance increase, up to a maximum of +25% chance when fully equipped.
  • Tier 4 Equipment: Each item (Hat, Suit, Boots, Rod and Bait) offers a +6% chance increase, up to a maximum of +30% chance when fully equipped.
  • Tier 5 Equipment: Each item (Hat, Suit, Boots, Rod and Bait) offers a +7% chance increase, up to a maximum of +35% chance when fully equipped.
  • Tier 6 Equipment: Each item (Hat, Suit, Boots, Rod and Bait) offers a +8% chance increase, up to a maximum of +40% chance when fully equipped.
  • Tier 7 Equipment: Each item (Hat, Suit, Boots, Rod and Bait) offers a +9% chance increase, up to a maximum of +45% chance when fully equipped.
  • Tier 8 Equipment: Each item (Hat, Suit, Boots, Rod and Bait) offers a +10% chance increase, up to a maximum of +50% chance when fully equipped.
  • All equipment has a certain durability, starting at 100% when purchased. Each time a fish is caught, the equipment's durability decreases depending on the fish level. Once an item reaches 0% durability it breaks and bonuses are no longer applied.
  • Its durability can be repaired by choosing the 'Repair Gear' option in a 24/7 type store for the price of $100 EACH at the time of equipment purchase.
  • Only equipment whose durability is below 80% can be repaired.
  • The server will automatically equip the highest level bait available from inventory. Other equipment (Hat, Suit, Boots, Rod) must be equipped manually by the player.
  • Players can track in real time the durability of each piece of fishing equipment from the inventory interface [''/jobinventory''].
  • Players can fish continuously as long as the necessary equipment is equipped.

docs.title: Ground Fishing Mechanics
docs.text:
• Players will have to control a radar marker and must keep it in the green capture zone using keys in real time.
  • A dynamic progress bar visually tracks the success of the fishing attempt.
  • Fish can now resist your pull, requiring multiple attempts to succeed.
  • Poor synchronization or deviation into orange/red zones triggers penalties or knockback effects.
  • Critical pulls offer bonus progress based on your Fishing Skill level.
  • The fish's position on the progress bar updates in real time to reflect your performance.
  • Each attempt is limited by a timer, adding urgency and pressure.
  • A higher Fishing Skill level improves radar control, increases critical pull chance, and reduces both the chance and strength of fish resistance.

docs.title: Boat Fishing Mechanics
docs.text: This method of boat fishing is more advantageous than ground fishing. It requires skill 3+ to be able to fish by boat in certain special maritime zones and a complex capture mechanic.

docs.title: Maritime Zones
docs.text: There are 9 fishing zones at sea, 3 for each main city: Los Santos, San Fierro and Las Venturas. All zones are visible on the map and offer different distributions of fish and garbage.

docs.title: Zone Types
docs.text:
• Green Zones
    • Fish that can be caught here are Tier 1-3.
    • Permitted equipment here is Tier 1-3.
    • Minimum required skill is 3.
  • Yellow Zones
    • Fish that can be caught here are Tier 4-6.
    • Permitted equipment here is Tier 4-6.
    • Minimum required skill is 4.
  • Red Zones
    • Fish that can be caught here are Tier 7-8.
    • Permitted equipment here is Tier 7-8.
    • Minimum required skill is 7.

docs.title: Boat Fishing
docs.text:
• To be able to fish by boat you need the following requirements:
    • Minimum skill 3.
    • Valid sailing license
    • Full equipment equipped before departure.
    • Inventory must be completely empty of fish.
    • At least one unit of bait (Tier 1 - 8).

docs.title: Boat Types Based on Skill
docs.text:
• Skill 3 - 4: Reefer
  • Skill 5 - 6: Dinghy
  • Skill 7 - 8: Tropic
  • Skill 9 - 10: Jetmax

docs.title: Capture Minigame
docs.text:
• The player must guide the boat to intercept fish (beware of waste).
  • Each boat has a unique collision and detection zone.
  • One bait offers a minigame, with up to 12 fish caught.
  • There is a 20% chance that the spawn will be waste.
  • Caught fish are automatically added to the respective expedition's catch.

docs.title: Boat Storage Capacity
docs.text:
• Boat capacity differs based on current job skill as follows:
    • Skill 3: 1100KG
    • Skill 4: 1400KG
    • Skill 5: 1700KG
    • Skill 6: 2000KG
    • Skill 7: 2300KG
    • Skill 8: 2600KG
    • Skill 9: 2900KG
    • Skill 10: 3200KG

docs.title: Expedition Completion
docs.text:
• An expedition ends when:
    • The boat's maximum capacity is reached.
    • The player runs out of equipment durability.
    • The player leaves the zone and chooses to end manually.

docs.title: Catch Sale
docs.text:
• Fish caught at sea can only be sold at dedicated docks in Los Santos, San Fierro and Las Venturas. These are available via GPS → Important Locations → Doc LS/SF/LV.
    • Sale is only possible if the player arrives with the expedition boat.
    • The player receives a 15% bonus compared to 24/7 stores.
    • A report is displayed with profit, total earnings and number of fish sold.

docs.title: Skill Advancement
docs.text:
• Skill advancement is done at a certain number of accumulated points calculated with the following formula: 'number_of_points' = ''Tier_XP_Factor'' x ''Fish_Quantity''.
  • The XP factor of each tier is as follows:
    • Tier 1 Fish - factor = 0.1.
    • Tier 2 Fish - factor = 0.2.
    • Tier 3 Fish - factor = 0.2.
    • Tier 4 Fish - factor = 0.3.
    • Tier 5 Fish - factor = 0.3.
    • Tier 6 Fish - factor = 0.4.
    • Tier 7 Fish - factor = 0.5.
    • Tier 8 Fish - factor = 0.6.
    • Specifically, let's say we have 5 tier 5 fish in inventory, the skill points we receive will be calculated as follows: 5 x 0.5 = 2.5 => 3 skill points.
    • If the number of points you obtain from the calculation is 0, you will receive 1 skill point.
    • The same number of points also applies to marathon points or clan xp.
  • Points required for advancement are as follows:
    • Skill 1 >> Skill 2: 50 points. (50 total)
    • Skill 2 >> Skill 3: 100 points. (150 total)
    • Skill 3 >> Skill 4: 200 points. (350 total)
    • Skill 4 >> Skill 5: 400 points. (750 total)
    • Skill 5 >> Skill 6: 750 points. (1500 total)
    • Skill 6 >> Skill 7: 1500 points. (3000 total)
    • Skill 7 >> Skill 8: 2000 points. (5000 total)
    • Skill 8 >> Skill 9: 3000 points. (8000 total)
    • Skill 9 >> Skill 10: 3000 points. (11000 total)

docs.title: Fishing City of the Day
docs.text:
• Every day, at 00:00, one of the three cities becomes the Fishing City of the Day.
  • Boat fishing in that city offers an additional 15% bonus at sale.
  • The city is announced to all players and marked visibly on the map with a specific icon.

docs.title: /work
docs.text: This command allows you to start fishing. You need to be near the fishing location to execute the command. If this is not the case, the server will put a checkpoint on the map, marking the place where you need to go.

docs.title: /jobinventory
docs.text: This command allows you to view the fishing inventory in real time.

docs.title: Garbage Man
docs.text: Garbage Man LS Location Player working as garbage collector

docs.title: General characteristics
docs.text:
• The job headquarters is located in Los Santos and Las Venturas (see location in the adjacent image).
  • Each player will receive a Trashmaster vehicle when using the /work command.
  • Job vehicles do not consume fuel and are locked for the entire duration of work.
  • To complete a full route, you must collect garbage from 20 different trash bins around the city.
  • If you have collected garbage from at least 10 locations (half), you can use the /dumptrash command to abandon collecting garbage from the remaining locations and go to the location where you unload the garbage and where you will also receive a sum of money depending on the number of bins from which you collected garbage before typing the /dumptrash command.
  • There is no skill for this job.

docs.title: Earnings for a complete route
docs.text:
• A complete route means collecting garbage from all 20 bins (checkpoints), receiving a sum of money between $2524 and $2530. The average time to complete a route is 621 seconds.

Important to note:

The payment above is approximate and does not include premium account bonus or other active bonuses on the account.

Players with premium accounts receive 50% more than the base job payment.

docs.title: Trashmaster
docs.text:
Trashmaster
  • Maximum speed: 100 KM/h
  • Based on: Ford F700
  • Number of seats: 2
  • Required skill: Any skill
  • Tunable: TransFender

docs.title: /work
docs.text: Using this command, the server will provide you with the Trashmaster vehicle to start working. If you are not close enough to the designated location for starting missions, the server will guide you to this area by setting a red point on your radar.

docs.title: /dumptrash
docs.text: This command is used to stop the server from sending you to bins to collect garbage and will set a red checkpoint on the map to guide you to the location where you can unload the already collected garbage. The command can only be used if you have already collected at least half of the total garbage for that route (minimum 10 bins).

docs.title: Lawyer
docs.text: #1 Los Santos City Hall Location

docs.title: General characteristics
docs.text:
A lawyer is the one who releases imprisoned players from jail and helps married couples get divorced.

  • The lawyer job is legal.
  • You need at least level 5 to become a lawyer.
  • You can get hired from inside the Los Santos City Hall (see image #1).
  • To be able to release players from jail, you need accept lawyer points. These can be purchased from police officers of rank 3 or higher, at a price between $5,000 and $20,000, or from the City Hall for the sum of $40,000.
  • Each time you release a player from jail, one accept lawyer point will be deducted.
  • You must be next to the prisoner or at the phones outside the jail to be able to release a player. The amount they will have to pay is between $15,000 and $50,000.
  • You cannot release from jail players who received ajail.
  • Also, lawyers are needed for divorces. You can offer your services to one of the spouses for an amount between $1,000 and $3,000.

docs.title: Skill advancement
docs.text:
1. To advance from skill 1 to skill 2, you must release 50 prisoners.
  2. To advance from skill 2 to skill 3, you must release another 50 prisoners. (total: 100)
  3. To advance from skill 3 to skill 4, you must release 100 prisoners. (total: 200)
  4. To advance from skill 4 to skill 5, you must release 200 prisoners. (total: 400)

docs.title: /free
docs.text:
Along with the command, you must specify the prisoner's name (or id) and the price.

Example: /free Nic.eXe 15000

This command allows you to release a player from jail, for a mutually agreed price (in this case, $15,000). The beneficiary can accept or decline this offer. You must have enough accept lawyer points.

docs.title: /acceptlaws
docs.text: The command displays in chat the number of accept lawyer points you have.

docs.title: /ldivorce
docs.text:
It is necessary to specify the name of the married player and the price.

Example: /ldivorce Madalin 3000

When using this command, the player will be sent a divorce offer, which they can accept or decline. You must be next to the player in question.

docs.title: /jaillist
docs.text: When using the command, a dialog box will be displayed with all imprisoned players. To be executed, you must be in Jail, next to the desk.

docs.title: General Characteristics
docs.text:
• With the Lumberjack job you will cut and deliver wood in exchange for money.
  • The Lumberjack job is legal.
  • To become a lumberjack, you need at least level 1.
  • The location of the hiring point can be found on the map in image #1.
  • For a single delivery (delivery is made at the hiring point) you must cut a total of 7 logs.
  • Players who have a premium account receive 50% more at the end of each run.
  • You will lose the mission if you leave the vehicle and do not return to it within 20 seconds (exception when cutting logs).
  • For each skill advancement, you will receive 10 Gold.

docs.title: General Characteristics
docs.text:
• With the Miner job you will collect and deliver ores in exchange for a sum of money.
  • The Miner job is a legal job.
  • To become a miner, you need a minimum level of 1.
  • For this job, you will use the Bobcat vehicle at skill 1-6 and the Yosemite vehicle for skill 6-10.
  • The location of the hiring point can be found on the map in image #1.
  • For a single delivery (delivery is made at the hiring point) you must collect a total of 5 ores.
  • Players who own a premium account receive 50% more at the end of each run.
  • You will lose the mission if you leave the vehicle and do not return to it within 20 seconds (exception when collecting ores).
  • For each skill advancement, you will receive 10 Gold.

docs.title: Pocket Thief
docs.text: Job location

docs.title: General Characteristics
docs.text:
• The job name, "Pocket Thief", says a lot about the activities practiced within it.
  • To become a pocket thief you need a minimum level of 5.
  • The job is illegal.
  • To get hired for the job you must use the /getjob command in the respective job area (see job location in the image above).
  • Players with a level lower than 15 cannot be robbed.
  • You cannot steal money from players in safezone.
  • You cannot steal money from AFK players, regardless of whether they are in safezone or not.
  • You cannot steal money deposited in banks, only the money in their pocket.
  • A player can only be robbed if they are NOT inside an interior.
  • A player cannot be robbed if they are in a vehicle.
  • If a police officer is robbed, they can use the /su command (accessible to department members) to give the thief Wanted 3 (with surrender right) for the reason Pickpocketing.
  • The victim of a successfully executed robbery can use the /emergency command to give the thief Wanted 1 (with surrender right), or kill the thief, thus receiving the stolen money back.
  • Members of the same faction cannot rob each other.
  • Skill advancement is rewarded with 10 Gold per skill.

docs.title: Skill Advancement
docs.text:
1. To advance from skill 1 to skill 2 you need 60 theft attempts.
  2. To advance from skill 2 to skill 3 you need another 60 theft attempts. (total: 120)
  3. To advance from skill 3 to skill 4 you need 120 theft attempts. (total: 240)
  4. To advance from skill 4 to skill 5 you need 240 theft attempts. (total: 480)
  5. To advance from skill 5 to skill 6 you need 200 theft attempts. (total: 680)
  6. To advance from skill 6 to skill 7 you need 250 theft attempts. (total: 930)
  7. To advance from skill 7 to skill 8 you need 300 theft attempts. (total: 1230)
  8. To advance from skill 8 to skill 9 you need 350 theft attempts. (total: 1580)
  9. To advance from skill 9 to skill 10 you need 350 theft attempts. (total: 1930)

docs.title: Success Rate
docs.text:
Depending on skill, the thief has a success chance:

  1. Skill 1 - < 25% success.
  2. Skill 2 - 25% success.
  3. Skill 3 - 32.5% success.
  4. Skill 4 - 40% success.
  5. Skill 5 - 50% success.
  6. Skill 6 - 65% success.
  7. Skill 7 - 75% success.
  8. Skill 8 - 82.5% success.
  9. Skill 9 - 90% success.
  10. Skill 10 - 100% success

Note:

Money is received only if the robbery is successfully executed (according to the success chance). Even so, the number of robberies needed to advance in skill decreases regardless of success.

The amounts of money are approximate because the job has a random payment and do not include the premium account bonus or other active account bonuses.

Players with premium accounts will receive 50% more from the base job payment.

Example: /pickpocket Adi007

To attempt a robbery, you must be as close as possible to your target.

#1 Player working at quarry

This job is located in the west of Las Venturas city, right at the extremity. Working at the quarry is dangerous due to the extremely steep and quite narrow road that a worker must travel for each run. Find out more about this job by reading the rest of the article.

docs.title: Quarry workers occupation
docs.text: A worker at the Las Venturas quarry must load various materials from the top of the quarry and transport them on the steep road directly into its heart. One run for skill is represented by a round trip.
