1. To download the GTA San Andreas game, you need the µTorrent application.
  2. Downloading the iso image is facilitated by this torrent (magnet) (3.95 GB) which you need to access.
  3. The µTorrent application will start downloading the GTA San Andreas game.
  4. After completing the game download, you will find a file named hlm-gtasa.iso. To open this file, there are several solutions, the most efficient being the use of Daemon Tools software.
  5. After downloading and installing Daemon Tools software, right-click on the hlm-gtasa.iso file, select Open with and click on the field describing Daemon Tools.
  6. In a few moments, the computer will behave as if you had inserted a USB stick, and in My Computer a new virtual drive will appear (similar to computer partitions, Local Disk D, Local Disk C, etc.).
  7. Open the respective virtual drive, which bears the name of the game, and access the setup.exe file.
  8. Follow the instructions provided and install GTA San Andreas. It is recommended, but not mandatory, to install the game on a partition different from the one where the operating system is installed.
  9. After completing the installation of GTA San Andreas, access again the virtual drive created at point 6. You will find a folder named HOODLUM, access it and copy the files from its content, then place them in the folder where you just installed the GTA San Andreas game (copy & paste).
  10. After completing the previous steps, if you want to remove the virtual drive created at point 6, right-click on it and select Eject.
  11. Also, the software used to download the game (Daemon Tools and µTorrent) can be uninstalled from the computer's control panel.

Note: For this installation method you have a video tutorial below.

docs.title: Downloading and installing the game using the executable with automatic installation (.exe)
docs.text:
1. To download the GTA San Andreas game, access this link (914 MB). The browser will immediately start downloading the game.
  2. After completing the game download, run the GTA B-Zone Installer.exe executable.
  3. Follow the instructions provided and install GTA San Andreas. It is recommended, but not mandatory, to install the game on a partition different from the one where the operating system is installed.

docs.title: Download the SA:MP application
docs.text:
1. Access the official SA:MP page and download the latest version of the client.
  2. Install the SA:MP client you just downloaded by following the displayed instructions.
  3. Access this link if you want version 0.3.7 R1 which is compatible with all mods.

docs.title: Add our server
docs.text:
• Congratulations! You have successfully installed the game. Now you will be able to open the SA:MP application and connect to the community's SA:MP servers:
  • rpg.b-zone.ro:7777

docs.title: Account
docs.text: The commands in this category are strictly focused on controlling your own account.

docs.title: /stats
docs.text: By using the /stats command, you will find out all the information about your account at that moment. The details that the server provides are identical to those you can find directly in your account on the website.

docs.title: /buylevel
docs.text:
The /buylevel command means buying a level, in the case of the B-Zone RPG server, advancing to a new level. Any community player is allowed to use this command and automatically advance to a new level, only if they have the respect points necessary to purchase that level. To find out how many respect points you have, use the /stats command. If you have more respect points than those required to advance to the next level, they will be lost once you purchase the new level. For each level advancement, the player will receive 10 Gold as a reward.

Notes:

  • With level advancement, the price increases calculated as follows: amount = level*250.
  • With level advancement, the number of RP required for advancement increases calculated as follows: required RP = level*4-2.
  • Players who have an active Premium Account will not lose the respect points they have in excess of those required for level advancement.

docs.title: /changepass
docs.text:
If you use this command, you should know that to change your account password you must know your current password. The server will display a dialog in which you must enter the current account password.

If the current password is correct, another dialog will appear, which you must complete with the new password.

If you forgot your password, you will not be able to change it using the /changepass command in game, but you will have to press the "Forgot your password" button as appropriate on the server's website.

docs.title: /changeemail
docs.text:
Using this command will cause the server to offer you a set of information regarding changing your account email through a dialog box. Below you can find an example of such a dialog, displayed by the server.

If the email address is not validated, you will be able to change it directly in game. More information can be found on the Email page.

docs.title: /arenas
docs.text: By using this command you can check the availability of a certain arena among those available on the server, whether it is occupied or not.

docs.title: Bank
docs.text:
The B-Zone RPG server has 3 banks, one in each city (Las Venturas, Los Santos, San Fierro). The following commands can be used in any of the 3 banks (except command number 5, which can only be used near an ATM):

Los Santos Bank

Las Venturas Bank

San Fierro Bank

#1 ATM Interface

docs.title: /balance
docs.text: After using this command, the bank will display the amount of money you have in the bank at that moment. You can only use the command if you are in one of the 3 banks.

docs.title: /withdraw
docs.text:
With this command you can withdraw money from your own bank account. The syntax you must complete for the command to work successfully is: /withdraw You can only use the command if you are in one of the 3 banks.

Example: /withdraw 5000 Effect: By using the example, you will receive $5,000 in hand, money that is withdrawn from your bank account.

docs.title: /deposit
docs.text:
With this command you can add money to your own bank account. The syntax you must complete for the command to work successfully is: /deposit You can only use the command if you are in one of the 3 banks.

Example: /deposit 5000 Effect: It will withdraw $5,000 from the money you have on you and deposit it in the bank.

docs.title: /transfer
docs.text:
With this command you can transfer money from your bank account to another player's bank account. The syntax you must complete for the command to work successfully is: /transfer You can only use the command if you are in one of the 3 banks, with the exception of event organizers.

Example: Assuming an online player, with the name "Adi007" and having ID 13: /transfer 13 5000 or /transfer Adi007 5000 Effect: It will withdraw $5,000 from the money you have in your bank account and deposit it in player Adi007's bank account.

Note: To transfer money, you need at least level 3. Note: The transfer fee is 1%, it can be calculated with the formula: 1/100 * transferred_amount

docs.title: /atmwithdraw | /atm
docs.text:
By using the [/atmwithdraw] or [/atm] command in front of an ATM you can withdraw money from your bank account, in hand. Usually, when you reach an ATM, a welcoming interface will open (image #1), from where you will select the desired amount of money. However, if you accidentally close the interface, you can use one of the 2 commands mentioned above to reopen it. You can only use the command if you are near an ATM.

Note: If you want to find an ATM you can use the /gps command.

docs.title: Business
docs.text:
Gun Shop LS

To find out absolutely all the control commands of a business, commands whose meaning is explained on this page, use the "/businesshelp" command on the servers.

docs.title: /bizradio
docs.text:
Using this command, the business owner will be able to play a radio station or a YouTube link inside their own business. When a player enters that business, they will hear the radio station or YouTube soundtrack that have been set by the owner. By using the /bizradio command inside a business that does not belong to you, you will be able to control your ability to hear audio streams inside the business.

Also, sound playback can be stopped by the owner using this command.

docs.title: /enter
docs.text: The /enter command is usually used to enter buildings, in this case, businesses. The command is executed successfully (you will be able to enter the business), only if you are close enough to the door of that business. For a faster execution, you can use the equivalent of this command, namely the "F" key on your keyboard.

docs.title: /exit
docs.text: The /exit command is usually used to exit a building, in this case, a business. The command is executed successfully (you will be able to exit the business), only if you are close enough to the exit door. For a faster execution, you can use the equivalent of this command, namely the "F" key on your keyboard.

docs.title: /sellshares
docs.text: After using this command, you will sell a business share to the state, the only money you will receive being that in the business safe, if it is not empty.

docs.title: /shareholders
docs.text:
Shareholders

After using this command, you will be able to see who the shareholders of a specific business are.

docs.title: /bizwithdraw
docs.text:
The command has the effect of withdrawing money from the business safe, money produced from the entry fee that players pay when entering the business.

To find out what amount of money you have in the business safe, type the /bizwithdraw command, without specifying the amount you want to withdraw from the safe.

If you want to withdraw a certain amount of money, type the command following the model: "/bizwithdraw 500", will withdraw $500 from the business safe.

For a correct and successful execution of the command, you must be inside the business (if you can penetrate inside it), as close as possible to the exit door, or outside it, as close as possible to the entrance door.

docs.title: /bizinfo
docs.text:
To use the command you do not have to be near the business or inside it, the command being usable anywhere you are if you are the owner of a business.

By typing the command, the server will show you some details about your business:

  • Business level.
  • Entry fee value.
  • Total revenue.
  • The minimum value for which the business can be sold.
  • The percentage of shares you hold in a certain business.
  • Business production based on shares held.

docs.title: /bizstatus
docs.text: After using this command, you will be able to see information about a business safe and the minimum value at which it can be sold.

docs.title: /mybiz
docs.text: To use the command you must be the owner of a rent type business (car, bike, airplane), and using this command you will be able to manage the owned vehicles and also buy new vehicles within the business if you have not reached the limit of 10 vehicles imposed by the server.

docs.title: /arenas
docs.text: Using the /arenas command you can see if the arenas available on the RPG server are occupied or not.

docs.title: /help
docs.text: Using the /help -> Businesses command you can find all the information presented above directly in the game.

docs.title: Chat
docs.text: The commands in this category are used strictly to socialize on chat with other players. There are several types of chats, which differ from each other and which you can access through various commands:

docs.title: /ignore
docs.text: By typing this command, you will be shown a list of all the players you have blocked and who can no longer contact you. By selecting the "Add player..." item, you will be able to add a player ID or their name to add them to the ignore list. Players on the /ignore list will no longer be able to whisper to you (/w), send you SMS messages (/sms), or call you (/call). By selecting a player from the /ignore list, they will be removed from the list.

docs.title: /say
docs.text:
It is a command equivalent to normal chat, the one you use to socialize and which does not require typing a certain command before the message, but simply writing the message in the game console. Messages sent through normal chat are only seen by players whose names you see.

Example: "/say message"

docs.title: /s
docs.text:
The command launches your message on a slightly larger radius than /say, being represented by a shout.

Example: "/s message"

docs.title: /w
docs.text:
The message transmitted by the command represents a "whisper", so you can transmit confidential messages that only the player you sent them to will be able to see. To be able to send such messages you need at least level 3.

Example: "/w Adi007 This is a whisper", will send the message "This is a whisper" to Adi007.

docs.title: /b
docs.text:
The command launches your message on a radius equal to normal chat (/say), but the message will appear in parentheses.

Example: "/b message", will display "Adi007 says: (( message ))"

docs.title: /f
docs.text:
The command transmits a message on the faction chat you are part of (only if you are part of one). The command is present in all /factions except police departments where /r is used.

Example: "/f message"

docs.title: /r
docs.text:
The command is only available to members of police departments and has the same effect as /f, namely transmitting a message to colleagues from that department. It will only work if you are part of a police department (LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, National Guard, FBI).

Example: "/r message"

docs.title: /c
docs.text:
The command transmits a message on the clan chat you are part of (only if you are part of one).

Example: "/c message"

docs.title: /ac
docs.text:
The command transmits a message on the alliance chat you are part of (only if you are part of one).

Example: "/ac message"

docs.title: /cw
docs.text:
The command only works if you are in a car. It transmits your message only to players who are in the same car as you.

Example: "/cw message"

docs.title: /wt
docs.text:
It represents the abbreviation of the object through which you speak, walkie talkie (radio station). It can be purchased from a 24/7 store. The command only works if you have set a frequency for the walkie talkie using the /setfreq command.

Example: "/wt message"

Note: The command only works if you have at least level 5.

docs.title: /sms
docs.text:
With this command, you can send messages from your mobile phone to another player using their ID or name.

Example: "/sms 123 hello", where "123" is the player's ID, and "hello" is the message.

docs.title: /call
docs.text:
With this command, you can call a player from your own mobile phone using their ID or name.

Example: "/call 123", where "123" is the ID of the player you want to call.

docs.title: /lc
docs.text:
The command can be used by faction leaders and admins 4+ to discuss.

Example: "/lc message"

docs.title: /al
docs.text:
The command is used if you have sent a report to admins (/report) for various reasons and an admin has accepted your report, so you will be able to talk to them using this command.

Example: "/al message"

docs.title: /hl
docs.text:
The command is used if you have asked for help from a helper (/helpme) for various reasons and a helper has accepted your help request, so you will be able to talk to them using this command.

Example: "/hl message"

docs.title: /e
docs.text:
The command only works if you are the organizer of an event. It is used to transmit a message to all server players, being the event organizer.

Example: "/e message"

docs.title: /ec
docs.text:
The command only works if you are the organizer or assistant of an event. It is used to transmit a message to all event assistants.

Example: "/ec message"

docs.title: /d
docs.text:
The command is used to transmit a message to all police departments (LSPD, SFPD, LVPD, National Guard, FBI), not only to the one you are part of.

Example: "/d message"

docs.title: /tx
docs.text:
The command is similar to /d and is used to transmit a message to all taxi companies (LS Taxi, SF Taxi, LV Taxi), not only to the one you are part of.

Example: "/tx message"

docs.title: /sx
docs.text:
The command is similar to /tx, it is used by members of LS School Instructors, SF School Instructors and LV School Instructors to talk to each other.

Example: "/sx message"

docs.title: /gc
docs.text:
The command is used by mafiosi during "Alliance" type war to discuss with the alliance.

Example: "/gc message"

docs.title: /rc
docs.text:
The command is used by players who rob in a team to communicate with each other.

Example: "/rc message"

docs.title: General
docs.text: This section presents the general commands of the B-Zone RPG server.

docs.title: /id
docs.text:
Syntax: /id [PlayerID/PlayerName]

  • The command displays information about that player:
  • Player ID.
  • Player name.
  • Ping between player and server.
  • Player's FPS in real time.
  • Player's current level.
  • Player status (AFK|SLEEP|AFK & SLEEP).
  • Name of the faction they belong to.
  • Type of skin they have (If they wear a Diamond or Onyx skin).
  • Their skin ID.

docs.title: /pay
docs.text:
Syntax: /pay [PlayerID/PlayerName] [amount]

  • This command will send the specified amount of cash to that player.
  • Players with a level lower than 3 can send a maximum of $10 per transaction.
  • The limit for other players is $10,000. Transactions are made with a pause of a few seconds between them.
  • You must be near that player to send them money.

docs.title: /buy
docs.text:
Syntax: /buy

  • With this command, you can buy items from 24/7 stores.

docs.title: /givekey
docs.text:
Syntax: /givekey [PlayerID/PlayerName]

  • This command allows you to hand over the keys of the vehicle you are in (you must own it) to another player. The owner does not lose their own keys. That person will remain in possession of the keys until they disconnect or use /throw.

docs.title: /drink
docs.text:
Syntax: /drink [DrinkName]

  • With this command you can buy drinks from clubs and bars.

docs.title: /turfs
docs.text:
Syntax: /turfs

  • The command will overlay the zones controlled by mafias, corresponding to the color, over the game map.
  • Visible both on radar (minimap) and on the large map.
  • To remove them, use the command again.

docs.title: /licenses
docs.text:
Syntax: /licenses

  • This command displays a list of all licenses and information about them: whether you have them and how long they are still valid.

docs.title: /requestlicenses
docs.text:
Syntax: /requestlicenses [PlayerID/PlayerName]

  • The command sends a request to that player to see their licenses. If they accept, a dialog box similar to /licenses will be displayed.

docs.title: /skills
docs.text:
Syntax: /skills

  • Displays the skills you have at jobs and how many more points you need to advance.

docs.title: /sleep
docs.text:
Syntax: /sleep

  • Enter and exit AFK mode.

docs.title: /lotto
docs.text:
Syntax: /lotto

  • Place tickets with different numbers in the lotto system.

docs.title: /cigarettes
docs.text:
Syntax: /cigarettes

  • Displays the number of cigarettes you have and whether or not you have a lighter.

docs.title: /spawnchange
docs.text:
Syntax: /spawnchange

  • The command allows you to change your spawn location. You can choose between spawning in a house (whether rented or owned) or in the default spawn location.
  • For players who are part of a faction, they will have the option to select the faction HQ as a spawn point.
  • For players without factions (civilians), they will have as spawn points a location from all three cities (Los Santos, Las Venturas, San Fierro) as well as spawn at the owned house or where they have rent.

You will not be able to use this command if you are wanted by the police.

docs.title: /eject
docs.text:
Syntax: /eject [PlayerID/PlayerName]

  • With this command you can forcibly remove one of the passengers from the car you are driving. Only drivers can use it.

docs.title: /rob
docs.text:
Syntax: /rob

  • Rob the bank in a group of 4-8 people or you can select the "Rob Solo" option and you can rob a house/business alone.

docs.title: /robhelp
docs.text:
Syntax: /robhelp

  • Provides information related to the robbery system.

docs.title: /service
docs.text:
Syntax: /service [Taxi/Medic/Mechanic/Lawyer/Towtruck]

  • Sends a request to a taxi driver, medic, mechanic, lawyer or towtruck to come to you. This request specifies the location where you are and can be accepted or not by them.

docs.title: /report
docs.text:
Syntax: /report

  • The command sends a notification request to the server administrators. If your request is accepted, an admin will open your report. You can talk to them using the /al command.
  • The maximum number of unopened requests (reports) at the same time is 1. If no admin closes or opens your report in 5 minutes, it will close automatically.

Attention! This command should only be used to report serious problems, players who cheat or other similar situations. Using offensive language or meaningless requests will not be tolerated and will bring you sanctions.

docs.title: /helpme
docs.text:
Syntax: /helpme [Text] or Syntax: /n [Text]

  • The command sends a help request to the server helpers. If at least one helper is on duty, the question will be assigned to them. You can receive a global response, meaning that the question and answer will appear on chat to all players with levels between 1 and 40. This option can be disabled from the /tog command -> Newbie Chat. Also, helpers can open a private conversation and you can talk to them using the /hl command. The maximum number of unopened help requests (helpme) at the same time is 1.

Attention! This command should only be used to ask questions or for help related to the B-Zone RPG server. Using offensive language or meaningless requests will not be tolerated and will bring you sanctions.

docs.title: /speedlimit
docs.text:
Syntax: /speedlimit [0 or 90-230]

  • With this command, you can set a maximum speed for the car you are in. This speed can vary between 90 km/h and 230 km/h. To remove this restriction, use "/speedlimit 0".

docs.title: /accept
docs.text:
Syntax: /accept [Service] [PlayerID/PlayerName]

  • You can accept one of these services if it is offered to you by another player or by the server: drugs (Drugs), repairs (Repair), Job, interview (Live), fuel supply (Refill), fine (Ticket), newspaper (Paper), licenses (Licenses), membership in an escape group (Escape), trade (Trade), Taxi, Medic, lawyer (Lawyer), mechanic (Mechanic), release from prison (Free), weapon (Gun), materials (Materials), /needlicense request (Needlicense; for Instructors), Lawyercall, Lesson, Rob, Dice (Dice), Alliance, Eventhelper, Pubg, Friend, Bunker.

docs.title: /cancel
docs.text:
Syntax: /cancel [Service]

  • You can refuse any of the above services.

docs.title: /usedrugs
docs.text:
Syntax: /usedrugs [Marijuana/Cocaine/Ecstasy/Meth]

  • You have the possibility to use the drugs you own.

docs.title: /fill
docs.text:
Syntax: /fill [percent]

  • You fill the fuel tank with the entered percentage.

docs.title: /fillgascan
docs.text:
Syntax: /fillgascan

  • You fill the fuel canister.

docs.title: /needlicense
docs.text:
Syntax: /needlicenses

  • The command sends a request to all server instructors, saying that you need a license. They will be notified about your level and the language you play in (RO/EN). If your request is accepted, that instructor will have the location where you are marked on the map, and the others will see who accepted.

docs.title: /buyweaplic
docs.text:
NPC weapon license purchase

Syntax: /buyweaplic

  • Through this command you have the possibility to buy the weapon license directly from an NPC without needing an instructor to offer it to you if you have level 5+.
  • There is such an NPC at the HQ of each School Instructors faction as well as an info point about the price.
  • Instructors will not be able to purchase or renew their license from these NPCs.
  • Players with wanted will have the possibility only to renew their license.
  • To be able to get the license from these NPCs, you must first request an instructor to see if there is someone on duty to grant you the license. The request will be automatically canceled after 5 minutes of waiting, after which you can get the license yourself.
  • The purchase price of the license varies depending on the level as follows:
  • For players with a level between 5 and 9 the license purchase price is $5,000.
  • For players with a level between 10 and 49 the license purchase price is $10,000.
  • For players with level 50 or higher the purchase price is $20,000.

Note: The money paid for the license will go to the server, so no one gets possession of it.

docs.title: /lawyers
docs.text:
Syntax: /lawyers

  • Displays a list of all server lawyers, along with the number of accept points held. You can call them by clicking on one of them.

docs.title: /animlist
docs.text:
Syntax: /animlist

  • Displays a list of all animations available on the B-Zone RPG server.

docs.title: /carradio
docs.text:
Syntax: /carradio or Key: R

  • Only drivers can use the command. This opens a dialog box from where you can choose the radio you want to listen to.

docs.title: /mp3
docs.text:
Syntax: /mp3

  • Equivalent to the "/carradio" command, with the difference that it can be used anywhere, on foot.

Note: Requires an MP3 Player (purchasable from a 24/7) and premium account.

docs.title: /throw
docs.text:
Syntax: /throw [Keys/Guns/Drugs/Materials]

  • Using this command, you can throw on the ground the keys, weapons, drugs or materials you have on you. A corresponding roleplay message will appear on chat to all nearby players. The command cannot be used for approximately 2 minutes if you have been pulled over by a police officer.

docs.title: /trade
docs.text: • Sends a trade invitation to another player, using the trading system.

docs.title: /givecigarette
docs.text:
• Using this command, a player can offer a cigarette to another player.

Example: /givecigarette Adi007 will offer player Adi007 a cigarette.

docs.title: /tog
docs.text:
• Using this command, players will be able to activate or deactivate certain functions, messages or logs, these being divided into categories:

News, Newbie Chat, Advertisments, Whisper Chat, Show Faction Chat, Clan Chat, Damage 'ding', Show HUD, Show Nametags, Event Chat, Spray Messages, Admin Punishments, Confidential Messages, Neons, Surfing, All vehicle neons

docs.title: /clanleaders
docs.text: • This command will display all clan leaders connected to the server.

docs.title: /fps
docs.text:
• This command will create a text in the top-right or bottom-left corner of the screen, constantly displaying the FPS.
  • The position of the text, its activation and deactivation are done by typing the command successively.

Note: The /fps command will not work for players who consume drinks (/drink), because in those cases the displayed FPS is erroneous.

docs.title: /cheater
docs.text: Syntax: /cheater [ID/Player] [Code] - The command sends a notification request to the server administrators to report a possible cheating player. You will receive a message on chat when the admin takes care of your report.

docs.title: /referrals
docs.text:
• This command shows you all online players who are registered on your referral ID.
  • In the dialog that appears, you will be able to see some information about them.

docs.title: /clanHQs
docs.text: • This command shows you the list of all clan HQs on the server as well as their ID so you can locate them through the /gps command.

docs.title: /safeboxes
docs.text: • This command shows you the list of all safeboxes you own on your account, along with its location on the map and the occupied capacity out of its total capacity.

docs.title: /opensafe
docs.text:
• This command allows you to open the safebox you placed on the map to deposit/extract/throw weapons/drugs/materials from it.

Note: You must be near the safebox when you want to open it to be able to interact with it.

docs.title: /clearfp
docs.text:
• This command allows you to use your ClearFP type gratuity through which you remove all the Faction Punish you have at that moment.

Note: The command can be used regardless of how much FP you have active on your account, it will be set to 0 after using the gratuity.

docs.title: /goldaward
docs.text: • This command shows you the list of the most active 15 players on the server by real hours played (without sleep).

docs.title: /premiu
docs.text:
• This command shows you the current tier from the chest system along with the number of real hours played that day.

From here you can also see information about the chances of each prize for a certain number of hours played that you can unlock.

docs.title: /surrender
docs.text:
• This command allows you to surrender to Jail if you have the right to surrender. You must wait about 3 minutes from the moment you used the command, department members will be informed and if no one comes to arrest you then you will be automatically arrested by the server.

Note: If there is no department member online on the server at that moment, you will be directly arrested without having to wait the 3 minutes.

docs.title: Houses
docs.text:
The houses on our servers are designed in RPG style, which means they closely mimic real houses.

B-Zone provides you with the possibility of buying a house, selling a house, the possibility of renting it and why not, offers you a perfect place to relax by sleeping, using the /sleep command.

Permissions:

  • Only tenants and the house owner are allowed to use the /tenants and /sleep commands.
  • Only the house owner is allowed to use the /open, /setrentable, /setrent, /evict, /evictall, /sellhousetostate, /houseprice, /housewithdraw, /houseupgrade commands.
  • If the house door is not locked by its owner, absolutely any player is allowed to use the /heal, /enter and /exit commands. If the door is locked, the commands are only available to tenants and the owner.
  • Furniture inside a house will become invisible to all players if the property owner receives wanted (wanted level).
  • The owner of a property will not be allowed to use commands for adding or editing furniture elements if they have at least 1 wanted star.

docs.title: /enter
docs.text: The /enter command is usually used to enter buildings, in this case, houses. The command is executed successfully (you will be able to enter the house) only if you are close enough to the door of that building. For a faster execution, you can use the equivalent of this command, namely the "F" key on your keyboard.

docs.title: /exit
docs.text: The /exit command is usually used to exit a building, in this case, a house. The command is executed successfully (you will be able to exit the house) only if you are close enough to the exit door. For a faster execution, you can use the equivalent of this command, namely the "F" key on your keyboard.

docs.title: /open
docs.text: With this command you can lock and unlock your own house. If you choose to lock the house, the only players who will be able to continue entering the house are tenants and the owner. You can benefit from this command only if you are the owner of a house. For a successful execution of the command, you must be inside the house as close as possible to the exit door, or outside it, as close as possible to the entrance door.

docs.title: /setrentable
docs.text: The command tells the server whether you want players to be able to become your tenants. To offer the house for rent, use the command "/setrentable Yes", otherwise use "/setrentable No".

docs.title: /setrent
docs.text:
Using this command, you can set the house rental price. Each tenant you have and who is online (connected to the server) at PayDay will be deducted the respective amount of dollars, the money will be deposited in the house safe. The command is executed correctly and successfully only if you have chosen a price between $0 and $1000.

Note: You are allowed to use the command only if the "/setrentable Yes" command function is activated.

docs.title: /tenants
docs.text: The command will display both the number and names of all tenants online (on the server) at the time of typing the command. Only tenants and the house owner have access to use this command.

docs.title: /evict
docs.text:
The command has the effect of breaking the house rental contract with a tenant and is at the disposal of any house owner. For a correct and successful execution of the command, use it in the following two ways: /evict or /evict .

Example: Consider player Adi007 as a tenant of a house and having ID 12. Therefore, the house owner will break the rental contract with Adi007 using one of the following examples: /evict Adi007 or /evict 12.

docs.title: /evictall
docs.text: The command has the effect of breaking the house rental contract with absolutely all tenants that the house hosts at the time of using it.

docs.title: /sellhousetostate
docs.text: After using this command, you will sell the house to the state, the only money you will receive being that in the house safe, only if it is not empty.

docs.title: /houseprice
docs.text:
The correct use of the command will lead to the activation of the possibility for a server player to buy your house in exchange for the amount of money you have set.

Example: "/houseprice 15000" will set the house price to $15,000.

The minimum price you can set for your own house is represented by the product between the house level and the number 1,000. Example: If you own a house that has level 15, the minimum price you can set is 15 multiplied by 1,000, i.e. $15,000

The maximum price you can set for your own house is represented by the product between the house level and the number 200,000. Example: If you own a house that has level 15, the maximum price you can set is 15 multiplied by 200,000, i.e. $3,000,000

This command gives you the chance for your home to be sold even if you are offline. The money will enter your bank account.

docs.title: /heal
docs.text: To use the command you must be inside a house that you own or have been a tenant for at least 10 minutes. After executing it, you will have 100 health points (HP). If the player typing the command is part of a department and at the same time the house benefits from "armour upgrade", they will have 100 health points and 100 armour points.

docs.title: /sleep
docs.text:
The command is designed to mimic sleeping, so by using the command your character will have a specific animation applied. When you sleep, other players will see in certain situations, next to your name, the text "(AFK)". Example of commands that suffer from the described situation: /id, /members, /clanmembers, etc.

If you sleep at PayDay time, you will receive the respect point necessary to advance in level, but the number of hours played will not increase.

The command does not work near the exit door of the house and not if you are wanted by the police or have committed an offense in the last 60 seconds from typing the command.

No player will be able to kill you while you sleep.

docs.title: /houseupgrade
docs.text:
The command will display a simple menu from where you can renovate the house. Currently, with this menu you will be able to add the possibility of increasing the health and armour reserve, adding decorative objects (furniture) and activating the possibility of playing a radio station inside the house.

The Heal and Armour functions are implemented when a player uses the "/heal" command in the house.

Each object selected from the menu will cost you $1,000.

Upgrades for houses will be lost when selling them.

Players will be able to add up to 170 objects maximum in the house.

docs.title: /removefurniture
docs.text: By typing this command, all furniture elements added through the /houseupgrade command will be removed. Money spent on furniture to be removed will not be returned.

docs.title: /editfurniture
docs.text: Using this command, the server will display a list of all furniture objects you have added to the house. By clicking on one of the objects in the list, you will be able to remove that object or edit its position. The order of displaying objects in the menu is made from the newest added to the oldest added.

docs.title: /defaultfurniture
docs.text: By typing this command, you can choose between creating or destroying the decorative objects of the house (the initial ones, not those created by you). For the change to take effect, you will have to leave the server and reconnect to it. It is possible that the initial objects of a house cannot be affected by this command (you cannot hide them).

docs.title: /housewithdraw
docs.text:
The command has the effect of withdrawing money from the house safe, money produced from the rent that tenants pay at each PayDay.

To find out what amount of money you have in the house safe, type the /housewithdraw command, without specifying the amount you want to withdraw from the safe.

If you want to withdraw a certain amount of money, type the command following the model: "/housewithdraw 500", will withdraw $500 from the house safe.

For a correct and successful execution of the command, you must be inside the house as close as possible to the exit door.

docs.title: /houseinfo
docs.text:
To use the command you do not have to be near the house or inside it, the command being usable anywhere you are if you are the owner of a house.

By typing the command, the server will show you some details about your house:

  • House level.
  • Number of tenants connected to the server.
  • Whether the house is rentable or not. If it is rentable, the rent value you set using the /setrent command will appear.
  • Whether that house is locked or not.
  • The minimum value for which the house can be sold.
  • The value of the tax charged by the state (the money you will not receive when someone buys your house, but they will be deducted from the buyer's account). The tax value is equal to the product between the house level and the number 100. Example (house with level 15): 15 multiplied by 100, so the tax is $1,500.
  • The house name, set by its owner.

docs.title: /houseradio
docs.text:
Using this command, the house owner will be able to play a radio station or a YouTube link in their own home. When a player enters that house, they will hear the radio station or YouTube soundtrack that have been set by the owner. By using the /houseradio command inside a house that does not belong to you, you will be able to control your ability to hear audio streams inside houses.

Also, sound playback can be stopped by the owner using this command.

docs.title: /housename
docs.text:
Using this command, the house owner will be able to set a house name that will be visible to all players who are around that house.

Note: Using vulgar/offensive texts is punishable by admins.

docs.title: /lift
docs.text:
House lift

  • This system allows players to teleport between various areas of the house (roof, parking, depending on availability).
  • Only the owner and tenants of a house that has a lift will be able to use the /lift command.
  • Vehicles cannot be teleported through this system.
  • The system is useful for reaching hard-to-reach places near the house (such as a roof of a tall building, where an airplane or helicopter can be parked).
  • To have a lift at your house you can open a ticket here and you can purchase one in exchange for a sum of gold depending on the size of the house. The price starts from 2000 Gold ordered from the shop in the last 7 days for a lift with 1 floor.

docs.title: Jobs
docs.text: To be able to work at one of the jobs available on the servers, you need to know the commands available for them.

docs.title: /jobs
docs.text:
This command opens a list of all jobs. The list includes the following details about each job: - Job name - The city it belongs to - Job type (legal/illegal) - Minimum level required for employment at that job

Note: To help your imagination, you can find such a list in image #1.

Jobs List

docs.title: /jobhelp
docs.text:
The command displays the list of all commands available within a job.

Example: Having the Farmer job, the server will display the /work command.

docs.title: /getjob
docs.text:
With this command, any player can get employed, if they meet the following conditions: - Have the minimum level required for employment (see the required level by typing the /jobs command). - Be close enough to the special marker (i - see image #2).

Job Marker

docs.title: /work
docs.text: This command is one of the most used commands regarding jobs. With this command, a player can start their work. The /work command works for all jobs, except Detective, Auto Mechanic and Lawyer.

docs.title: /skills
docs.text:
#3 Skills list

The /skills command is a general one, players can access it even if they are not employed at any job. By typing the command, the server will display a dialog that includes information about the skill held for each job.

Note: To help your imagination, you can find such a list in image #3.

docs.title: /switchjob
docs.text:
Certain factions allow holding an auxiliary job specific to that faction as well as a normal job at the player's choice, so members of these factions can simultaneously hold two jobs and can switch between them using this command.

  • Members of departments and Hitmen Agency members have the Detective job as an auxiliary job.
  • Gang members have the Arms Dealer job as an auxiliary job.
  • Members of TTC, Paramedics, News Reporters, Taxi LS/LV/SF, School Instructors LS/LV/SF have the Mechanic job as an auxiliary job.

docs.title: /jobskillup
docs.text:
The /jobskillup command is a general one, it can be used to increase your current skill at certain jobs.

  • You must have JobSkill type gratuities.
  • The job you want to increase your skill at must have a skill system.
  • You must not already have the maximum skill at the job you want to increase.

docs.title: Locations
docs.text: The B-Zone RPG server has a single command that includes absolutely all important locations, as well as faction headquarters.

docs.title: /locations | /gps
docs.text:
Using this command, the server will display a frame that includes 10 elements:

  • Important locations
  • Faction HQs
  • Houses
  • Businesses
  • Clan HQs
  • ATMs
  • 24/7s
  • Gas stations
  • Clothing stores
  • Food stores

docs.title: Important locations
docs.text:
If you select the first element from the list, you will be shown a list of all important server locations.

Example: Banks, CNNs, Gun shops, DMV, City Hall, etc.

Important locations

docs.title: Faction HQs
docs.text:
If you select the second element from the list, you will be shown a list of all server faction headquarters. Example: 69 Pier Mobs HQ, Hitmen Agency HQ, Tow Truck Company HQ, National Guard HQ.

Faction Headquarters

docs.title: Houses
docs.text: If you select the third element from the list, you will be shown a dialog in which you must enter the ID of the house you want to locate.

docs.title: Businesses
docs.text: If you select the fourth element from the list, you will be shown a dialog in which you must enter the ID of the business you want to locate.

docs.title: Clan HQs
docs.text:
If you select the fifth element from the list, you will be shown a dialog in which you must select the clan you want to locate.

Note: For more information about clan HQ IDs, use the [/clanhqs] command.

docs.title: ATMs
docs.text: If you select the sixth element from the list, you will be shown a list of all server ATMs.

docs.title: 24/7s
docs.text: If you select the seventh element from the list, you will be shown a list of all server 24/7s.

docs.title: Gas stations
docs.text: If you select the eighth element from the list, you will be shown a list of all server gas stations.

docs.title: Clothing stores
docs.text: If you select the ninth element from the list, you will be shown a list of all clothing stores available on the server.

docs.title: Food stores
docs.text: If you select the tenth element from the list, you will be shown a list of all food stores available on the server.

docs.title: Other Commands
docs.text: On this page you will find commands that once typed in the game, also display a new set of commands.

docs.title: /cellphonehelp
docs.text: This command displays the following set of commands:

docs.title: /p(ickup)
docs.text: The effect of this is to answer the phone if someone calls you. Both variants can be used: /p or /pickup.

docs.title: /h(angup)
docs.text: The effect of this is to close a phone conversation. Both variants can be used: /h or /hangup.

docs.title: /call
docs.text:
It is used to call a player. To use this command you need the ID or name of the player you want to call.

Example: /call Madalin

docs.title: /turn
docs.text: This command closes, respectively opens your phone, depending on the specified parameter: - /turn on - will open the phone. - /turn off - will close the phone.

docs.title: /speaker
docs.text: When you are in a phone conversation, no one else around can see the conversation from the interlocutor's side, but after using the /speaker command, the messages will become visible.

docs.title: /sms
docs.text:
It is a command used to send text messages to other players on the server, to the specified ID or name.

Example: /sms Madalin B-Zone!

docs.title: /renthelp
docs.text: This command displays the following set of commands:

docs.title: /enter
docs.text: The /enter command is usually used to enter buildings, in this case, houses. The command is executed successfully (you will be able to enter the house) only if you are close enough to the door of that building. For a faster execution, you can use the equivalent of this command, namely the "F" key on your keyboard.

docs.title: /exit
docs.text: The /exit command is usually used to exit a building, in this case, a house. The command is executed successfully (you will be able to exit the house) only if you are close enough to the exit door. For a faster execution, you can use the equivalent of this command, namely the "F" key on your keyboard.

docs.title: /tenants
docs.text: The command will display both the number and names of all tenants online (on the server) at the time of typing the command. Only tenants and the house owner have access to use this command.

docs.title: /unrentroom
docs.text: Using this command, the rental contract for the current home will be terminated.

docs.title: /rentcarhelp
docs.text: This command displays the following set of commands:

docs.title: /unrentvehicle
docs.text: This command is used to give up the rented vehicle and its keys. After using this command, you will no longer have a rented vehicle.

docs.title: /locaterentedcar
docs.text: If you have a rented vehicle and forgot where you left it, then the /locaterentedcar command is useful to you. Using this command, the server will set a red point on the map representing the destination of the rented vehicle.

docs.title: /vehicles
docs.text: This command displays all the vehicles you own, including rented ones so you can interact with them.

docs.title: /givekey
docs.text: This command gives the keys to your vehicle to another player so they can lock or unlock it.

docs.title: /changelock
docs.text: This command offers the vehicle owner the possibility to change the vehicle lock so it can no longer be used by the players to whom they gave the keys.

docs.title: /park
docs.text: This command offers the vehicle owner the possibility to park the vehicle in their desired location. - To be able to park the vehicle, it must not be hit or damaged.

docs.title: /eventhelp
docs.text: This command displays the commands you can use at an event, and if you are the organizer of an event and use the command, depending on what type of event you organize, you will receive a list of commands you can use. This command displays the following set of commands when you are not the organizer/assistant of an event:

docs.title: /event
docs.text:
If there is an ongoing event at the time of typing the command, you will receive the following information:

  • The title of the ongoing event.
  • The event prize.
  • The type and location of its deployment.
  • The name of the organizer and their assistants.
  • The level required to participate in the event.
  • The minimum and maximum number of participants.

docs.title: /requestevent
docs.text: This command represents a request form that level 2 helpers and B-Zone RPG server administrators can read, who will accept or not your request to organize an event.

docs.title: /join
docs.text: You join an ongoing event if it benefits from this option.

docs.title: /leaveevent
docs.text: If you are a participant in an ongoing event, using this command you will leave the event.

docs.title: /leaderhelp
docs.text: This command displays the following set of commands:

docs.title: /members
docs.text: Using this command, you open an interactive menu with the faction members list and two separate options. Within the members, you can see their names, the last time they logged in, rank and FWarns. Regarding the 2 options, the first option is Faction Applications, and using this option you can open the faction applications directly in the game. The second option is Faction Tests, and using this option you can edit one of the 2 test logs of the faction.

docs.title: /factiontest
docs.text: Using this command, any rank 4+ with the Tester function in the faction can start a test with a faction candidate.

docs.title: /tog
docs.text: Using this command, you can find the option Members can use faction chat, by disabling it, no faction member will be able to use the /f command, only the leader and admins 4+.

docs.title: /fvr
docs.text: By executing the command, all unoccupied faction vehicles will be respawned. The command is accessible from rank 5.

docs.title: /lc
docs.text: This command is used by faction leaders to talk on the chat designated for leaders.

docs.title: /fwithdraw
docs.text:
By typing the /fwithdraw command without specifying any parameter, you will get information about the amount of money held at that moment by the faction safe. To withdraw money from the faction safe, the amount of money is used as a parameter.

Example: /fwithdraw 15000

docs.title: /fmotd
docs.text:
By typing the /fmotd command without specifying any parameter, the server will send you a preset message by the leader or sub-leader, if it exists. To change the preset message (message of the day), the desired message is used as a parameter.

Example: /fmotd Everyone to HQ!

docs.title: /fget & /fput
docs.text:
The command is used to put or take drugs or materials from HQ.

Example: /fgetdrugs 100 and /fgetmaterials 100000

docs.title: /setgc
docs.text: Using this command, a mafia leader can set the minimum rank needed to send a message on /gc, the chat during alliance war.

docs.title: /vehrank
docs.text:
The command sets a minimum rank to use the respective faction's vehicle.

Note: You need at least rank 6 to use this command.

docs.title: /clanhelp
docs.text: This command displays the following set of commands:

docs.title: /claninvite
docs.text:
The /claninvite command is used by clan owners and members with rank 6+ to invite someone to their own clan.

Note: Members with rank 6+ can only use the command on players who have an accepted application.

docs.title: /c
docs.text:
The command transmits a message on the clan chat you are part of (only if you are part of one).

Example: "/c message"

docs.title: /clanmembers
docs.text: The command opens a dialog with all clan members you are part of (only if you are part of one).

docs.title: /clanresign
docs.text: With this command you can leave the clan you are in.

docs.title: /setclanowner
docs.text: With this command, clan leaders can set another clan leader.

docs.title: /spray
docs.text: The command is used near a clan turf to draw it in the name of your clan.

docs.title: /clanxp
docs.text: The command displays a textdraw with the XP the clan has in total and how much XP it has left until it advances to the next level.

docs.title: /clanzones
docs.text: The command opens a dialog with all clan turfs.

docs.title: /clanturfs
docs.text: The command displays all clan turfs.

docs.title: /clancolor
docs.text: This command can only be used by clan leaders to set the clan color.

docs.title: /clangoldwithdraw
docs.text: With this command, clan leaders can extract Gold from the clan safe.

docs.title: /cmotd
docs.text: The command is used by clan leaders to set a clan motto.

docs.title: /clanrename
docs.text: With this command, clan leaders can change the names of ranks.

docs.title: /clanduty
docs.text: This command will put you on duty at the clan.

docs.title: /clanleaders
docs.text: The command displays all clan leaders who are on the server at that moment.

docs.title: /ctalkpower
docs.text: This command prohibits using the /c command for a certain rank. (minimum rank 5+)

docs.title: /topclan
docs.text: The command displays the top clans holding turfs.

docs.title: /clanwithdraw
docs.text: With this command, any member with rank 6+ can take money from the clan safe.

docs.title: /clandeposit
docs.text: With this command you can deposit money in the clan safe.

docs.title: /clanput & /clanget
docs.text:
With this command you can put or retrieve materials or drugs.

Example: /clanputmaterials 1000000

docs.title: /cwithdrawpower
docs.text: The command is only available to clan leaders, they can set a rank that can use the /clanwithdraw and /clanget(drugs/materials) command.

docs.title: /claimhq
docs.text: The command is only available to clan leaders, with this command they can claim an available Clan HQ.

docs.title: /leavehq
docs.text: With this command, clan leaders can abandon a Clan HQ.

docs.title: /interiorhq
docs.text: The command is used by clan leaders to set an interior for the Clan HQ.

docs.title: /claninfo
docs.text: Displays certain information related to the clan. (only for leaders)

docs.title: /cvs & /cvr
docs.text: With /cvs clan members can spawn the clan's vehicles, with the /cvr command, a member with rank 5+ can respawn all clan vehicles.

docs.title: /buyclanvehicle
docs.text: The command is used by clan leaders to buy vehicles for the clan.

docs.title: /clanwar
docs.text: The command is used by members with rank 5+ or members who have been given access to it to add/remove players from the clan war.

docs.title: /guns
docs.text: With this command you can choose your weapon set during clan wars.

docs.title: /leavewar
docs.text: With this command you can exit your clan's war.

docs.title: Premium
docs.text:
Shop Interface

This category of commands uses exclusively the server's real currency (gold), so please use them carefully to avoid unwanted situations.

docs.title: /shop
docs.text:
Any player can use this command to open the B-Zone community's virtual store (see the store in the image), on the RPG server. The store consists of a dialog with rows that present information following the model:

  • Product name - Amount of gold required for purchase

The dialog title contains the amount of gold you have at that moment. If you have enough gold to buy a certain product from the store, the product's price will be colored green, otherwise red.

docs.title: /hiddencolor
docs.text: The command can only be used near the "CarColor" business and has the effect of teleporting the car into the color selection menu. There you can select special colors for your vehicle using gold, colors that cannot be accessed by simply typing the /carcolor command. The color selection menu is welcoming and extremely easy to use.

docs.title: Vehicles
docs.text:
Vehicle Image

Everyone wants to have a beautiful, perfectly functional and fast personal car, but at the same time you must also know how you can control your own vehicles. Below you will find a list of all commands you can apply to a vehicle:

docs.title: /vehicles
docs.text:
Garage Image Vehicle Options

This command represents the control center of all personal vehicles of a player. The /vehicles command also has alternatives for accessing the control center such as commands: /v, /garage and /g. All these commands lead to a single place, the control center.

After using one of these commands, the server will display a list of all owned vehicles using the following model:

  • ID of the slot occupied by the vehicle
  • Vehicle name
  • Its status (available, occupied, hidden)
  • How long until the vehicle will be despawned.

Due to SA:MP server limitations, players with premium accounts can spawn up to 8 vehicles at the same time on the server, and those without premium accounts can spawn up to 2 vehicles at the same time on the server.

By selecting a vehicle from the list, the server provides you with several options with which you can control the vehicle.

Control options:

  • Information - Information will be displayed such as: model, price, status (locked/unlocked), colors, kilometers, vehicle days, insurance, insurance cost, id, vip.
  • Locate - A checkpoint will be set at the vehicle's position.
  • Tow - Your vehicle will be respawned at the place where it was parked. The price of this service is $200.
  • Spawn/Despawn - With this option you can make your vehicle appear/disappear temporarily from the server.
  • Unblock - This option can be useful when your vehicle has been parked improperly and can no longer be used (example: in a wall, in water). The vehicle will be parked in a safe location. Then use the location service to find your vehicle.
  • Sell - Through this option you can sell the vehicle at DealerShip, only if you are around it.
  • Convert to VIP vehicle - Through this option you can convert a normal vehicle into a VIP Vehicle.
  • Spawn on login - Through this option you can select which vehicles will spawn automatically when connecting to the server.
  • Buy insurance - Through this option you can buy insurance for the vehicle.

By default, a player has 4 vehicle slots, these can be supplemented from the Shop.

docs.title: /engine
docs.text: Using this command when you are in a vehicle has the effect of starting, or as the case may be, stopping the vehicle engine. As a shortcut to the command, you can also use key 2 on the keyboard.

docs.title: /lock
docs.text: The command is used by vehicle owners to lock or unlock their own vehicle. As a shortcut to the command, key N can be used. The command can only be used from near the vehicle.

docs.title: /park
docs.text: This command will fix the position in which the vehicle will be spawned when connecting to the server or when it explodes, sinks or when the towing service (tow) is used. The command can only be used if you are at the wheel of your vehicle.

docs.title: /vehswitch
docs.text: By typing this command, you will be able to change the vehicle you are currently driving with another vehicle that is not spawned.

docs.title: /carcolor
docs.text: A player can use this command only if they are in a personal vehicle and near the CarColor business. After typing the command, the player will be teleported with the vehicle inside a garage from where they can use the menu provided to select the desired colors. If a player is not near this business, a checkpoint will be set for them.

docs.title: /buyinsurance
docs.text: By typing the command, the vehicle owner will buy insurance for the vehicle they are in. A vehicle can have a maximum of 5 insurances. A vehicle left without insurance can no longer be driven by anyone until its owner pays the necessary repairs.

docs.title: /buyvehicle
docs.text: It only works if you are near one of the two dealership doors. Once the command is typed, the server will teleport you into a garage from where you can select the desired vehicle using the menu provided. The server also provides information such as the vehicle's price and speed, allows you to change its colors and most importantly, to do a test drive.

docs.title: /givekey
docs.text:
To offer someone the keys to your own vehicle, use the /givekey command. The command uses a single parameter, the name or ID of the player to whom you want to lend the keys to your vehicle.

Example: /givekey 135

After offering the keys, the person who received them will be able to use the /lock command on the vehicle. This command can only be used near the vehicle.

docs.title: /changelock
docs.text: The command has the effect of changing the lock of the personal vehicle so that the players to whom you offered its keys can no longer unlock or lock the vehicle.

docs.title: /throw
docs.text: This command is used to throw certain objects in your possession, including the keys to a vehicle received from another player, either by renting a vehicle from specially arranged businesses (example: Bike rent). After using this command, you will no longer have a rented vehicle.

docs.title: /swapcolors
docs.text: The servers provide you with two sets of colors for your vehicles, the first set being primary, and the second secondary. By using the /swapcolors command, the vehicle colors will be reversed, which means that the primary will become secondary and the secondary will become primary.

docs.title: /v -> Sell
docs.text:
To be able to sell a vehicle at Dealership you must be near it with the car you want to sell. From the /v menu you will select the desired vehicle and then choose the Sell option.

Note: To be able to sell the tutorial car at Dealership you need at least level 5.

docs.title: /lights
docs.text: Through this command you will be able to turn on the vehicle lights without activating the NOS system if it is installed.

docs.title: Cash Vehicles
docs.text:
• Standard (cash) vehicles on RPG servers are vehicles that can be purchased using in-game currency ($) starting from level 3.
  • Standard (cash) vehicles can be sold to other players using the /trade command. They can also be sold to the Dealership for 60% of their value.
  • The complete list of all standard (cash) vehicles available at the Dealership:

docs.text:
• Dealership Price - The price at which you can buy a new vehicle from the Dealership.
  • Dealership Refund - The amount of money you receive if you sell your car to the Dealership (/v -> vehicle -> '''Sell''').
  • Dealership Gold Refund - The amount of money you receive if you sell your car to the Dealership (/v -> vehicle -> '''Sell'''), when it was purchased with Gold.
  • Maximum Speed - The maximum speed the vehicle can reach.
  • Based on - Real car names associated by similarity with those in San Andreas.
  • Number of Seats - The maximum number of players that can enter the vehicle at the same time (including the driver).
  • Price in Gold - If it appears in a vehicle's information list, it means that the vehicle can be purchased using real currency, gold (so it can also be found on the gold vehicles list) and displays the amount of gold required for purchase.
  • Tunable - If the vehicle is tunable, the name of the tuning shop it belongs to is displayed, otherwise the message "Not tunable" is shown.

docs.title: How to Buy
docs.text:
﻿--- icon: material/car

﻿# How to buy vehicles

Dealership Location

Reading this article, you will find out how you can buy a certain vehicle directly from the Dealership. The Dealership is a building located in the east of Los Santos city and is known as a vehicle distribution agency. Vehicles purchased from Dealership are new, have no damage and have the mileage set to 0 kilometers.

docs.title: General features
docs.text:
Dealership Exterior
  • The Dealership has two doors (see the image above):
  • Left door - From there you can buy standard vehicles.
  • Right door - From there you can buy premium vehicles.
  • Standard vehicles can only be purchased starting from level 3. These vehicles are limited depending on the stock available on the server.
  • Premium vehicles can be purchased regardless of your level. These vehicles have unlimited stock and can be purchased anytime.
  • The /buyvehicle command is protected by PIN.

docs.title: How to buy a new vehicle?
docs.text: Dealership Interior

docs.title: Standard vehicles
docs.text:
To buy one of the standard vehicles from RPG servers, follow these steps:

  1. Position yourself near the left door of the Dealership.
  2. Type the /buyvehicle command.
  3. Select the desired vehicle (using the < and > arrows), then press the Buy Model or Test Model button if you want to test the vehicle. If you opt for testing the vehicle, you will have three minutes at your disposal. Vehicle testing will be done in a virtual world, which means you will not be able to meet any other player.
  4. Make sure the vehicle you want to buy is in stock. If it has 0 stock then it cannot be purchased from the Dealership but only from other players.
  5. As soon as you press the Buy Model button, you will exit the Dealership, and your new vehicle will be positioned in the underground parking of the Dealership. In case of boats and helicopters, use the /v command to locate the newly purchased vehicle.

Note: Find the standard vehicles list on the Standard Vehicles page.

docs.title: Premium vehicles
docs.text:
To buy one of the premium vehicles from RPG servers, follow these steps:

  1. Position yourself near the right door of the Dealership.
  2. Type the /buyvehicle command.
  3. The server will display some information about using and purchasing premium vehicles. After reading them, continue by pressing Order.
  4. To buy a premium vehicle make sure you have a free slot by typing the /vehicles command.
  5. Premium vehicles are permanent and cannot be sold to other players.
  6. They can be sold to the Dealership for 40% of their value. This amount will appear on the right when you choose to buy the vehicle.
  7. Select the desired vehicle (using the < and > arrows), then press the Buy Model or Test Model button if you want to test the vehicle. If you opt for testing the vehicle, you will have three minutes at your disposal. Vehicle testing will be done in a virtual world, which means you will not be able to meet any other player.
  8. As soon as you press the Buy Model button, you will exit the Dealership, and your new vehicle will be positioned in the underground parking of the Dealership. In case of boats and helicopters, use the /v command to locate the newly purchased vehicle.

Note: Find the premium vehicles list on the Premium Vehicles page.

docs.title: Special vehicles
docs.text:
To buy one of the special vehicles from RPG servers, follow these steps:

  1. Send a ticket on our website to the Shop section.
  2. Fill in the form with the desired vehicle and payment method (euro or in-game money).
  3. As soon as possible an administrator will take care of your ticket and will withdraw the amount from your account, respectively will set the desired vehicle on your account.

Note: Find the special vehicles list on the Shop Vehicles page.
