docs.title: Useful Commands
docs.text:
﻿--- icon: material/car

﻿# Useful commands for vehicles

Vehicle Representation

Everyone wants to have a beautiful, perfectly functional and fast personal car, but you also need to know how you can control your own vehicles. Below you will find a list of all the commands you can apply to a vehicle:

docs.title: /vehicles
docs.text:
Vehicle Garage

This command represents the control center of all personal vehicles of a player. The /vehicles command also has alternatives to access the control center such as: /v, /garage and /g. All these commands lead you to one place, the control center.

After using one of these commands, the server will display a list of all owned vehicles using the following format:

  • The ID of the slot occupied by the vehicle
  • The vehicle name
  • Its status (available, occupied, hidden)
  • After how long the vehicle will be despawned.

Due to SA:MP server limitations, players with premium accounts can spawn up to 8 vehicles at the same time on the server, while those without premium accounts can spawn up to 2 vehicles at the same time on the server.

By selecting a vehicle from the list, the server will provide several options with which you can control the vehicle.

Vehicle Options

Control options:

  • Information - You will be shown information such as: model, price, status (locked/unlocked), colors, kilometers, car age, insurance, insurance cost, id, vip.
  • Locate - A checkpoint will be set at the vehicle position.
  • Tow - Your vehicle will be respawned where it was parked. The price of this service is $200.
  • Spawn/Despawn - With this option you can make your vehicle appear/disappear temporarily from the server.
  • Unlock - This option can be useful when your vehicle has been parked incorrectly and can no longer be used (example: in a wall, in water). The vehicle will be parked in a safe location. Then use the locate service to find your vehicle.
  • Sell - Through this option you can sell the vehicle to DealerShip, only if you are around it.
  • Convert to VIP vehicle - Through this option you can convert a normal vehicle into a VIP Vehicle.
  • Spawn on connect - Through this option you can select which vehicles will spawn automatically when connecting to the server.
  • Buy insurance - Through this option you can buy vehicle insurance.

By default, a player has 4 vehicle slots, which can be supplemented from the Shop.

docs.title: /engine
docs.text: Using this command when you are in a vehicle results in starting or, as the case may be, stopping the vehicle engine. As a shortcut for the command, you can also use the 2 key on the keyboard.

docs.title: /lock
docs.text: The command is used by vehicle owners to lock or unlock their own vehicle. As a shortcut for the command, the N key can be used. The command can only be used near the vehicle.

docs.title: /park
docs.text: This command will fix the position where the vehicle will be spawned when connecting to the server or when it explodes, sinks or when the towing service is used. The command can only be used if you are at the wheel of your vehicle.

docs.title: /vehswitch
docs.text: By typing this command, you will be able to switch the vehicle you are currently driving with another vehicle that is not spawned.

docs.title: /carcolor
docs.text: A player can use this command only if they are in a personal vehicle and near the CarColor business. After typing the command, the player will be teleported with the vehicle inside a garage from where they can use the menu provided to select the desired colors. If a player is not near this business, a checkpoint will be set for them.

docs.title: /buyinsurance
docs.text: By typing the command, the vehicle owner will buy insurance for the vehicle they are in. A vehicle can have a maximum of 5 insurances. A vehicle without insurance can no longer be driven by anyone until its owner pays the necessary repairs.

docs.title: /buyvehicle
docs.text: It only works if you are near one of the two doors of the dealership. Once the command is typed, the server will teleport you to a garage from where you can select the desired vehicle using the menu provided. The server will also provide information such as the price and speed of the vehicle, allow you to change its colors and most importantly, perform a test drive.

docs.title: /givekey
docs.text:
To give someone the keys to your own vehicle, use the /givekey command. The command uses a single parameter, the name or ID of the player to whom you want to lend the keys to your vehicle. Example: /givekey 135

After giving the keys, the one who received them will be able to use the /lock command on the vehicle. This command can only be used near the vehicle.

docs.title: /changelock
docs.text: The command has the effect of changing the lock of the personal vehicle so that the players to whom you gave the keys can no longer unlock or lock the vehicle.

docs.title: /throw
docs.text: This command is used to throw certain objects in your possession, including keys to a vehicle received from another player, either by renting a vehicle from specially designed businesses (example: Bike rent). After using this command, you will no longer have a rented vehicle.

docs.title: /swapcolors
docs.text: The servers provide two sets of colors for your vehicles, the first set being primary and the second secondary. By using the /swapcolors command, the vehicle colors will be swapped, which means that the primary will become secondary and the secondary will become primary.

docs.title: /v -> Sell
docs.text: To be able to sell a vehicle to the Dealership you must be near it with the car you want to sell. From the /v menu you will select the desired vehicle and then choose the Sell option Note: To be able to sell the tutorial car to Dealership you need at least level 5.

docs.title: /lights
docs.text: Through this command you will be able to turn on the vehicle headlights without activating the NOS system if it is installed.

docs.title: 2FA Recovery
docs.text: Players who have lost access to the device on which they had the 2FA application for their RPG account will be locked out of the account if they did not save the unique activation key when they did the activation.

docs.title: How do I recover the unique 2FA key?
docs.text:
• The RPG website offers you the possibility to recover the unique 2FA activation key through the email address set on the account.

  • To do this you must follow these steps:

  • Access the website.

  • Go to the Sign In section.
  • Press the Recovery button and from the displayed list choose Recover 2FA.
  • Enter the name of the account for which you want to recover the key together with the email address set on that account.

Note: If the email address entered is not exactly the same, you will not receive the key by email because you cannot prove that it is you.

docs.title: How do I use the key received in the application?
docs.text:
1. Download one of the Two Factor Authentificator applications from Google Play or AppStore, you can use both Google Authentificator and Authy (the steps are the same).
2FA Applications
  1. Enter the downloaded application then click the + button and then choose Manual entry.
Add Account Manual Entry
  1. In the Account box you can enter the account name to know which account it is from so you don't get confused if you have more than one.
  2. In the Key box enter the entire key exactly as you received it by email (try to be very careful with diacritics and letters that look similar).
Enter key
  1. Then the application generates the unique 6-digit code that you can use again to access your account.

docs.title: Similar Posts
docs.text:
• Account - Password Recovery
  • Account - Account Recovery

docs.title: How do I recover my account?
docs.text:
• Players who have lost access to their account for various reasons can make an account recovery request by going to the login page and pressing the "Recovery - Recover Account" button.
  • The link specified above will take you to a page where you enter the current name of your account. In case it has been changed in the meantime, you can click on the link "Can't find your account? Click here". From there you will be able to search for the account by the previous name.
  • Within the recovery request, the questions are established by admins and answers as detailed as possible are needed, so that they can establish based on them whether the account belongs to you or not.

Verifications are made by admins 4+ and each question can be validated or invalidated by them, following which a percentage will be established.

  • Following the closure of a request with a positive response, the email address set on the account will be replaced with the one completed in the request.

At the time of closing a request, the author will receive an email to the email address completed in the form informing them about the response received and additional details.

If an account recovery attempt has been made and a positive response has been received, another one cannot be made for that account for one year. If 3 consecutive negative responses have been received, a request cannot be created for one month.

docs.title: Ban List
docs.text:
Below you can find links to the Ban list:

  • RPG.B-ZONE.RO

If an account has been banned or still is, it will definitely appear in the ban list. The information is presented in the form of a table, each line representing a sanction. The table is structured as follows:

Ban list example
  • IP: This is the IP address of the sanctioned account. The word "Offline" will be displayed if the player was not connected to the server at the time of sanctioning. This information can only be seen by RPG server admins.
  • Player: This is the name of the sanctioned account.
  • Admin: This is the name of the admin who issued the sanction.
  • Time: This is the moment (date and time) when the sanction was issued.
  • Duration: This is the expiration date of the ban. If the ban is permanent, the word "Permanent" will be displayed.
  • Reason: This column contains the reason for sanctioning.

Players who believe they have been sanctioned unfairly can request a re-evaluation of the sanction: Unban Requests

docs.title: Clans
docs.text:
Top clans at a given moment

Info

For details about clans click here.

docs.title: Clan Turfs
docs.text:
• This page displays the in-game map with all clan zones.
  • The color of the zones is given by the color of the clan that owns the respective zone.
  • By placing the mouse over one of them you can see the name of the zone in the game as well as the name of the clan that owns it.

docs.title: Top Clans
docs.text:
This page displays a table with all clans on the server which presents the following information about each clan:

  • #: represents the row number.
  • Name: represents the full name of the clan.
  • Tag: represents the clan's tag.
  • Clan Level: represents the current clan level.
  • Date created: represents the date when the clan was founded.
  • Members: represents the number of current members out of the maximum number of available members.
  • HQ: represents the availability of the clan for an HQ.
    • None means that this clan does not have an HQ. Any other number between 0 and 42 represents the in-game ID of the HQ.
  • Minimum level: represents the minimum level you need to be able to apply to the clan.
  • Application status: represents the status of applications for the clan, whether they are open or closed.
  • Apply: represents whether or not you can apply to that clan.

Each clan owner has a certain control panel on the website, similar to that of faction leaders, from where they can invite, kick out members or give clan warnings and ranks.

Clans RPG

docs.title: How to apply?
docs.text:
To apply to a clan, from this page you must press the Apply button located next to the desired clan name. The website will redirect you to a form that you must complete, and after completion send the application to the clan owner for examination.

Warning: When completing an application, don't rush and don't exaggerate with unnecessary details. Use warm and decent language, explaining only the necessary information. A hastily completed and superficially thought application diminishes your chances of being accepted. You must keep in mind that the applications you complete remain permanently stored in the servers' databases and are visible on your profile.

docs.title: How to find out if your application has been answered?
docs.text: The website has a notification system, so each player is notified when the clan leader for which you sent an application responds to your application.

docs.title: Haven't been accepted?
docs.text: If your application hasn't been accepted, don't worry. Perseverance will lead to results, it's just a matter of time until you are accepted into a clan. When you are rejected, read the clan leader's response carefully and think about what your application was missing. After you understand the reason for rejection, gather your thoughts and complete a new application. This time, make sure to cover the mistakes from the last application.

docs.title: Top Alliances
docs.text:
This page displays a table with all clans that form an alliance on the server, which presents the following information about each alliance:

  • #: represents the row number.
  • Name: represents the alliance name.
  • Members: represents the total number of alliance members (the total number of members from all allied clans).
  • Allied clans: represents the names of the allied clans.

docs.title: Clan Levels
docs.text:
This page will display all available clan levels, divided into 3 categories:

  • LEVEL: will display a representative image depending on the clan level.
  • EXPERIENCE: will display the amount of XP required to unlock that level.
  • FEATURES: will display all benefits of each clan level.

docs.title: Economy
docs.text:
Info

For the Economy system you can enter here.

Economy tab

docs.title: General characteristics
docs.text:
The Economy system has the main purpose of ensuring advertising of players' personal goods that they want to sell or exchange for another personal good.

The tab includes the following information:

  • Vehicles
  • Houses
  • Shop Houses
  • Businesses
  • Clans
  • Skins
  • Auctions

docs.title: Vehicles
docs.text:
In this sub-page you can see the vehicles put up for sale by players to make them an offer along with the following information:

  • Preview: displays a small representative image of the vehicle.
  • Vehicle Model: displays the vehicle name.
  • Vehicle KM: displays the total number of kilometers of the vehicle.
  • Vehicle Age: displays the total (approximate) number of days of the vehicle.
  • Price: displays the price chosen by the player to sell the vehicle.
  • Seller: displays the name of the player who listed the vehicle.
  • Seller Level: displays the level of the player who listed the vehicle.
  • Last Login: displays the seller's last login date to the server.
  • Posted on: displays the listing date of the vehicle by the seller.
  • Status: displays the listing status, whether it is still valid or not (whether it was purchased or not).
  • View: displays another separate page where you can make an offer to the seller, you can see in more detail the offers made by players as well as their comments.

docs.title: Houses
docs.text:
In this tab you can see the houses put up for sale by players and you can make them an offer along with the following information:

  • Preview: displays a small representative image of the house interior.
  • House ID: displays the in-game ID of the house.
  • House Interior: displays the house interior ID.
  • Price: displays the price chosen by the player to sell the house.
  • Seller: displays the name of the player who listed the house.
  • Seller Level: displays the level of the player who listed the house.
  • Last Login: displays the seller's last login date to the server.
  • Posted on: displays the listing date of the house by the seller.
  • Status: displays the listing status, whether it is still valid or not (whether it was purchased or not).
  • View: displays another separate page where you can make an offer to the seller, you can see in more detail the offers made by players as well as their comments.

docs.title: Shop Houses
docs.text:
In this page you can see the level 999 houses existing on the server and available for purchase depending on the interior type along with the following information:

  • Preview: displays a small representative image of the house interior.
  • House ID: displays the in-game ID of the house.
  • House Interior: displays the house interior ID.
  • House Level: displays the house level.
  • Price: displays the house price in client euros.
    • The displayed price is not negotiable, it is a fixed price.
    • Houses whose price is not available means that the price varies depending on the size of the house, location area, desired interior.
  • City: displays the city where the house is located.
  • Location: displays a button called Map through which you are redirected to another page where you can see the in-game map along with a red dot where the house is located.

Below the entire list of houses, there is some more information about what you need to do to purchase the house along with what you need to know before agreeing to purchase the house.

docs.title: Businesses
docs.text:
In this tab you can see the businesses put up for sale by players and you can make them an offer along with the following information:

  • Preview: displays a small representative image of the business interior.
  • Business ID: displays the in-game ID of the business.
  • Business Category: displays the business type.
  • Price: displays the price chosen by the player to sell the business.
  • Seller: displays the name of the player who listed the business.
  • Seller Level: displays the level of the player who listed the business.
  • Last Login: displays the seller's last login date to the server.
  • Posted on: displays the listing date of the business by the seller.
  • Status: displays the listing status, whether it is still valid or not (whether it was purchased or not).
  • View: displays another separate page where you can make an offer to the seller, you can see in more detail the offers made by players as well as their comments.

docs.title: Clans
docs.text:
In this tab you can see the clans put up for sale by players and you can make them an offer along with the following information:

  • Clan Name: displays the clan name.
  • Clan Tag: displays the clan tag.
  • Slots: displays the maximum number of slots the clan has.
  • Price: displays the price chosen by the player to sell the clan.
  • Seller: displays the name of the player who listed the clan.
  • Seller Level: displays the level of the player who listed the clan.
  • Last Login: displays the seller's last login date to the server.
  • Posted on: displays the listing date of the clan by the seller.
  • Status: displays the listing status, whether it is still valid or not (whether it was purchased or not).
  • View: displays another separate page where you can make an offer to the seller, you can see in more detail the offers made by players as well as their comments.

docs.title: Skins
docs.text:
In this tab you can see the Diamond/Onyx skins put up for sale by players and you can make them an offer along with the following information:

  • Preview: displays a small image of the skin.
  • Skin ID: displays the skin ID.
  • Skin Type: displays the skin type.
  • Rarity: displays the skin rarity.
  • Price: displays the price set by the seller.
  • Seller: displays the seller's name.
  • Seller Level: displays the level of the player who listed the clan.
  • Last Login: displays the seller's last login date to the server.
  • Posted on: displays the listing date of the clan by the seller.
  • Status: displays the listing status, whether it is still valid or not (whether it was purchased or not).
  • View: displays another separate page where you can make an offer to the seller, you can see in more detail the offers made by players as well as their comments.

docs.title: Auctions
docs.text:
In this tab you can see all auctions that have taken place and will take place along with the following information:

  • Property ID: displays the in-game ID of the property.
  • Preview: displays a representative image of the business, respectively the house interior.
  • Interior / Category: displays the business type if the auction is for a business, respectively the house interior ID in the case of houses.
  • Type: displays the auction type.
  • Added by: displays the name of the admin who initiated the auction.
  • Time: displays the date and time when the auction was initiated.
  • Status: displays the auction status.

To participate in such an auction you must be online in game at 20:00 on the same date when the auction was initiated by the admin (on the same day).

docs.title: How do I make an offer to someone?
docs.text: To make an offer you must press the View button next to the good listed by the player, then the Oferta / Offer button which displays an interface from where you can offer an amount of money, other goods in exchange (if the seller accepts exchanges) as well as a comment for the offer made.

docs.title: How do I respond to someone's offer?
docs.text:
If you access your own listing, you will have the option to accept or reject the offer received from a player.

Then that offer will appear with Offer Rejected respectively Offer Accepted to be visible to everyone.

docs.title: How do I take possession of a good?
docs.text: To take possession of the good (if the seller accepted your offer), you will have to meet the seller of the good in game and make a deal through the /trade command.

docs.title: How do I put a good up for sale?
docs.text:
1. Access one of the RPG sites.
  2. Log in to the site with your in-game username and password.
  3. From the menu on the left choose My Account and then Property.
  4. For the desired good press the Place for sale basket and from the interface that appears choose the desired price as well as whether or not you accept other goods in exchange.

docs.title: General characteristics
docs.text:
Factions are special groups that server players can join. If you don't want to be simple civilians, you can integrate into a faction. Correlating factions with real life, they represent, to a certain extent, a stable job.

Factions RPG

The page has a list with information structured in several tables, each table including:

  • Faction name
  • Number of members
  • Minimum level required to apply
  • Application status (open or closed)
  • Date and time when applications will close automatically (if a date has been set by the leader)
  • A button to apply to the faction

Note: Each faction has its name written using its corresponding color.

docs.title: How to apply?
docs.text:
To apply to a faction, from this page you must press the Apply button located next to the faction name. The website will redirect you to a form that you must complete, and after completion send the application to the faction leader for examination.

Warning: When completing an application, don't rush and don't exaggerate with unnecessary details. Use warm and decent language, explaining only the necessary information. A hastily completed and superficially thought application diminishes your chances of being accepted. You must keep in mind that the applications you complete remain permanently stored in the servers' databases and are visible on your profile.

docs.title: How to find out if your application has been answered?
docs.text: The website has a notification system, so each player is notified when a faction leader responds to your application.

docs.title: Haven't been accepted?
docs.text: If a leader hasn't accepted your application, don't worry. Perseverance will lead to results, it's just a matter of time until you are accepted into a faction. When you are rejected, read the leader's response carefully and think about what your application was missing. After you understand the reason for rejection, gather your thoughts and complete a new application. This time, make sure to cover the mistakes from the last application.

docs.title: Application example
docs.text:
1. Real age: 17 years old
  2. Number of hours per day spent in game: 4 hours
  3. Game time interval: Between 15:00 and 19:00
  4. Explanations for leaving previous factions:
    • Los Santos Police Department - Being active in this faction means dedicating a large part of your time to the game to complete the imposed weekly report. School will start soon, so I decided to leave the faction and apply to a peaceful one to better structure my free time.
    • Hitmen Agency - I didn't leave the assassins agency voluntarily, but due to repeated mistakes. I made several mistakes that were not in accordance with the faction's regulations, therefore I was dismissed with 3 faction warnings (3 FW).
  5. Explanations for sanctions received from admins: I received ajail from an admin 3 months ago for non-RP behavior. The sanction was applied because the policeman who was ordering me to get out of the vehicle in flames made a complaint against me. The vehicle in flames exploded, with me in it.
  6. Your description as a person: My name is Adrian. I love vacations, and I do quite well in school. I'm passionate about action movies and I especially like watching them at a 3D cinema. I'm up to date with technology and I'm currently trying to develop my programming skills. During school, my schedule is quite busy because I have to take care of two important and at the same time hard-to-cover things: homework and friends. When I have more free time (on weekends or vacations), I prefer to spend time going for walks with friends or simply working on personal projects (for example a website, or a server).
  7. Are you on another faction's blacklist?: No
  8. Do you have English language knowledge: Yes, I have a rich vocabulary, only verb tenses sometimes give me trouble.

docs.title: Leader Panel
docs.text: The leaders' control panel is extremely important, due to the fact that from here any leader can apply sanctions or promotions and especially dismiss certain members from their team. The control panel page includes several sub-pages in the left menu, which help the leader monitor the activity of the player members of their faction.

docs.title: Members
docs.text:
From this sub-page, a leader can:

  • View the date when a certain faction member last logged in.
  • View the date when a player joined the faction.
  • View the date when the player was last promoted.
  • Promote or demote members in rank (only offline ones).
  • Remove a player from the faction (only if they are offline).
  • Give or delete faction warnings (FW).
  • View the number of faction warnings received.

docs.title: Faction activity
docs.text: By visiting this page, a leader can see the faction activity of all members. Each row in the table has a checkbox, with which the leader can declare that activity row as invalid for various reasons.

docs.title: Faction reports
docs.text:
This page displays to the leader an informative table that includes information about the reports of their faction members, as follows:

  • Player name
  • Time interval in which the activity report was recorded (one week).
  • Number of accumulated points

docs.title: Pending reports
docs.text:
All complaints to which the leader has not yet provided a final answer are sent to this page. Here there is a simple table that includes:

  • Name of the reported member
  • Name of the reporting player
  • Date when the complaint was registered
  • A button (View) for the leader to reach the complaint form completed by the reporter.

Note: From the actual complaint page, accessed through the View button, the leader can issue a final response to the complaint.

docs.title: Closed reports
docs.text: Here all complaints that have already received a response from the leader will appear. The table on this page displays the same details as on the Pending reports page.

docs.title: Pending applications
docs.text:
All applications that have not received a response (accepted/rejected/rejected at tests/invited) from the leader will appear on this page, being detailed:

  • Name of the applicant player
  • Date when the application was submitted.
  • A View button, with which the leader reaches the application form completed by the respective applicant.

docs.title: Candidates Table
docs.text: By visiting this page, the website will display a table that includes players who need to take the entry test, respectively players who have taken the entry test and the verdict given by the tester.

docs.title: Accepted applications / Rejected applications / Test failed applications / Invited applications
docs.text:
By visiting this page, the website will display a table that includes information about a certain player's application, an application that was marked as accepted/rejected/Failed at tests/Invited. The information in the table refers to:

  • Name of the accepted player
  • Date when the application was published
  • Response given by the leader
  • Date when the leader provided the response to the application
  • A View button, with which the leader reaches the application form completed by the respective applicant.

docs.title: Inactivities / Resignations
docs.text: By visiting this page, the website will display a table that includes active inactivities or resignations, respectively those processed.

docs.title: Blacklisted Members
docs.text: By visiting this page, the website will display a table with players on the faction's blacklist.

docs.title: Application Model
docs.text:
From this page, the faction leader can modify the questions for the faction entry application.

  • From this page, the minimum application requirements can also be modified.

docs.title: Application Search
docs.text: From this page, the faction leader can search for an application by a sentence or phrase, to verify its originality.

docs.title: My Account
docs.text:
#1 General Info #2 General Info #3 Jobs

Each player is able to access the "My Account" branch only if they are authenticated using the username and password they also use to access their account on one of the community's RPG servers. On the left side of the site there is a column containing several tabs with which players can find information strictly about their own accounts.

Note: You can find out what the usual in-game commands that affect your account are by clicking here.

Your Account

docs.title: General Information
docs.text:
The page dedicated to general information contains basic things, this information being divided into several tables.

  1. The main table of the page contains the most important characteristics of an account (image #1):

    • Player name
    • Email address attached to the account.
    • 2FA status (active/inactive).
    • Account registration date on the server.
    • Date when the player last connected to the server.
    • Duration of the last session in game.
    • Account status (active/banned).
    • Number of warnings received from administrators.
    • Amount of gold (gold - in-game currency) the player has.
    • Whether the player has a premium account or not (if they do, then the premium account expiration date will be displayed).

  2. The second table contains information regarding the player's social status on the RPG server such as (image #2):

    • Player's position in the top.
    • Player's position in the top for activity from the previous month.
    • Current account level.
    • Number of respect points the player has at that moment.
    • Number of hours played on the server.
    • Number of hours played in that month on the server (real + sleep).
    • Number of real hours played in that month on the server.
    • Amount of money the player has in hand.
    • Amount of money the player has in the bank.
    • Number of crates owned

  3. The third table on the page contains the player's criminal record, which means it displays (image #2):

    • If the player is married, the spouse's name.
    • Number of crimes committed on the server.
    • How many times the player has been arrested.
    • How many times the player died having at least one wanted star, being sent to jail.
    • Amount of materials the player has.
    • Amount of drugs the player has.

  4. The fourth table on the page contains information about the functions held by the player (image #2):

    • Admin Level
    • Helper Level
    • Leader

  5. The fifth and sixth tables on the page contain information about points accumulated by the player (image #2):

    • Number of accept points that only police officers can accumulate to sell warrants.
    • Number of warrants the player has to release someone from prison.
    • Total number of mission points the player has.
    • Number of rob points.
    • Number of escape points.

  6. The seventh table on the page contains the amounts of materials for the Craftsman job:

    • Number of wood materials owned.
    • Number of gold materials owned.
    • Number of cotton materials owned.
    • Number of silver materials owned.

  7. The eighth and ninth tables on the page contain various freebies (image #2):

    • Number of free name changes.
    • Number of Free VIP.
    • Number of Free Bails.
    • Number of Free Hiddens.
    • Number of Free DS stock.
    • Number of Free KM reset.
    • Number of Free Half report.
    • Number of Free Optional report.
    • Number of Free FP Clear.
    • Number of Free Warn Clear.
    • Number of Free Job skill.
    • Number of Wheel Spins.

  8. At the bottom of the page there are icons that illustrate the type of licenses a player can have. Under the icons, the number of hours remaining until the license expires is counted in real time (image #2).

  9. The general information page includes a frame displaying the photo of the skin used in game.

  10. In the upper left part of the page there are two icons, the first being a person with an envelope, and the second a simple person.

    • The first icon is visible all the time, and using it you attach (if you want) your forum profile to the sa-mp account.
    • The second icon is visible only when you have a Free Name change, and using it you can change your in-game name directly from the website (it only works if you are offline in the game).

docs.title: Messages
docs.text:
On this page you can view the private messages you have received from senior staff, respectively those you have sent to players for various reasons. Only level 4+ admins can send you messages on the website. Messages will be sent when direct communication with the respective player involved in a certain situation is necessary (clan leaders, hacked accounts, etc.) and is not available in-game at the desired time.

The page displays all messages you have received/sent, respectively in which you have been added, along with the following information:

  • Time: represents the date when the message was sent.
  • From / To: represents from whom to whom the message was sent.
  • Participants: represents the total number of participants in the message.
  • Subject: represents the title of the message.
  • Message Preview: represents a small part from the beginning of the message content.
  • Last Reply: represents the date when the last reply was given in the message.
  • View: represents a button through which you can see the entire content of the message.

The page with the message content also displays the following information and options:

  • In the upper left the title of the message.
  • In the upper right displays a representative image of the skin of each participant in the message.
  • For STAFF, under the images mentioned above, the following options are also displayed:
    • Option to add other participants in the message using their exact names.
    • Option to remove someone added from the message (in case you made a mistake with the name).
    • Option to close/open the respective message.
  • Following which the content of the message will be displayed in the page in the following order:
    • The first message in the page that is displayed represents the content that was initially written in the message when it was sent.
    • The following messages in the page represent the answers of each participant in descending order, from the most recent to the oldest.
  • Each sent reply contains the option to delete that reply, which will remain visible only to STAFF along with the date when it was deleted and by whom.
  • Once a message has been closed by STAFF, no further replies can be added by anyone until it is reopened.
  • Sent/received messages cannot be deleted. They remain in history as evidence for the purpose of their sending.
    • Occasionally there is the possibility for very old messages to be deleted permanently by the server management when it is considered that they are no longer needed.

docs.title: Marathon
docs.text:
On this page we can see all the information about the marathon when there is one in progress as follows:

  • Marathon season number.
  • Current version we have at the marathon.
    • Players who unlock the PRO version benefit from rewards from both versions, regardless of when they decide to unlock the PRO version.
    • Unlocking the PRO version can only be done in-game using the /marathon command > Get Pro and paying the amount of 3,000 Gold.
  • The day we are at with the marathon along with the number of uncollected prizes from the marathon.

Under this information, each day of the marathon, the prizes from both versions as well as the current number of points out of the required number of points for that day are found.

Under the marathon prizes, the badge you receive automatically on your website profile when completing the marathon completely can be found.

At the bottom of the page we can also find a table with all the actions we can do on the server to get points as follows:

  • Activity: represents the actual action we can do.
  • Points: represents the number of points we receive when we do that action.
  • Maximum Limit: represents the maximum number of points we can accumulate per day from that action.
    • Actions that do not have an imposed limit mean they can be done until you reach the current day with the marathon.
    • The limit reached by actions is automatically reset at midnight (00:00).

docs.title: Achievements
docs.text:
Achievements are goals you can accomplish by completing tasks. You will be rewarded for completing them.

There are two types of achievements, for a total of 280 achievements:

  • Those that can be obtained only once and others that measure how many times a certain action has occurred.
  • For example, an achievement that is awarded once is to reach level 20, and an achievement that is counted is to organize an event.

docs.title: Faction
docs.text:
The factions page contains various information and logs regarding the factions in which the player is active or has been active in the past.

There is a special table on this page that contains main data about the faction the player is part of:

  • The faction the player is part of
  • The date when the player joined
  • The player's rank in that faction
  • Number of warnings received in the faction
  • Number of penalties in the faction (Faction Punish).

docs.title: Top 5 faction ranks
docs.text: In this table, the last 5 highest ranks obtained in the faction will be displayed.

docs.title: Latest faction applications
docs.text:
The table displays the latest applications the player has submitted:

  • Date when the application was submitted
  • Faction name
  • Application status (Accepted/Failed tests/Rejected/Invited to faction)
  • A button to view the application

docs.title: Latest Faction logs
docs.text:
The table in this category contains information collected when a faction leader executes faction-specific commands (example: Invitation to faction):

  • Date when a command was executed by the faction leader
  • Faction name
  • Consequence resulting from the command execution by the leader

docs.title: Faction activity
docs.text:
On this page, any member of a faction can view personal statistics accomplished in the faction during that week.

There are two branches into which weekly statistics can fall:

  1. Total items registered as valid in the statistics.
  2. Total items registered as invalid in the statistics.

Note: If the faction leader considers that a certain item of the statistics is corrupt/fraudulent/or has other problems, they can move it to the list of invalid items. Each faction has a certain policy regarding the validity of statistics items.

docs.title: Faction reports
docs.text:
Any player can read their own reports accomplished over time in factions, with structured data displayed in a table informing you about:

  • Name of the faction in which the respective activity report was registered
  • Time interval (one week)
  • Number of points accumulated for the report

docs.title: Blacklist
docs.text: The first table on the page will display the factions that have added you to the blacklist and the information needed to remove you from that list. The next table will display all factions to which you have been added to the blacklist over time.

docs.title: Clan
docs.text:
The "Clan" branch has similar information to that of factions, displaying data about the latest applications submitted to clans and a log about the latest commands a clan leader has applied to the player.

The first table, which contains the latest applications submitted, will display the following information for each registered application:

  • Date when the application was sent
  • Clan name
  • Application status (Accepted/Rejected/Invited)
  • A View button, which once pressed, will redirect you to the application page.

docs.title: Job
docs.text:
Rented plot table.

By accessing the Job page, the website will provide you with two tables (image #3).

The data of the first table shows the value of the skill held for each job, a progress bar to highlight the evolution from skill 1 to skill 5, respectively skill 10 where applicable, as well as the name of the job you are employed at that moment.

Note: The information present in the table is in the form: Job name - Skill value - Progress bar. The first row of the table is in the form: Current job - Name of the job held at that moment.

In the second table, information about the currently rented plot can be found, such as:

  • Plot ID
  • Plot type
  • Plot expiration date
  • Time remaining available to plant the crop.

Further down the page, another table can be found with each slot of the plot out of the 16 along with the following information:

  • Plant type
  • Last watering date
  • Humidity
  • Time until it starts to run out of water
  • Date when it was planted
  • Maturity
  • Time until maturity
  • Time remaining available to harvest.

Note: All this information is updated in real time.

docs.title: Vehicles
docs.text:
Here each player is informed about the status of their garage and can view data about their own vehicles, even having a preview of them. For each vehicle owned, the following information is displayed:

  • A representative image of the vehicle.
  • Vehicle ID on the server.
  • Vehicle model.
  • Price for which the vehicle was purchased from the Dealership (if purchased from it).
  • Dealership selling price of the vehicle at the time of purchase from it.
  • Way the vehicle was purchased
    • Dealership: means the vehicle was purchased exclusively from the Dealership with in-game money.
    • Shop: means the vehicle was either purchased from the premium Dealership with gold/received from crates/bought from the special shop with client euros/etc.
  • IDs of the colors applied at that moment on the vehicle (primary and secondary).
  • Total kilometers driven by the vehicle.
  • Approximate number of days since its purchase.
  • Total number of insurances available for the vehicle.
  • Vehicle status (locked/unlocked).
  • Existence of VIP.
  • A button called Map, which, when pressed, will redirect you to a page containing an image of the San Andreas map. On the image available on the page, a red dot is inscribed, which represents the location where the vehicle is parked (/park to set a new location).
  • A button called For Sale, which, when pressed, will put the vehicle for sale on the website.

docs.title: Business
docs.text:
Only if you own a certain business, the page will display an informative table about its characteristics, presenting you with:

  • Unique ID of the business.
  • Business name, set by the owner in-game using the /bizname command.
  • Minimum level a player must have to be able to take possession of the respective building.
  • Money value of the business safe.
  • Tax value set for the respective business.
  • Estimated value of the business.
  • A button (Map), which, when pressed, will redirect you to another page. On that page the website will provide you with an entire game map that has a red dot on it. The red dot on the map represents the location of the business.

Below, a graph will be built containing information about the business activity in the last 30 days.

  • Business profit in that hour

docs.title: General Info
docs.text:
This page has an informative table about the characteristics of your own house, or the house you are renting. The table includes:

  • House ID on the server.
  • In-game name of the house.
  • House type (here the number of rooms is also displayed).
  • Interior ID of the house.
  • House level (required for purchase).
  • House door status (locked/unlocked).
  • House rent status (rentable/not rentable).
  • Rent price.
  • Amount of money collected by the owner in the house safe.
  • Healing upgrade status.
  • Armor upgrade status (for police).
  • Number of slots of the purchased garage of the house.
  • A button (Map), which, when pressed, will redirect you to another page. On that page the website will provide you with an entire game map that has a red dot on it. The red dot on the map represents the location of the player's residence/where the player is renting.
  • Total number of tenants of the house.
  • Number of tenants online at the time of accessing the page.
  • A button (Evict All), which, when pressed, will evict all current tenants of the house from rent.
  • A button (For Sale), which, when pressed, you can place the house you own for sale to receive offers from other players.

docs.title: House Renters
docs.text:
The page displays a table containing various information about tenants:

  • Name.
  • Date of last authentication on the server.
  • Level.
  • Amount of respect points.
  • Number of hours played.
  • Faction.
  • Rank held in the faction.
  • Current job.

docs.title: Bunker
docs.text:
The page displays information about the current bunker you own:

  • A representative image with the bunker.
  • Bunker name.
  • Total amount of money earned from the bunker.
  • Bunker tier along with a progress bar for it.
  • Amount of supplies along with maximum amount of supplies.
  • Amount of stock along with maximum amount of stock.
  • Security upgrade status.
  • Staff upgrade status.
  • Equipment upgrade status.
  • Supervisor upgrade status.
  • Date and time when the bunker was purchased.

docs.title: Skins
docs.text: The page displays all the skins you own, it is divided into 5 categories:

docs.title: Onyx Skins
docs.text:
• This category displays all skins that have been upgraded to Onyx.
  • The skin image contains a specific color to more easily identify skins of this type.
  • Under the skin image the following information is found:
    1. Skin ID.
    2. Skin type.
    3. First bonus and its value.
    4. Second bonus and its value.
    5. Third bonus and its value.
    6. Fourth bonus and its value.

docs.title: Diamond Skins
docs.text:
• This category displays all skins that have been upgraded to Diamond.
  • The skin image contains a specific color to more easily identify skins of this type.
  • Under the skin image the following information is found:
    1. Skin ID.
    2. Skin type.
    3. First bonus and its value.
    4. Second bonus and its value.

docs.title: Platinum Skins
docs.text:
• This category displays all owned Platinum skins.
  • The skin image contains a specific color to more easily identify skins of this type.
  • Under the skin image the following information is found:
    1. Skin ID.
    2. Skin type.
    3. Skin value in money.
    4. Skin value in gold.

docs.title: Silver/Bronze Skins
docs.text:
• These pages display all owned Silver and Bronze skins respectively.
  • Under the skin image the following information is found:
    1. Skin ID.
    2. Skin type.
    3. Skin value in money.
    4. Skin value in gold.

docs.title: Crates
docs.text: The page displays at the top the total number of crates you own, and at the bottom a table is displayed indicating the number of boxes held of each type of crate.

docs.title: Safeboxes
docs.text: The following two pages are found on this page.

docs.title: 1. Safeboxes
docs.text:
Displays at the top the total number of safeboxes you own, and at the bottom each safebox is displayed with a representative image and the following information:

  • SafeboxID: represents the safebox ID on the server. It helps you realize in the Safebox Logs page in which safebox things were stored or from which safebox things were extracted.
  • Name: represents the safebox name chosen in-game.
  • Capacity: represents the occupied capacity out of the total capacity of the safebox.
  • Materials: represents the number of materials stored in the safebox.
  • Drugs: represents the number of materials stored in the safebox.
  • 9mm: represents the number of bullets for the 9mm weapon stored in the safebox.
  • Deagle: represents the number of bullets for the Desert-Eagle weapon stored in the safebox.
  • Shotgun: represents the number of bullets for the Shotgun weapon stored in the safebox.
  • Combat: represents the number of bullets for the Combat-Shotgun weapon stored in the safebox.
  • MP5: represents the number of bullets for the MP5 weapon stored in the safebox.
  • AK-47: represents the number of bullets for the AK-47 weapon stored in the safebox.
  • M4: represents the number of bullets for the M4 weapon stored in the safebox.
  • TEC-9: represents the number of bullets for the TEC-9 weapon stored in the safebox.
  • Rifle: represents the number of bullets for the Rifle weapon stored in the safebox.
  • Sniper: represents the number of bullets for the Sniper weapon stored in the safebox.

docs.title: 2. Safebox Logs
docs.text:
Displays logs for each safebox, both when storing in it and when extracting from it in the following columns:

  • Date: displays the date when the deposits/extractions were made.
  • Name: displays the in-game name of the safebox in/from which deposits/extractions were made.
  • Safebox ID: displays the safebox ID in which deposits/extractions were made.
  • Type: displays what you deposited/extracted in/from the safebox.
  • Value: displays the amount deposited/extracted in/from the safebox.
    • If the value is positive it means it was deposited in the safebox.
    • If the value is negative it means it was extracted from the safebox.

docs.title: Skin Tickets
docs.text: The page displays in the upper left the total number of tickets and fragments you own, and at the bottom a table is displayed indicating the number of fragments and tickets held.

docs.title: Chest Rewards
docs.text:
The page displays progress on the Chest Reward (Chest) in-game along with other information such as:

  • Current tier you are at.
  • Prize status (whether it can be collected or not).
  • Progress on the respective tier (number of real hours played out of the total required number).

Also on this page, a table can be found with each level of the tier, the number of hours played required and its prizes.

docs.title: My Stats
docs.text:
Each player has two types of user bars on this page. The respective bars actually represent 2 photos on which various aspects of an account are inscribed. To make public one or both bars, all you have to do is copy the source code provided right under these photos and place it in any posting form on the forum, or even on your own websites.

User bars include:

  • Your name
  • Name of the faction you are part of
  • Rank held in the faction
  • Name of the job you are employed at
  • Account level
  • Respect points held at that moment
  • Total number of hours played on one of the B-Zone RPG servers
  • Number of warnings received from administrators
  • Player status (Online/Offline)

docs.title: Friends
docs.text:
The "Friends" page is accessed so that a player can view the number of friends they have and be informed about certain aspects of them, as follows:

  • Player's name and status (Online/Offline)
  • Their level
  • Number of respect points held at that moment
  • Number of hours played on one of the B-Zone RPG servers
  • Name of the faction the player is part of
  • Rank held in the faction
  • Name of the job the player is employed at
  • Total number of warnings received from administrators

docs.title: Referrals
docs.text:
On this page each of you can find out your own Referral ID, some information about that ID being presented right on the page. Also here is a list of all players brought to the server using your Referral ID, and below information regarding the total earnings resulting from the advancement of recruits in level. Some details about how to invite your friends to the game can be found on this page.

The recruit table includes:

  • Recruited player's name and their status (Online or Offline)
  • Date and time when they registered their account
  • Date and time when the player last authenticated on the server.
  • Number of hours spent in-game
  • Their level
  • Total respect points held by the recruit at that moment
  • Total amount of money earned from the recruit's advancement in level.
  • Total amount of money collected.
  • Total number of respect points earned from the recruit's advancement in level.
  • Total number of respect points collected.

docs.title: Name log/2FA log/Mute log/Jail log/Warn log/Ban log
docs.text: These six pages contain absolutely personal information about punishments received on the server (mute log, jail log, warn log and ban log), information showing how many times a player has changed their in-game name (name log) and information showing if the two-step authenticator has been activated or deactivated on the account, with additional information being presented.

docs.title: Security
docs.text:
Being one of the most important pages of any account, here each player can maintain their own security by changing their email address or activating their two-step authentication. By accessing the page, pressing on the first option you have the possibility to view the current email address associated with your account, as well as access the Change button to change your email address.

If you want to change your email address, but the current email address is not confirmed, then to do this you will use the /changeemail command directly in-game. For more details about changing the email address associated with the account, in-game, access the Email page. If the current email address is confirmed, then the website allows changing it using the Change button.

If you select the second option, you will receive an email with the account pin if you have a valid email on the account.

If you select the third option, Activate Two Factor Authentication, and press the Activate or Deactivate button (depending on the case) you will be able to activate/deactivate two-step authentication. More information about this as well as an installation tutorial can be found here.

docs.title: Last logins
docs.text:
To maintain your account security, the administration has provided you with this page where you can monitor when, from where, from what IP your account was accessed both in-game and on the website. The table available on the page contains information about:

  • Date when the action was recorded
  • IP used for authentication (on website or server)
  • Approximate location from where the action was performed
  • Type of authentication (on website or on server)

Note: You should keep in mind that the location displayed in the table is generated based on IP and may be inaccurate in some cases.

docs.title: Gold transactions
docs.text:
Here you can see each addition or reduction of the amount of gold held by a player. The page also provides the date of modification of the gold amount, as well as the type of transaction (example: gift, shop). The informative table on this page will display:

  • Date when the transaction was made
  • Transaction type
  • Gold value involved in the transaction

docs.title: Shop transactions
docs.text:
Gold is an important part of a player's statistics, therefore you can view from this page what items have been purchased using the real in-game currency, using the /shop command. To familiarize yourself with the page information, you need to know the table composition, which contains for each transaction:

  • Name of the purchased item
  • Gold price of the item
  • Discount resulting from the transaction, if it was made during a discount period
  • Date when the transaction was made

docs.title: Quest Map
docs.text: Here you can see what pickups remain to be taken from the active Quest.

docs.title: Badges
docs.text:
On this page you can manage the badges you have unlocked. In the first part of the page you find some instructions on how to use the system and at the bottom you find a table with badges along with the following information:

  • Badge Icon: displays the image of the respective badge.
  • Badge Name: displays the name of the respective badge.
  • Unlocked: displays the date and time when you received that badge.
  • Sort: displays a box with the order number of the respective badge (the order being descending).
    • For a badge to be displayed first (from top to bottom) you must assign it the value 6.
    • For a badge to be displayed second (from top to bottom) you must assign it the value 5.
    • For a badge to be displayed third (from top to bottom) you must assign it the value 4.
    • For a badge to be displayed fourth (from top to bottom) you must assign it the value 3.
    • For a badge to be displayed fifth (from top to bottom) you must assign it the value 2.
    • For a badge to be displayed sixth (from top to bottom) you must assign it the value 1.
    • If you don't want a specific place for a certain badge you must assign it the value 0.
  • Hidden: displays a box that if you check, that badge will not be displayed on the profile anymore.

After you have made the desired modifications you need to use the Save button to save.

Note: A maximum of 6 badges can be displayed on the profile.

docs.title: General Badges
docs.text:
B-Pets Winner

B-Pets Winner - Offered to players who win 1st place in the B-Pets contest.

B-Setups Winner

B-Setups Winner - Offered to players who win 1st place in the B-Setup contest.

Donator

Donator - Offered to players who have reached the amount of 10,900 Gold added in-game.

Economy Savior

Economy Savior - Offered to players from whom $100,000,000 is withdrawn from their account.

Marathon Completionist

Marathon Completionist - Offered to players who complete an entire Marathon season.

Quest Completionist

Quest Completionist - Offered to players who complete the entire Quest.

Miss B-Zone

Miss B-Zone - Offered to female players who win 1st place in the Miss and Mister contest.

Mister B-Zone

Mister B-Zone - Offered to male players who win 1st place in the Miss and Mister contest.

Retired Admin

Retired Admin - Offered to players who held in the past the admin function.

Retired Helper

Retired Helper - Offered to players who held in the past the helper function.

Retired Leader

Retired Leader - Offered to players who held in the past the leader function.

Veteran Faction Member

Veteran Faction Member - Offered to players who have accumulated at least 4 years of seniority in a single faction.

VIP

VIP - Offered exclusively to senior admins (level 4+).

Youtuber

Youtuber - Offered to players who are part of the official team of community content creators.

B-Vlog Team

B-Vlog Team - Offered to players who are part of the official B-Vlog team of the community.

Social Media

Social Media - Offered to players who are part of the official Social Media team of the community.

B-Zone Radio DJ

B-Zone Radio DJ - Offered to players who are part of the Radio Team of the community.

Cheater Team

Cheater Team - Offered to staff members who are part of the Cheaters Team of the community.

Cheater Team Manager

Cheater Team Manager - Offered to admins who coordinate the Cheaters Team of the community.

Community Founder

Community Founder - NOT offered to players, held only by Bobo.

Community Manager

Community Manager - NOT offered to players, held only by Kelton.

RPG Administrator

RPG Administrator - Offered exclusively to supervisors.

Developer

Developer - Offered exclusively to game or website developers.

To remember: All these badges are awarded automatically by the server when you are eligible for that badge, if you haven't received it it means you are most likely not currently eligible to receive it. They can also be awarded by STAFF if somehow they were not awarded automatically or are not made to be awarded automatically.

2023 Christmas Quest

2023 Discord B-Pass

2024 Spring B-Pass

2024 Spring B-Pass - This badge was offered to all players who completed the Spring 2024 B-Pass edition to the end, organized on the community's discord server.

2024 Quest Enthusiast

16 Years Together

16 Years Together - This badge was offered to all players who completed the Community Day Quest 2024 to the end.

2024 Christmas Quest

2024 Christmas Quest - This badge was offered to all players who completed the quest to the end on the occasion of Christmas in 2024.

2024 Christmas B-Pass

2024 Christmas B-Pass - This badge was offered to all players who completed the Christmas 2024 B-Pass edition to the end, organized on the community's discord server.

2025 Unification Quest

2025 Unification Quest - This badge was offered to all players who completed the quest to the end on the occasion of the Small Union in 2025.

2025 Valentine's Days

2025 Valentine's Days - This badge was offered to all players who completed the quest to the end on the occasion of Valentine's Day in 2025.

2025 Women's Days

2025 Women's Days - This badge was offered to all players who completed the quest to the end on the occasion of Women's Day in 2025.

2025 Easter Quest

2025 Easter Quest - This badge was offered to all players who completed the quest to the end on the occasion of Easter in 2025.

2025 Spring B-Pass

2025 Children's Quest

2025 Halloween Quest

2025 Christmas Quest

To remember: All these badges were offered automatically by the server at the respective time, they cannot be awarded manually not even by STAFF.

docs.title: Custom Badges
docs.text: The possibility of purchasing custom badges is offered in exchange for the amount of 3000 Gold (bought from the shop in the last 7 days). For more details you can open a ticket on the website where you will receive all the necessary details about purchasing your own badge.

docs.title: Password Recovery
docs.text: Players who have forgotten, lost, etc. their in-game account password will no longer be able to recover it if they do not have a valid email address set on the account to which they also have access.

docs.title: How do I recover my password?
docs.text:
• The RPG website offers you the possibility to recover your account password through the email address set on the account.

  • To do this you must follow these steps:

  • Access the website for the desired server.

  • Go to the Sign In section.
  • Press the Recovery button and from the displayed list choose Recover Password.
  • Enter the name of the account for which you want to recover the key together with the email address set on that account.

Note: If the email address entered is not exactly the same, you will not receive the password by email because you cannot prove that it is you.

Once you have received the email, open it and in it you will find the new password automatically set on your account, you use it to connect to the server, and later you can change it in game.

docs.title: Similar Posts
docs.text:
• Email - General Information
  • Account - Password Change in game
  • Website - Account Recovery
  • Website - 2FA Recovery

docs.title: Players
docs.text:
Search box List of authenticated players on one of the servers

As the title says, this page contains information about the server's players. There are certain tabs that make up the "Players" category as follows:

Players RPG

docs.title: Online players
docs.text: In this sub-page, players authenticated on the server at that moment are listed. The listing of players is done by categories, depending on the faction they belong to (Civilians, LSPD, National Guard, etc.), each having next to their name, an icon with the skin they are wearing in the game.

docs.title: Search player
docs.text: Any player can perform searches based on a certain name entered in the box on the page. As you type a player's name in the box, the website displays the found results, thus making searching for friends extremely easy. Once the name you are looking for is displayed, you can view their profile with a single click on it. When you enter a player's profile, the menu on the left will display the categories of information you can view about that player, exactly as in the case of the My Account page.

docs.title: Complaints
docs.text:
In this tab you can view all the complaints made by the server's players. The complaints are structured in a paginated table and include the following information:

  • Name of the reported player
  • Name of the reporting player
  • Date and time of complaint creation
  • Name of the administrator who provided the final response to the complaint (if they responded)
  • Date and time when the response was given by an administrator
  • Complaint status
  • A button to view the respective complaint

Note: Learn more details about complaints by clicking here.

Also above the table there is a box with which any player can search for certain complaints based on the name of the reported or reporting player.

docs.title: Unban Requests
docs.text:
To send an unban request to the RPG servers' administration, one of the available buttons (Account Unban / IP Unban) will be pressed, depending on the type of ban. Also on this page, all unban requests you have made over time are displayed.

  • Requests for unbanning an account can be made after a maximum of 3 days from the sanction date.
  • Requests for unbanning an IP can be made at any time and can be re-sent after 7 days from the last unban request.
  • Administrators level 4 or higher will be able to respond to unban requests by pressing the Raspunde/Answer button.
  • Faction leaders can see if faction members have made unban requests in the last 7 days.

docs.title: Reports
docs.text:
Reports table

A report represents a notification of rule violation that a player can make either to the server administrators or to the leader of the faction to which the reported player belongs.

WARNING

Unfounded, offensive reports may result in sanctions for the reporter!

WARNING

Both the reported player, the reporting player and the rule violation must have the same server in common!

WARNING

Reports made for the sake of seeing the player punished, without being directly involved will be sanctioned, read more here.

docs.title: How to report someone?
docs.text:
First of all, to report a player you must log into your own account on the website of the server you belong to. Once logged in, you must access the "Players" page from the website menu, then go to the "Search Player" sub-page and search for the profile of the player you want to report. As soon as the searched player's name is displayed by the automatic search, enter their profile.

To report a player you will need at least level 3.

docs.title: Report to administrators
docs.text: To report the player to the server administration, in the "General Info" sub-page press the "Report this player to admins" button. The website will redirect you to a simple form that you must complete correctly, thus making the report valid.

docs.title: Report to faction leader
docs.text: To report the player to the faction leader they belong to (this is only possible if the player is not a civilian), in the "Faction" sub-page press the "Report this player to faction leader" button. The website will redirect you to a form similar to that of reports to administrators, which you must complete correctly, thus making the report valid.

docs.title: External links
docs.text: RPG server reports list

docs.title: Shop
docs.text: This page displays all products that you can purchase with Gold in game.

docs.title: Page title
docs.text:
Shop Products

Under the page title we will be informed if there are active discounts on the servers as well as a counter that indicates how long these discounts are still active.

docs.title: Page content
docs.text:
Below we will find each product available in the game categorized by their type and structured as follows:

  • Product Name: displays the product name in game.
  • Price: displays the product price. (when there are active discounts on the shop they will be displayed)
  • Info: displays the main information about what the respective product offers us.

Premium Account: we will find all available packages that offer us a Premium Account.

Cash Money: we will find all available packages that offer us cash money directly in game.

Vehicle Products: we will find all vehicles that we can purchase from the Premium Dealership as well as all products related to vehicles.

House Products: we will find all products with interiors and garages for houses.

Clan Products: we will find all products for creating a clan as well as those related to the clan.

Skin Products: we will find the three types of skins that can be purchased as well as the two types of skin tickets.

Account Products: we will find all products with which we can perform different actions on our account or which we can use in different actions.

docs.title: Staff
docs.text:
Sidebar

The Staff page represents the brain of the community. There you can find the names of the most important people on the RPG servers. The entire Staff is made up of administrators, helpers and leaders.

In the left menu, the three categories of people who are part of the Staff are presented. Each sub-page contains informative tables that show the name of the Staff member and the date they last logged in.

STAFF RPG

docs.title: Admins
docs.text:
They are responsible for the proper functioning of the servers, maintaining order so that any player feels safe. Administrators help newly arrived players, occasionally organize events with special prizes, different from other events. On important days such as holidays, administrators are with the players and supervise to maintain decency both in the game chat and in the players' actions.

If you ever find a player who violates the servers' regulations, or who does any action that results in bad things, feel free to use the /report command. The /report command is the command that puts you in direct contact with the server administrators, being the fastest way to contact them. Help maintain order on the server, use /report!

docs.title: Helpers
docs.text:
Helpers are small apprentices of the administrators, which is why most often a helper is promoted after a period of time to administrator.

Their function is limited, they don't have as many rights as administrators and are not allowed to use the commands made available through the function for personal purposes. They only deal with helping players, mostly with answering questions from others on the server. To get in touch with a helper, each player can use the /helpme command. A helper always makes sure that players are well informed and speaks to them in a pleasant tone, without offending them.

docs.title: Leaders
docs.text: A leader is a person mainly concerned with the proper functioning of their faction. They have the right to add new members to their faction team and to dismiss those who violate the imposed rules. In addition to the faction's main rules, a leader has the right to impose new rules on their members.

docs.title: General characteristics
docs.text:
The main page of statistics is represented by the top players. The top is updated based on the level of all players, being displayed in a paginated table. Also in sub-pages you can find various statistics about the server such as businesses & houses on the server, list of bans given, etc.

Statistics RPG

docs.title: Top Achievements
docs.text:
In this category, each type of achievement is presented along with their number.

  • General Achievements (30)
  • General Faction Achievements (7)
  • Peaceful Faction Achievements (20)
  • Gangs Achievements (13)
  • Departments Achievements (21)
  • Mixt Factions Achievements (13)
  • Jobs Achievements (108)
  • Staff Achievements (16)
  • Clans Achievements (13)
  • Vehicles Achievements (14)
  • Combat Achievements (18)
  • Special Achievements (2)

docs.title: Top monthly played
docs.text:
Top players from last month

In this category there is a paginated table that includes columns arranged with players who have played the most hours over a period of one month.

The table contains the following information:

  • Position occupied.
  • Player name.
  • Hours played in the previous month.
  • Player level.
  • Faction they belong to.
  • Rank they have in it.

The table contains the top 15 most active players, to see the continuation of the list you must go to the following pages.

docs.title: Top players
docs.text:
Placement in the ranking is done according to the player's level

On this page you can find the following information:

  • Number in top.
  • Player name.
  • Their level.
  • Number of respect points.
  • Number of hours played on the server.
  • Faction they belong to.
  • Rank held if they are part of a faction.
  • Job the player has.
  • Number of warnings received from admins.

docs.title: Weekly referrals
docs.text:
In this category there is a paginated table that includes columns arranged according to the number of hours spent in game summed by all recruits of a player over a period of one week. Also, above the table the period in which the top is included is specified.

The table includes:

  • Player's position in top
  • Name of the player who has recruits
  • Total number of hours played by recruits
  • Total number of recruits of the player

docs.title: Top referrals
docs.text:
Here total data regarding players' recruits are displayed. The top is calculated based on the total number of experience points that a player has collected from their recruits leveling up.

The data is structured in a table using the same method as in the case of the weekly recruits top.

docs.title: Top Gold Rewards
docs.text:
In this category there is a paginated table that includes columns arranged with the first 50 players who have the most hours in the current month.

The following information is displayed in the table:

  • Player name
  • Position occupied
  • Level
  • Respect points
  • Their faction
  • Hours played in the current month

docs.title: Houses
docs.text:
This sub-page displays all available interiors on the server. Each interior contains a representative image to see what it looks like. Each interior contains the following information:

  • Interior type.
  • Interior ID.
  • How many houses exist on the server with that interior.

If you press on the number of houses with that interior existing on the server, you will be redirected to another page with the following information:

  • Player name.
  • Hours played in the current month.
  • Player level.
  • Interior description.
  • House level.
  • State price of the house.
  • Whether or not it is for sale.
    • If it is for sale, the price set by the owner in game appears.
  • Date of their last login to the server.
  • Location on map.

If you press the Map button, you will be redirected to a page with the in-game map and a red dot with its exact location.

docs.title: Vehicles
docs.text:
This sub-page also includes other sub-categories to divide the totality of vehicles into:

  • Cars
  • Motorcycles
  • Boats
  • Aircraft

The four sub-categories include all vehicles available in the Dealership, both premium and non-premium.

Each vehicle has some information about it under its own image:

  • Model name
  • Price in Dealership
  • Number of vehicles of this type owned by all server players.

If you press on the number of vehicles of a certain type owned by server players, the website will redirect you to a page containing a table with information.

The information is structured as follows:

  • Name of the owner of that type of vehicle
  • Owner's level
  • How the vehicle was purchased (real currency store or Dealership)
  • Vehicle price
  • Amount of money the player receives if selling the vehicle to Dealership.
  • Last date the player logged into the server.

docs.text:

Skin Normal

docs.text:

Illegal jobs:
