docs.title: Ban list
docs.text: This page includes each player who has been banned, as well as the reason, duration, time and admin who gave the ban.

docs.title: Tickets
docs.text:
RPG Website Ticket Section

The ticketing system has the following features:

docs.title: For players:
docs.text:
• The tickets tab will display the number of open tickets of all players
  • By accessing the tickets tab they will be able to see the tickets they have opened or participated in, and will be able to open a new ticket by clicking the Open a Support Ticket button.
  • A ticket can be opened starting with level 3 and at least 3 hours played.
  • No more than 5 tickets can be opened per day.
  • No more than 2 tickets can be open simultaneously.
  • When opening a ticket, the player will have the possibility to select a department, and depending on it, a set of rules will be displayed that they must read.
  • Inside the ticket, the player will be able to see the participants in the ticket and if admins add other participants to it.
  • The player has the possibility to close the ticket themselves if they consider they no longer need a response from admins.
  • The player will not be able to give more than 3 consecutive answers without someone else answering in the meantime, to avoid spam.

docs.title: For admins:
docs.text:
• Depending on the admin level set for a department, admins will have access to see tickets from that department.
  • Admins with access to the department can add other participants to the ticket, if it is necessary for them to be involved in it.
  • Admins with access to the department can move the ticket to another department if necessary, can close or reopen the ticket, or can use automatic responses for it.
  • Admins will be able to view certain actions performed on the ticket such as: closing, reopening, adding participant, removing participant, moving to another department.
  • Level 6 admins can create departments with different settings.
  • Level 6 admins can create automatic responses, which will help with tickets where responses are repeated.

docs.title: Updates
docs.text:
Updates spoiler example

Note

The latest updates are marked with the red flag, New.

  • The B-Zone community emphasizes organization so that players can find what they want in just a few clicks. For this reason, the RPG servers' websites have the Updates page where every change made to the website or server is noted.

  • The main page is for RPG server updates. It also includes 2 buttons to display updates made to the website or updates made to the server.

  • Every time the server or website is updated, players will receive a notification in their own accounts.

  • Updates are structured in such a way that visitors can quickly find a certain update made at a certain time.
  • Their structure consists of introducing information into well-optimized spoilers having a title according to the following model: Update date - Update version.

docs.title: External Links
docs.text: Server updates Website updates

docs.title: Wars
docs.text:
Turfs

The wars page is especially dedicated to the RPG server's mobsters. It includes several sub-categories located on the left side of the website:

Wars RPG

docs.title: Turfs
docs.text:
Here all players can view a map of the game with the mafia territories inscribed on it. The colors of the territories are updated in real time and match those displayed by the /turfs command in game.

Any mobster who holds rank 4 or higher is allowed to attack other mafias. To attack a mafia, the mobster must press on one of the territories on this page, then complete a short form for the attack to be valid. Attackers must do this as quickly as possible, because there is a maximum number of attacks in a day.

docs.title: Upcoming
docs.text:
In this sub-page there is a table that informs players about the upcoming wars that will take place. The table presents information such as:

  • Name of the territory for which the battle is held
  • Name of the attacking mafia
  • Name of the mafia defending the attacked territory
  • Time interval in which the war is held
  • A button to view the statistics of that war

docs.title: Top Gangsters
docs.text:
The page contains a table in which all gang members are structured, displaying information regarding wars:

  • Number of kills.
  • Number of deaths.
  • Number of seconds spent in total on turfs.
  • Number of wars the respective player participated in
  • Total number of points accumulated in wars.

In addition to this information, others of a general nature will also be displayed: player name, faction, level, rank in faction.

docs.title: View all
docs.text: The sub-page contains a paginated table that contains informative columns about all the wars that have already been fought. In addition to the information contained in the table from the Ongoing sub-page, the scores of both mafias involved in the war are also specified.

docs.title: Interdiction List
docs.text: This page displays all players who have received a ban in gangs. The table will also specify the date of receipt and the date of lifting the ban, among other general information.

docs.title: Interdiction Requests
docs.text:
For a player to end up on the list of those banned from wars, they must first be subjected to a vote. Gang leaders and server administrators will be able to create a new voting session, through which the ban of a certain player will be decided.

  • Within a ban request, gang leaders will vote whether they are for or against banning the respective player (leaders have 3 days to vote), taking into account the evidence presented by the complainant.
  • If at least 5 out of 9 votes are for banning, the respective player will no longer have the right to participate in wars.
  • Also, there is a comment form with which the topic can be discussed.
